title: Horrible
text: There was hair everywhere the floor the bed the showers. The pillows was rock hard I couldn’t sleep at all. I saw a rat in the bathroom under the drain. There were bed bugs and cockroaches everywhere. The breakfast was stale and undercooked no flavour at all. The servers were all grumpy and rude did not want to help me. I had to carry my own luggage to my room. I waited 3 hours for the receptionist to come to the counter. Horrible experience totally don’t recommend. There was fight too

title: They just got everything right
text:
First and really important: the location: steps from Times Square, like the CENTER of Times Square, not (like so many do) advertising Times Square but really next to Port Authority. If you're going to a Broadway Show and don't want to fight for a cab in the rain or try to find your Uber in the ocean of Ubers, this is the place. It is a 10 minute, brightly lit, sight-filled walk from every theater (and every great pre-dining restaurant) you could want to be close to. 
OR if you're dining in Midtown, going to Radio City, Rockefeller Center, shopping on Fifth Avenue? 10 minutes the other way. So the location is perfect for all things midtown east, west, and Times Square. Ideal.
Second, this place is NEW and really well-designed, so everything is up to date. The super-thick windows create an unbelievably quiet setting in the middle of everything (and I was on the third floor!) and the doors and walls are solid and safe. The bathroom fixtures are modern and sparkling, great pressure in the shower, the bed and linens are literally among of the best I've ever experienced (and I travel frequently for work). The heat/AC is quiet and easy to use (no indecipherable buttons or weird clanging). The rooms are THOUGHTFULLY structured, with a logical flow from bed to desk to closet to bathroom (and some can be expanded to accommodate families). And the appointments are great - not flashy or overdone, just really nice, understated wood and fabric tones, with lights you can actually figure out how to use! Very easy on the eyes and ears after a stimulating night on the town. 
Third, you have a wide range of in-house dining options that surprise on the upside. Quick, casual pub food - a great burger or open-faced turkey sandwich in a fun, boisterous setting? Head right downstairs to Connolly's Pub (or upstairs to the incredible roof garden!). Want something a tad nicer and quieter? Maybe a shrimp risotto or fresh carbonara? The intimate and delightful restaurant on the ground floor is wonderful. All basically under the same roof and in each, a wide selection of spirits, wines and (of course) more beers on tap than you can even imagine. And in the morning, you can enjoy a full breakfast, coffee to go, or anything in between.
Lastly, and most importantly, the staff of the Merrion Row are warm, welcoming and gracious. This is a small-family-owned hotel literally in the "middle of the middle" of the highest energy zone in the world, but the team makes you feel like you're coming in from the rain to your own quiet country home. And the family has been managing hospitality in New York City for decades; they know how - and genuinely want - to make customers feel like guests.
I live outside the city and frequently stay in town after late dinners or events. Merrion Row is now my go-to place to stay in NYC. Stay there once and it will become yours as well!

title: 10/10 hotel
text:
10/10. Great hotel with a perfect location when visiting Manhattan.
Rooms were very clean and well maintained. Breakfast is excellent and very rich. Staff is very professional and helpful. It definitely makes your stay in Manhattan better.

title: Great people and even better service
text:
Experience was outstanding, and the food? Don’t even get me started. Feels a very homey energy blocks from Time Square. 

Even hung out with the manager and bartender a bit at the early morning bar. Good people and even better business. Get the croissant breakfast sandwich 👌🏼 10/10

title: Amazing Hospitality, Wonderfully Comfortable with Great Food and Drink
text: Merrion Row Hotel and Public House is a hidden gem in the heart of Time Square. We were in town for an event on Broadway and wanted to be close without the craziness of some of the huge hotels in the area. We booked based on reviews and boy did we find an amazing place. It is truly a public house and hotel. The ground floor is the best little bar and restaurant with amazing food. With all the restaurants around us we ate three meals at the hotel because it was so good. Our rooms were quaint and wonderfully decorated with all the amenities we needed. Exceptionally clean and incredibly comfortable. As amazing as this hotel is, the staff is so much better. From the second we arrived it was all about what we needed to make our stay perfect. Everyone was so warm, welcoming, and truly interested in us. Each member of the team were enthusiastic about making our trip enjoyable. If you are looking for a wonderfully personal and comfortable stay near Broadway, you can't go wrong with the Merrion. We'll definitely be back.

title: Great hotel
text:
Impeccable value for money hotel. Without a doubt I would repeat it again if I have to return to the city
Super comfortable beds and the entire hotel is super clean, close and well connected. Perfect for city stays

title: Service
text:
A great experience, a dream come true!
I thank everyone.
Incredible
A great place to stay with family and friends!
So happy!
Impeccable service, I would like to say that you are a 100,000!
God willing I will return!!!!

title: A boutique experience within moments of Times Square madness
text: So if your vibe is massive hotel lobbies furnished with grand prices of art or installations, then avoid Merrion Row. Luckily we didn’t and experienced a rather lovely boutique hotel instead. Positioned a couple of moments from Times Square, you could be forgiven for missing the entrance but once inside you will receive warm Irish hospitality. We stayed in the room type with two double beds, both delightfully comfortable after a full day’s sightseeing. If wardrobe space is important to you, you might be disappointed and if you need a giant bathroom then perhaps look elsewhere but we’re were visiting for four nights to see Manhatten, not the inside of a hotel room. The extremely frustrating resort fee was $25…in many hotels that gives you the right to leave a bag or access the WIFI, ridiculous….at Merrion Row you had a $25 food and beverage credit instead, which we used for breakfast or evening drinks. Thank you, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

title: We will be back!
text:
This little gem checks all the boxes!
Very  comfortable, really quiet, very clean, great service, delicious breakfasts, good  location!
Perfect if you are coming to see a show and have dinner! 
Looking forward to coming back this will be our go too!

title: Amazing place. Book it now.
text:
Amazing Hotel, amazing staff & amazing value for money. My wife and I stayed for 4 nights in Feb 2024 and cannot believe how good this wee hidden gem of a hotel was. We arrived later than expected but reception was still open, the check in was smooth and easy. We also got $100 worth of vouchers to spend in the hotel.

The room, at to the back of the hotel, was small but had everything we needed. The bed was the most comfortable I've ever slept in. We got clean towels every day and the room was cleaned twice during our stay.

We had breakfast in the hotel each morning. Great choice at reasonable prices. The Irish Coffee was excellent.

The location was perfect, right next to an Irish pub & close to Times Square, Bryant Park and only 15 min walk to Central Park.

Can't miss out the wonderful staff we met during our stay. Sebastian was a star, he gave us hints and tips on places to go and things to see. Shona was always keen to find out what we had been up to and also lets us know some do's & dont's. Thank you both.

title: Perfect Stay at Small Boutique Hotel in NYC
text: My husband and I just stayed for one night at The Merrion Row Hotel and Public House in New York City. I have so many nice things to say about this small boutique hotel. The room was well appointed and very clean. I love the way the hotel was decorated. The sleeping area was small but the bathroom was big. Love the fixtures, the tiles and the bathroom amenities.  I usually don't sleep well but i did when we stayed here.  The bed was very comfortable. All the staff that we encountered were all so friendly. It was traffic on our way to NYC and got to the hotel later than planned. After checking in, we went to the Public House restaurant downstairs. It was a little past 7 pm and we told our server that we have a show to watch at 8 pm. He went to the kitchen to let them know and he said that's fine. Ordered a Lobster Bisque and Shepherd's Pie while my husband got the Petite New York Strip. The food came right away! It was the quickest dinner I've ever had but we liked the service and our compliments to the chef for the delicious food. They were so calm despite the time crunch and very accommodating. We made it in time for the 8 pm show. We were even early. It was only a 5 minute walk from Merrion Row Hotel. This is another advantage of this hotel,  the proximity to Times Square, the theaters, restaurants and to a lot of attractions in the city. Perfect location! We also had the complimentary breakfast the next day which was also good. This hotel was a welcome respite from the hustle and bustle of the city. You step inside and it's like you're not in the middle of Times Square. It's so calm and comforting inside. The friendly staff makes all the difference, too. We will be back here for sure. A place like this is rare. It checks all the boxes. Perfect location, friendly staff, very clean and comfortable rooms. You get your money's worth. I didn't get the names of the staff but thank you for an enjoyable stay. Also, they all seemed like they're happy to be there. Please keep up the good work!

title: Home away from home!
text: This is the perfect getaway, it feels like a home away from home in the center of the hustle and bustle of New York City.  Close to theater, concerts, great shopping and amazing eats (Connollys right next door).  From the minute you check in everyone around is friendly and happy,  from the staff to the guests.  We met a super nice couple visiting NY from Ireland. The room was spacious, updated and modern with a very home-like vibe. Extremely clean and comfortable. A great night sleep in a comfy bed with soft sheets and comforter.  The bathroom tiling is beautiful and the rain-shower has plenty of hot water with good water pressure. The Irish breakfast/brunch was amazing on a glass-roofed indoor patio. After staying at many hotels in NYC over the years, this is the first place we said we wouldn’t want to stay anyplace else!

title: Charming boutique hotel in the heart of Times Square 🗽. Excellent central location and immersion in Ireland 🇮🇪
text: We have just stayed 3 nights at the Merrion Row hotel and public house in New York in the heart of Times Square. The location is ideal for visiting New York and the heart of Times Square is a minute away. The hotel is run by an Irishman and all the decor is Irish themed. The bar is very cozy, the room is small but very clean and comfortable and decorated in a modern way. We were just a little inconvenienced on Saturday evening arriving with the pub just below as there was a bit of noise pollution but the other evenings it was quiet. Breakfast is delicious and served à la carte. I recommend you take it because it is quiet and the dishes are very good and homemade. This hotel is like a boutique hotel apart from the hustle and bustle of New York. The prices are fair and the cleanliness is there. I recommend for your future stay in the city that never sleeps.

title: An excellent little clean hotel with friendly staff
text: This was a really great little hotel within walking distance of many tourist attraction's. The bed was so comfortable and room was excellent. Kept spotless every day. We enjoyed a freshly cooked breakfast each morning and the staff were so chatty and friendly. Connolly’s and Perfect Pint next door are also really good for food. We will definitely be back.

title: My new favorite
text: I love trying the boutique hotels in NYC out. Merrion Row popped on my radar while planning my last trip and I decided to give it a try. It was perfect. The quiet atmosphere, well-appointed rooms, and very nice staff made our stay very enjoyable. Since the hotel is smaller, there are no crowds and very little noise to deal with. The suites were just the right size for a couple. I ate at the restaurant for breakfast each day and it was very good. As others mentioned, it is steps from everything you want to visit in midtown. A new go to!

title: Great Venue
text:
Great atmosphere with all staff having a nothing is too much trouble attitude, everyone was so friendly.Local area is sometimes very busy but all this is part of the hotels charm.
Totally enjoyed our visit and we will return soon. Highly recommended.

title: A hidden gem amidst Manhattan chaos
text:
In the age of the modern glass high rise, it’s crazy that a place like this exists in the heart of Manhattan - but I’m certainly glad it does.  I stumbled across Merrion Row while trying to find a hotel convenient to the Macy’s Thanksgiving Parade that would accommodate a member of my party who does not use elevators (often a struggle in city hotels).  Just half a block from the middle of Times Square and situated perfectly on the parade route, the location of the property is everything.  

Once inside, the level of calm on the first floor sharply contrasts all the happenings outside.  Something about it feels almost sacred - it’s like coming back to a relative’s house, rather than a hotel. The property is what you would never expect from a NYC hotel - charming, personable, and intimate.  Little touches, like playing Irish radio stations, made the property feel all the more authentic.  The first floor wasn’t quite a lobby as much as it was a pub with a desk for check-in (which we loved).  The room was quite small (think cruise stateroom size) though the size wasn’t surprising given the property’s age / location.  The bathroom was very nicely designed and almost as large as the sleeping area itself.  

Overall, customer service was good - one woman who worked the front desk was especially friendly and we adored the two guys who worked the bar (they had A+ energy and we would come back just to hang at the bar!).  We would definitely keep the property in mind for the future - Merrion Row is a place you don’t want to tell people about so the secret doesn’t get out, but it only feels fair to give the property the love it deserves.

title: Fantastic Hotel
text: My wife, son and I went to NYC for a few days over the Christmas holidays and had a fantastic stay.   The location was perfect for Times Square, Radio City, Bryant Park and all the holiday festivities.  Shona seemed to go out of her way to make us feel welcomed and comfortable during our stay.   Daniel was great in the Public House, he was there in the evening pouring pints and there in the morning making sure you received a great breakfast.  A special thanks to Jayson and the rest of the staff at Merrion House.  Please make sure that you stop by Connolly's next door.  We were in there a few times during our trip and always found the staff to be wonderful.  While we found all of the bartenders to be great, Lorraine was excellent in making a customer feel welcomed.  I highly recommend the Merrion Row Hotel and Public house and look forward to our next stay when in NYC.

title: Not What I Was Expecting
text: We booked this small, unheard of boutique hotel in the middle of the theater district at the insistence of my wife who was tired of big chain NYC hotels.  What we found was a charming, small, personal hotel in a great location. It was impeccably appointed and had very friendly staff.  On the down side, the rooms were small and there was no room service.  There is a charming restaurant on the main floor.  Will definitely keep this as our midtown, go-to stay!

title: Magical stay!
text:
Our stay at the Merrion Row was the best small boutique experience in New York. 
Super clean with many unexpected amenities. The staff was friendly and welcoming while being superbly professional. High marks for the Pub Burger and fries as well!

title: December 2023 Christmas Trip
text: Great location and the room and bathroom were clean. Staff were very nice and courteous. We arrived early and left late and they held our luggage each day for us. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks.

title: Quiet and like family.
text:
The room was small but clean.  The best part was the quietness of the room, even with being in the heart of NYC. Close to theatres, subway, shopping. 
The food and drinks were excellent.  Shona seemed to be there nearly every moment we were in a common area and she was so friendly and helpful. Made us feel like we were welcome and family! Food in the pub and restaurant was excellent. Lots of beers on tap.

title: I Will Stay Here Again While In NY.
text:
Answer to the only important question. Would I stay here again. YES. Room was small, Clean, location is excellent.
I can’t say enough for the superior staff.  The restaurant and bar are excellent.  YES I Will STAY HERE WHEN GOING TO NEW YORK. WALK TO ALL BROADWAY SHOWES. A Thank You To The Staff.

title: Small town atmosphere with big city activities.
text: If you enjoy staying in B & B’s, this hotel is perfect for you.  Located steps away from Times Square, this small, nicely renovated hotel offers all the amenities of larger places.  The owners have infused their Irish heritage into the atmosphere.  They are truly determined to make your stay memorable.  Outstanding service from the general manager, Shona McEl, along with wait staff, Demi and Sebastian, completed our fantastic experience.  We have found our home away from home.

title: Fun experience
text: Very quaint find in the heart of the city.  Walking distance to the major attractions in NYC.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  We loved the local feel as opposed to a modern hotel chain.  We would stay again

title: Sanctuary in the city!
text: This place is fantastic! Clean, updated, quiet, and friendly! It's a sanctuary in the hustle and bustle of Times Square! The staff are warm, friendly and so helpful! Irish hospitality at its best! The rooms are simple, but have what you need, and most importantly, are clean and well kept. This may not be the hotel for 'views' but if you want a quiet place to retreat to after a full day - this is it! Great location, too! We highly recommend as we will certainly return!

title: Hidden Gem
text:
This boutique hotel is incredibly chic, tastefully decorated to the smallest detail. The staff are out of this world kind and efficient. The restaurant/bar on premise offers an awesome menu throughout the day. It is centrally located and you can practically walk everywhere!!                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           
                                                                                                                                                                              .
I never write reviews, but this hotel really deserves to be discovered! you would be glad you did 😊
This is will I will be staying next time 'm in NY!!

title: Perfect in every way!
text:
The location was perfect - near Time Square and close to our off Broadway theater.
The staff was professional, helpful and friendly.  The room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable.  The breakfasts were wonderful and the waiters went out of their way to accommodate all of our needs.  We would never stay anywhere else for
our future trips to the Big Apple.

title: NYC Marathon - A slice of Irish hospitality in the city that never sleeps
text:
I recently stayed at the Merrion Row Hotel for the NYC Marathon and had a fantastic experience from start to finish. The owners and incredibly friendly staff make you feel right at home with their top-notch hospitality and service.

My room was spotless, tastefully decorated, and very comfortable. I appreciated the quietness of the room - it was a relaxing oasis from the energetic city outside. 

The hotel's central Midtown East location proved perfect for accessing all the major sights in NYC, such as Times Square, Avenue Shopping and Central Park. It's just steps from the subway which made navigating the city a breeze. Travelling alone I felt very safe and secure, also having such great local knowledge made my stay there that much more enjoyable. 

A standout was the mouthwatering breakfast, lunch and dinner. The chef uses fresh, local ingredients to create a delicious menu - the Irish staples are excellent and always enjoyed!

I also valued how the staff and the hotel owners, Anne and Bernie both went out of their way to ensure my stay was perfect. They made my entire Marathon experience that much more fun and enjoyable. Their attention to detail is unparalleled.

For an outstanding NYC stay with genuinely five-star hospitality, I can't recommend the Merrion Row Hotel enough. It's now my only choice when I visit New York.

title: localisation parfaite
text:
Esprit boutique-hôtel style irlandais. Petite structure. 4 chambres par étage. Pas de lobby.
Localisation: à quelques pas de Times Square, à proximité immédiate de la 5° avenue. Métros à proximité. PARFAIT.
Chambre: taille correcte pour NYC. Literie confortable. Belle salle de bains. Wifi sans problème. Ménage quotidien. Chambre très propre. 
Deux remarques: manque une machine à café dans la chambre, eau chaude capricieuse dans la douche.
Calme absolu la nuit !
Check in et out très facile.
25 dollars de voucher quotidien pour breakfast, lunch ou diner au restaurant de l'hôtel.
Nombreux restaurants à proximité.
Un excellent endroit pour séjourner à Manhattan.

title: Cute and cozy!
text: Great location! Super cute and clean. Staff was friendly and welcoming. We were given a $25 daily voucher to use at the restaurant. Bar and breakfast were great. Our room was a little smaller than I expected, but it’s New York! I would stay there again!

title: Little gem in Manhattan
text: We had a two night stopover in The Merrion Row and what a wonderful experience it was. Located in the heart of the city this hotel has a lot to offer. It literally is a few steps from Time Square though when inside you wouldn’t believe this was the case. The staff led by Shona and backed up by Daniel, Sebastian, Dean and Felicity amongst others you get a proper welcome and looking after. The food with the odd Irish touch here and there is wonderful and I would throughly recommend this little gem in Manhattan. B and B Derry

title: Perfect Location & Great Staff!!
text:
Excellent Hotel. 
Room was clean and bathroom spacious. 
Staff were very friendly and made guests feel welcome. We often had a night cap in the bar and staff were chatty and interested. 
Breakfast was also good.
Location perfect- if Time Square is your thing it is minutes away. If like me it’s a return visit then Central Park also a short walk away. Subway is close and easy to navigate.

title: Fantastic perfect hotel!
text: We visited for a 2 night stay and this turned out to be the perfect choice! Fantastic staff!!  Our room was spotless and so clean  and the beds turned out to be very comfortable. The food at the restaurant within the hotel was outstanding too. Location is key. It was within walking distance to many areas and  our room was absolutely silent. You wouldn’t even know Times Square was right around the corner. Very welcoming atmosphere. Highly recommend this hotel. We will always stay here for any trip to NYC!!

title: Little oasis in the middle of Manhattan
text:
When we arrived at the hotel after a combined 19 hour long flight we found the check in process at the hotel super efficient. The room was super quiet, the bed was very comfortable and the blackout curtains worked a treat. We stayed in the king deluxe so we had more room with our luggage. A smaller room would be just as nice but a bit cramped. The bathroom was nice and spacious and overall the room was very clean.
We took advantage of the breakfast hotel which was fantastic. Really good options. The staff were very friendly. The breakfast venue was a little oasis on the ground level at the back of the hotel which was perfect before we started a big day exploring New York. (They not only serve breakfast but dinner and lunch as well and drinks). We didn't feel like a number at this hotel but a welcomed guest. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect! Home Away From Home...
text:
When coming to NYC, we have vowed to always and only stay at the Merrion Row Hotel and Public House! This weekend, we traveled from Ohio to celebrate my wife"s birthday and see some shows. From the moment we stepped through the door into Merrion Row Hotel, we left the hustle bustle of an exhausting travel day behind us - all to be greeted warmly by the hotel staff.  They really do make you feel like family!  Once inside, we felt the happy embrace of the most hospitable and peaceful hotel establishment you could possibly hope for anywhere in Manhattan.  

The hotel is superbly convenient to attend all the theaters, shops and activities in and around Times Square and Broadway. We walked everywhere! And after the wild meandering through Times Square crowds and traffic, it felt great to 'come home' to Merrion Row. 

Through the years, we have stayed at other boutique hotels in cities around the country. Often 'boutique'  can imply cramped and stuffy. Nothing stuffy at Merrion Row! It is simply perfect in room design - and we felt comfortable and relaxed in the single queen room we selected. The design of our room was serene, efficient and beautiful.  Downstairs, the hotel  staff is like the surroundings - friendly, down-to-earth, cheerful and eager to make sure guests are comfortable. In the bar/dining area, the food is tasty and the dining experience is excellent. The outer dining area is light filled and lovely thanks to the glass enclosed atrium. It is the perfect spot to enjoy a morning coffee or evening wine - or even your first shot of Irish Whiskey! We enjoyed several yummy breakfast choices throughout our stay. Plus you can also immerse yourself in a menu of Irish fare at Connolly's - the connecting Irish pub next door that offers a robust Irish/American menu. 
Merrion Row Hotel has become our second home whenever we come to take in the sites, sounds and experiences of NYC. We can't wait to return.

title: Great location, comfort and restaurant
text:
Cosy and calm little hotel perfectly located close to Times Square. Nice and very clean room with a highly comfortable bed.
We can also recommend the restaurant/bar for both breakfast and dinner. Lastly, we want to outline the super friendly and attentive staff!

title: Let's not get carried away
text: It's possibly a 4 for NYC from a quality standpoint but I am just reacting to the rave reviews and want to bring everyone back to reality. The big plus is that it is relatively quiet for a Times Square location (although it's only 6 floors so you get full HVAC exposure). The room is ok, pretty small but acceptable, nothing fancy. The 3 stars come from the price tag ($850/night with about one month advance booking) and cold reception, one guy on a stool tucked between a staircase and a laptop barely saying hi (I think the only thing he said is " I need your credit card and ID"). There is zero soul there, bar was empty, no lobby, nobody greeting you, a corridor, a grumpy guy at the "reception" and an old elevator to get you to your room. This was a test, was trying to escape the big hotels nearby and have a boutique experience but for $850, this just does not cut it. For the records I come to NYC twice a month.

title: Practically perfect!
text:
Lovely place! The hotel is situated in the middle of everything. The room was clean and comfortable. The staff was really, really great! There is a bar/restaurant in the lobby with good food, excellent drinks, and attentive staff. There was also a fun bar next door, where we watched some of the Open matches.

Our room was in the back, so it was nice and quiet. Considering the location, that was remarkable. We would definitely stay again, and recommend!

title: Can’t beat the location!
text: We loved our stay at Merrion! The location cannot be beat - 2 minute to Times Square, 5 minute to Bryant Park - super easy subway access. The street was always busy, but the hotel was incredibly quiet and the staff was exceptionally helpful. We had one little issue and they went above and beyond to take care of us. Plus the bed was great! We will definitely stay here again!

title: A true gem in the heart of the theater district
text: A true gem of a hotel in the theater district. Such character built into every detail. The restaurant is charming, especially the conservatory spot for breakfast and coffee. Comfortable beds and lovely texture and decor. A new favorite! The staff is young and energetic and eager to please.

title: Has gone waaay downhill
text: We've stayed here before and LOVED it. This time around we were SO disappointed! It's an adorable hotel, near all the action in NYC but it has definitely seen better days. I don't know what happened! There was hardly ever any staff around. No one to help with bags. The couple people that WERE there were friendly however, especially the sole waiter in the restaurant. The biggest problem was that the towels were completely shredded, dirty looking and had holes...they looked more like someone's old cleaning rags, AND there was a big gross stain on our fitted sheet...looked like...well, I don't want to say. Vey disappointing. Used to be a lovely little place.

title: Wonderful place to stay in Manhattan staffed with wonderful people.
text:
We were in New York for a few days on our way back to California from Lisbon. My wife set us up for three nights at the Merrion Row, and it turned out to be a great place to stay. 

Plusses: There were many of these. The location is great, right off of Times Square. (And despite this, the place was dead quiet.) The bed was very comfy with nice pillows and bedding. The bathroom was a good size with a luxurious shower. Wifi connection was good - my wife did a Zoom webinar from the room. The hotel has a bar and restaurant onsite, and these are both good establishments. We had breakfast every morning in the restaurant and the quality of the food was high. There's an Irish theme, so they offer Irish brown bread, Irish bacon, and a couple of other items along those lines. Everything we had was excellent. The bar was great as well, with some very nice cocktails available. What really set this place apart, though, was the service. Everyone we encountered, from the night clerk to the manager to the waitstaff were very friendly and willing to go out of their way to help. Special shout out to Sebastian in the restaurant. Really a nice guy and a solid pro. 

Minuses: Nothing to speak of. The room was small and mostly taken up by the bed and desk, but that's par for the course for Manhattan hotels that don't cost $1000+ a night. 

Summary: Great location, good value, quiet comfy room, good bar/restaurant, first-rate service. We will be back.

Mike sez check it out!

title: Quiet hotel near theaters and Times Square
text:
The Merrion Row Hotel is a small hotel on W 45th very convenient for Broadway and Times Square while tucked away on a side street. It's perfect for those who prefer the more intimate feel of a boutique hotel over some of NYC's colossal chains. Our room was small but comfortable with what seemed to be a newly redone bathroom. All very lovely. 

We also enjoyed a very good breakfast and delicious cocktails during happy hour, all served by very friendly staff.

One negative was that the room had only one small window that fronted an interior courtyard so there was virtually no natural light and as a result it felt rather confining. I would not have wanted to stay there for more than a weekend. Upgrades were not available during our stay, but I was told that there are rooms with exterior windows. And a small point-the towels did not live up to the promise of the beautifully decorated bathroom as they were rather flimsy.

Overall, I would rate the hotel a 4.5 - great location; quiet; lovely rooms; delicious food and drink; friendly staff; only lost 0.5 due to lack of light.

title: Un séjour parfait !
text: Charmant petit hôtel idéalement situé , proche de Times square , Bryant Park et 5h avenue mais très calme , où vous serez chaleureusement accueilli par un personnel aux petits soins ! Les chambres sont très confortables , et très accueillantes avec une décoration soignée . la literie très confortable et la propreté est exemplaire . Le Petit déjeuner est varié et très copieux . Nous recommandons vivement cette adresse !!

title: Mother daughter trip
text: The hotel was beautiful, clean, quaint, and all around perfect! Beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were beautiful. The staff went above and beyond. They were friendly and kind. Everything was wonderful, highly recommend!

title: Great location, great place, less than great staff.
text: Great location and classy-looking hotel. Very high-end decor and good breakfast in the restaurant. You get a $25 credit towards restaurant at check-in, which is nice. Front desk staff was very cold and unfriendly at check-in though. Not a welcoming vibe, not even a smile. Otherwise, good experience.

title: Great location
text: Quieter than expected given proximity to Times Square. Small but functional room. Decent food. I would definitely recommend anyone from the UK or Ireland stays here - feels like a home away from home.

title: Clean & Convenient
text: Merrion is a two minute walk to Times Square.  Connolly's & Perfect Pint are colocated and offer great food/beverage options.  Staff was friendly and room was clean.  Be aware of the $25/day "urban fee".

title: A lovely small hotel in the heart of NYC
text: Quiet hotel near Times Square and theaters. Room was spacious for NYC and very clean with comfortable beds and an updated bathroom. Staff were accommodating and we enjoyed several discounted meals at the hotel’s restaurant. I look forward to staying at the Merrion Row again.

title: Friendly Staff and Great Location
text: The location was absolutely perfect, so if you're coming to NYC for a show or just to explore times square/midtown this is a great option. The staff was very nice and easy to deal with. Overall a great experience.

title: Fabulous boutique hotel!!
text: A hidden gem!! This great boutique hotel is tucked into 45th St, a quick walk from Times Square and several theaters. The staff is so welcoming and inviting. The building is newly updated, fresh, and clean. Our room was modern with two queen beds (a rarity in NYC!!) and an updated bath (complete with rainfall shower head, what a luxury). The entire hotel is quiet, you can't tell you're two quick blocks from Times Square. The bar and restaurant are cute, with an excellent Happy Hour, cocktail menu, and extensive selection of liquor. Bartenders were so friendly! There are also late night options right next door at the Irish Pub. Management was so friendly and welcoming. This was just such an excellent experience, it really just added a cherry to an amazing NY trip. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Merrion Row Hotel and Public House made my stay PERFECT!
text:
First time staying in New York City and my stay at the Merrion Row and Public House was excellent. The room exceeded my expectations and the hotel provided a lot of great amenities; including wifi, a tv with screencast capability, and great accommodations for food/drinks. Food and drinks in the hotel were amazing! We also ventured two doors over to the Perfect Pint rooftop for dinner, absolutely incredible view and great service!
I would definitely recommend trying the Irish coffee at least once during your stay!

title: Amazing stay at this hidden gem in the heart of Manhattan
text: It was an unexpected surprise: beautifully decorated with spacious room and large operating windows. We stayed for two nights in the King Room overlooking the courtyard. Bed and pillows were very comfortable. Staff was absolutely amazing and very accommodating. Restaurant at the hotel was great and location is perfect for theatre lovers. We will definitely be staying there again.

title: Perfect for short business trips
text: Merrion Row is the perfect home away from home when traveling for business. I popped into NYC for a day of media and the location was perfect. It’s a short Uber or transit ride from Penn Station and close to all of the news companies. My room was a perfect size and everything was nice and clean. Linens were fresh and plentiful and the staff were kind and helpful throughout. If you’ve got a busy schedule and haven’t the time to go out for food, the Public House has a diversified menu of for all times of day and the coffee is strong! The rooms block out the noise from Times Square which is a huge plus. I’m looking forward to returning the next time I’m here for work!

title: Clean and quiet near all the action
text: Excellent Location near Time Square.  Local bar restaurant options next door.  Hotel was very clean and had nice quiet vibe after a busy day of sight seeing and crowds.  Breakfast was great all week too.

title: A Calm Oasis in Times Square
text:
My wife and I traveled to NYC for a long weekend to see a couple of plays, visit the MET and generally just enjoy the city.  Our stay at Merrion Row Hotel and Public House was fantastic.  The hotel is less than a block from the action of Times Square, but it is a clam and quiet oasis.  Flanked by an Irish Pub on one side and a deli/convenience store on the other, the hotel has a sort of classy, relaxing & quiet vibe all its own.  
Our room was a King Suite, and unlike most rooms in Manhattan, it did not feel small, and was very well appointed.  The bed was extremely comfortable, and the rainfall shower was very pleasant.  We were located on the side of the hotel facing away from 45th Street and it was very quiet.  We had requested a room with a mini fridge and it was there when we checked in.
The staff at Merrion Row are amazing!  Shona, the manager, is very kind and we loved speaking with her about Ireland.  Bernie, the owner, has great stories about growing up in Ireland and is also responsible for much of the great photography that adorns the walls of the Lobby and Public House areas, and the guest rooms also.  Their kind, friendly and generous spirit carries over to the rest of the staff as well.  They are both great examples of Irish hospitality!
The servers in the Public House/Restaurant are very friendly and accommodating, Felicity, in particular, was very helpful!  The food is also very good, and quite reasonable, with generous portions.  The breakfasts are great, with very good locally roasted coffee and plenty of tea options.  We had one dinner there and the fish & chips were delicious as was the lamb burger!  They also have the best Guinness this side of Dublin and it was properly poured and served.
All in all, my wife and I look forward to another visit and highly recommend Merrion Row.  (And Shona, we hope you had a good visit back to Derry!)

title: Very Enjoyable Stay
text:
My family and I had a  recent stay in Merrion Row hotel. It is so well located just off Times Square, we had inter-connecting rooms for my children which was very accommodating   Really comfortable bedrooms, immaculately clean & the softest pillows!  The staff were most welcoming & we enjoyed a tasty breakfast on both mornings in the airy dining room.  Our waiter Sebastian each morning was very entertaining.  
Great selection of craft beers in the bar and we enjoyed an excellent Guinness.  
We highly recommend a stay in the Merrion Row Hotel.

title: Wonderful, clean rooms, safe local, brilliant location. Book Today!
text: Lovely boutiquish hotel with great theatre location. Rooms were small as expected but super clean and had everything you need. Bathroom was clean and spacious with wonderful products and a rain shower (love that.) Shona and the staff were SUPER friendly and helpful. Their lovely pub/restaurant has back section that opens to the sky with natural lighting. The food was hot, came fast, and yummy. We stayed on the third floor, so took the stairs easily. We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend if you want a room just off the heart of Times Square. My only request would be that they do some fine tuning on the freely provided Wi-Fi. The service was a bit spotty from our room 304. The first night, it would not work at all. The second night, I needed to make a phone call when we dropped by the room to refresh for the evening, it was around 4 PM. Could not get it to work again. That evening, it seemed to work fine. As it did the next morning. Not sure what the problem was, but spotty Wi-Fi can be annoying these days. Overall though, don’t let that deter you from booking a room there.

title: Best little hidden gem in Manhattan!!
text: The restaurant was magnificent!! My husband had the scallop risotto with spinich & it was delicious, scallops were melt in your mouth!  I had the rack of lamb with roasted potatoes and broccolini which was amazing!! The Mediterranean salad was fresh and fulll of delicious olives and feta cheese, which my husband and I shared. We also shared the Carmel truffle cheesecake which was also a culinary delight!! Our server & bartender, Daniel, was so pleasant, efficient and made the best Negroni I ever had!

title: Great place!
text: Everything about this hotel was awesome! Customer service, Food, staff, rooms (small but clean and nicely set up). I will go back again and highly recommend this establishment for both the hotel and restaurant!

title: Time Square Hidden Gem
text:
Merrion Row is Located right in the heart of Time Square. The hospitality was exceptional from the time of arrival till departure. The property is immaculately kept. My room was spacious and super comfortable. 
There was no expense spared upon linen,pillows and mattress you can be sure of  a very comfortable nights sleep. Restaurant downstairs was as delicious as it was inviting. Very creative menu. Wine and cocktail list fully on point as was the various craft beer selections from many parts of the world. 
I just rebooked for early September. 
Looking forward to my next visit so much.

title: New York vibe with an Irish Twist - A fabulous experience
text: We were over the moon with this hidden gem of a classy hotel right next to Times Square - what a find!  Super-friendly staff, comfy high class and very quiet room, superb food ... a New York vibe with an Irish twist.  Bernie the owner made us feel particularly welcome as did his wonderful staff. Bang in the middle of Manhatten, the theater district and all the intense vibes that the city has to offer -  it's a 10 min walk to the Empire State Building or a 10 min walk to Central Park.  We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would 100% stay there on our next visit to NYC. (Hint: Book directly with the Hotel - don't book via Booking.com as we did as it was a thoroughly confusing exercise).

title: A Great Little Hotel
text: A great little hotel in a prime location. My room was immaculate. The bed is comfortable and the rooms is very quiet. The staff is friendly and helpful. Their breakfast is wonderful too. I highly recommend their delicious roasted potatoes.

title: 2 night stay, excellent place!
text:
Clean, fresh and beautiful room. 1 Queen Bed was extremely comfortable, amazing pillows. 
Bathroom was spotless, great shower. Perfect location if you’re in town for Broadway Show. Excellent stay, will visit Merrion Row again.

title: Excellent clean boutique hotel
text:
Excellent small boutique hotel.  Very,  very clean.  Excellent kitchen and bar. 

Very quiet and clean room given the location in Times Square. 

The staff are very nice and personal.   Highest rating,  and ready to come back and take in several shows in NYC.

title: Absolutely Perfect!
text:
Absolutely the kindest group of people you’ll ever come across.  From Shona to Dominic … no matter who I came in contact with, they were all helpful and kind…friendly even.  

Breakfast was delicious- the best avocado toast!  (I know what you’re thinking… but yeah, avocado toast!).  During breakfast, a child of maybe 7 was running around (not a fan of the mother for allowing this) however Dominic was patient and spoke to the child…. Even offered a tour of the place if the child sat down and ate his breakfast.  Then Shona came and spoke to the child with the same kindness.  I can appreciate that even if I didn’t appreciate that the mother felt it was okay to let her son run wild.  (For all the parents out there… she’s wrong, it’s not okay to allow this).

Location Location Location!  Yes! Everything within walking distance.  And a great Irish pub connected for the most part- I’ll review that place too!

Finally, the rooms.  The place is built like every other old place with charm-  boutique, charming and small.  Bathrooms are large and well appointed-  loved the water fall shower head!  I’m doing a remodel on my bathroom and had already ordered one… now I know it’s a great choice!  Bed is comfy and so are the pillows- granted I always bring my own, for once, I didn’t have to.  The best part about my room was upon arrival, I opened up the door and immediately was at the bed.  It took some shuffling of luggage and door to get in, however I thought I would look out the window.  Opened it up and it looked out upon - small inner square brick area… however my window also was close enough to see the window seats at the bar.  I was immediately waved at-  and made friends! LOL. I love that kinda stuff and can appreciate it.  Small, quaint, and friendly place.  How much time do you actually spend in the room after all.  The bathroom is large enough to make up for it.  

Will stay here again for sure!!  Don’t miss out on this gem!

title: Excellent stay at Merrion Row hotel
text: Great location just off Time Square. Best hotel we have stayed in whilst visiting New York. We stayed in a Studio King room which included a sofa and was very spacious.  The decor and bathroom were high end.  The bed was very comfy and the room very clean.    Staff were very friendly and couldn’t do enough.  We had breakfast and 1 dinner in the on-site restaurant. Food was excellent and good value. We can’t wait to return.

title: Amazing Hotel with amazing staff! Highly recommend
text:
This hotel is AMAZING!  We decided to stay after reading other great reviews but this place was even better than I imagined. WONDERFUL BARTENDERS AND MANAGEMENT STAFF.  (Sebastian, Felicity, & Shauna)
Beds were also amazing- the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. 
Whole establishment was very clean and decorated wonderfully as well. 
Will be returning for sure next time we are in NYC. 10/10 great job!

title: Excellent hotel very close to Times Square
text:
Excellent hotel in New York. I stayed for a full week and would definitely recommend. 
The location is excellent as it is very close to Times Square. 
Rooms very were very clean and modern.
Brilliant food (especially the Irish breakfast), drinks and bar area.
Staff were really helpful and friendly. Sebastian's latte's were a particular highlight.
Would definitely stay again.

title: Merrion Row Hotel New York
text: Fantastic stay with superb service from Shona, Sebastian and all the staff. We couldn't have asked for more and would recommend a stay at anytime. Room, food and facilities all first class and convienent location  to any sites u want to go visit  👏👏👏💚💚💚

title: Fabulous boutique hotel
text: What an amazing place.  Stayed in The deluxe King suite with my 3 older teenagers. Was room enough for all of us. Amenities were fabulous. Air con, large TV, WiFi etc.  Staff were friendly & helpful. Location was fantastic, just up the road from Times  Square & couldn't hear any noise at night. Hotel was clean, trendy & food was great.  Housekeeping came daily too.  Lovely homely feel. Will definitely stay here again. 10 out of 10

title: Very nice staff but slightly lacking.
text: I tried Merrion Row for the first time. The staff were very nice. I was upgraded to a bigger king room. So that was nice. The location in midtown is convenient for getting around. However, the street the hotel is on (45th between 6th and 7th Ave.) is pretty nondescript and there is no view to speak of. Also there is a lot of construction going on around there at the moment. The facade of the hotel was covered in scaffolding as well. Obviously this is not the hotel's fault, but still.  When I  arrived in my room I saw that the area around the sink had not been cleaned properly as there was toothpaste in the shape of a toothbrush around the sink (yeah, first world problems I know). This put me off a bit because it indicates that the cleaning has not been very thorough. When I asked a cleaner to come up and clean the bathroom sink he just wiped it with some water and did not even use any cleaning fluid. If you are paying $450 to $500 a night you expect that the room will have been cleaned properly before you get there. Other than that, the room was clean. Bathroom was nice but water pressure was nothing to write home about. The bed was comfortable but the bed had 4 pillows which were all really thick, had no give and were uncomfortable. When I asked if they had any soft pillows for the second night they said "oh you want down pillows, of course" I am not not sure why they don't just put them in the room to begin with! This hotel is small and does not have a classic sized lobby. So if you are looking for a traditional large hotel with a big lobby this is probably not for you. The rooms are on the smaller size, even for NYC. Also the hotel is only 4 stories tall so you cannot get a high floor and escape the street noise. There is a lot of construction going on in the area at the moment and I was woken up by the sounds of generators and trucks with reverse alarms very early. Also, the walls are very very thin and you can hear everything in the next door rooms and the corridor outside the room. So when my neighbors stumbled in at 3AM I had to listen to them for the next 45 minutes. It was like I was sharing a room with them. Overall it was fine but I was not blown away, and the main problem was not getting decent sleep either night because of the thin walls. If you are traveling single or a couple it may be fine. A bit small for a family.

title: Book your next NYC stay here! You will not regret it!
text: Wonderful stay and experience! We loved our time at the Merrion Row Hotel and Public House. You are only a half a block from Times Square, however, the hotel is a warm and welcoming refuge from the hustle and bustle. It was so calm and quiet in our room which was much needed for me and my tween/teen girls after a busy day on Broadway. The staff was kind and helpful. The Public House was a fantastic restaurant and bar the served great breakfast to start the day and wonderful dinner before our next Broadway show. They also booked us a taxi back to the hotel. I have been to the city many times and this is one of my favorite places to stay to date. Book this place and you will not regret it.

title: A five star stay at the Merrion Row Hotel
text: Our stay at the Merrion Row was amazing. This boutique hotel caters for all your needs from location to a great nights sleep in an amazing comfortable bed. Staff were so welcoming from Bernie the hotel owner to Shona the hotel manager, to Seb, Dean, Shane, Nelson, Dickson & the lovely ladies at the front desk. We felt at home, we felt safe and no query was too big or small. The food was amazing, so much so that we had all our meals at the hotel. From its central location we never heard a sound from the city at night. A combination of all the  above made our experience memorable. We look forward to our return in the future. To all the staff we would like to say thank you and well done - we were spoiled! Kindest regards, Ger & Joan Power

title: Merrion Row provides!
text: Awesome staff that were very accommodating from the bar to the cleaning staff. The rooms were spacious, the bathroom had good water pressure, comfortable beds and pretty aesthetics. The breakfast and cocktails were a nice bonus

title: Our New Home Away From Home while in NYC
text: We just loved it here and will stay again for our April  stay in NYC.  We actually had dinner reservations elsewhere and immediately canceled them when we saw the hotel and dining space and stayed put to enjoy a wonderful dinner.  The rooms are well decorated and well appointed. The staff was so warm and welcoming.  The manager Shona was a joy to chat with and we hope to see her again on the next visit.

title: Birthday getaway
text:
We enjoyed a terrific stay for my husband’s birthday.  The hotel atmosphere was warm and inviting.  A hidden retreat in midtown close to theater and museums.
We enjoyed chatting with the friendly staff while taking part in good food and drink.  We will definitely return.

title: Wonderful!
text: Our family stayed at the Merrion Row Hotel over February break and we wholeheartedly recommend this hotel without reservation. The location was close by to many of Manhattan’s attractions as well as both clean and comfortable; we enjoyed our time there. The restaurant was also an absolute delight!  Breakfast under the glass atrium was pleasant and the food and drinks were top notch. Do yourself a favor and stay or grab a bite to eat at this lovely slice of Ireland on Manhattan!

title: The best place in midtown
text: I love the location- convenient to everything but feels miles away from the madness of midtown. The details feel very old world Europe, but the beds are clean, modern and ridiculously comfortable. And the breakfast: amazing!!! Can’t wait to return.

title: Fantastic family friendly hotel close to everything
text: Nice little hotel really close to everything.staff were so friendly felt like staying with family. The hotel was spotless clean rooms and beds made and cleaned every day. Breakfast menu had plenty of choices and was all cooked fresh to order. We couldn’t fault anything with our stay. They even put champagne and chocolate in are room for our anniversary really nice touch.

title: Fantastic hotel in central location.
text: I had a fantastic stay for just one night while in NY for business. Everything from check-in to check out was perfect. The room was clean, fresh, well maintained and had the amenities I could have asked for. Shout out to the friendly staff and Shona in particular. I look forward to staying again soon!

title: Just Great
text: Great rooms, great people, great food, great service. Super happy. This will be my new home away from home in NY. The hotel is quiet, beds are comfortable, clean rooms. It is still possible to have a room at an affordable price in NY. Thanks.

title: Très bon séjour à l'hôtel
text:
Bel hôtel
Super bien situé
Notre chambre était trop bruyante du à la mauvaise isolation de la fênêtre et Mélissa a tout de suite accepté de nous changer de chambre, sans discuter ( on a même été upgradé pour le coup :-)) 
Personnel charmant 
Petit déjeuner assez cher mais comme partout à NY je pense, on reçoit un bon de 25 dollars par nuit à dépenser , pour info, cela ne suffit pas pour déjeuner à deux. 
Bref nous recommandons cet hôtel

title: BEST HOTEL IN NYC
text:
This is our 2nd visit to Merrion Row and this hotel is FABULOUS.  The rooms are clean,  super cute decor, wonderfully comfortable beds, large bathroom and very nice size for a boutique hotel in NYC. The service is EXCEPTIONAL from every team member  including Sebastián who served breakfast 2 days in a row,  Melissa at the check in desk  who was so accommodating with a special request and the General Manager Shawwna who was so friendly.   The bartender was also so friendly  and made us laugh with tales of being an Irishman in the USA. The place feels like staying overnight at your best friends house, where you feel so welcome and comfortable.   Highly recommend this hotel. This darling hotel sets the bar high for all other boutique hotels and will be the only place we stay in NYC.

Book a room today . You will thank me later! And location is fabulous ♡

title: Great location but average hotel.
text:
Location is great however it’s a very average hotel. Small rooms with very basic standard. With the same high price you can enjoy better quality stay in nearby better hotels.
Additional fees should be paid at the hotel (even though, it was mentioned: no fees to be paid at the hotel when we booked) …

title: Best hotel I've ever stayed at!!!
text: The ambiance of this place is really something! It's soo cute inside. Smells amazing. The staff? Amazing people & entirely too kind. (Meeting kind staff in NYC is rare). The food in the restaurant 10/10. The room is so so clean, never seen a hotel room like it lol. You always seen to find some little flaw in a hotel room but this one had NONE. Love that. I'd definitely stay here again & again. Cheers to Shona, Sebastian & Demi!!

title: Very Rude General Manager; tiny loud room
text: The rudeness and lack of customer service of General Manager Pedro makes this hotel a definite place to avoid.  I saw positive reviews online for this hotel and based on the photos online and the positive reviews decided to reserve a room here.  The day before I arrived I phoned the hotel and told the staff that I needed to prepare for a meeting the following day so I would like a quiet room where I could work.  I was told that a room in the back of the hotel on the 6th floor (top floor) would be set aside for me.  When I arrived around 1:00 I was told that such a room in the back was unavailable but that if I waited for a couple of hours and came back after 3, I could get a room on the 6th floor.  So I walked around for a couple of hours and came back at which time a very rude man at the desk who said his name was Pedro told me that he had given someone else the last room on the sixth floor and there were no rooms in my category in the back of the hotel so he was putting me in a middle room towards the front on another floor.  When I complained, he suggested that I was lying when I told him that someone at the hotel promised me a room in the back on 6.  He asked for the name of the employee that I had spoken with.  I said I didn't know.  I told him that I was very disappointed as I had been promised a quiet room because of my need to work.  He suggested that he didn't care and that the policy of this hotel was that no specific rooms are reserved in advance.  He said if I paid another $200 he would find me a back room!  I asked his name and he said it was Pedro.  I said that I would report his rudeness and that this was not the behavior of a hotel that cares about its guests and hospitality.  He repeated that he didn't care.  He never apologized.  He then said that he was the General Manager and there was no one to report him to.  Shocked at his brazen rudeness, I told him I would make my experience known on the internet.  He said he didn't care, I should go ahead and do so.  If you want a positive hotel experience, skip this hotel.  Any hotel can have a single rogue employee, but making such a rude and unfriendly individual your general manager speaks volumes about this hotel--  Not to mention that the expensive room I was given was so small that it couldn't fit a desk or chair or closet!  I had to sit on the side of the bed to try to prepare for my meeting with street noise in the background! There are lots of hotels in New York,  avoid this one.

title: What a horrible MOTEL - So disappointed Please GO somewhere else!
text: Firstly I entered the hotel with bags after traveling for 4 weeks - no porter or help - The reception lady was too busy watching a movie on her IPad to give me proper attention! The room was the size of a matchbox and you could hear every sound and noise in the passages - I was woken up at 3am to some screeching …. There was no cleaning service after having to ask and couldn’t get the hot water to work! On leaving no one helped with bags - was told buy in checking out and had complaints ignored by the Manager! Asked if there was a bill and there was one…just received it now! I have stayed in 5 hotels in NYC at his past month and this was a secretly hidden well marketed DUMP! Shame on you!

title: Friendly and clean hotel
text: Clean and well kept hotel/restaurant with very friendly staff. The location was great for us and provided walkable access to just about everything. It was also so nice to be able to go right down stairs for a good cup of coffee in the morning. I appreciated the water bottles left in our room each day and was very impressed with the size of the bathroom in our queen room. Only reason I couldn’t give 5 stars was because the air conditioning in our room was a bit spotty. Overall it was a great experience and I would recommend staying here!

title: Great time seeing in the new year.
text: We stayed here over the new year, we felt right at home the minute we walked through the doors. Beautiful hotel, our room was immaculate and very comfortable. The perfect location,and the food in the hotel and bar was 5star. The staff were lovely, Shona was extremely helpful to us. Anne and Bernie the owners were incredible to us. Bernie was a gentleman and we got to see the ball drop. It was the highlite of our trip. We Will definitely be back.

title: Sehr gutes Restaurant!
text:
Wir waren nicht im Hotel aber in seinem Restaurant. 
Es ist ein kleines feines Restaurant mit einem sehr guten Preis Leistungsverhältnis.
Wir haben dort gefrühstückt und zu Abend gegessen. Die Qualität der Speisen war stets exzellent und preislich für das teure New York sehr gut.
Also insgesamt mehr als empfehlenswert.

title: C'est bien un boutique hôtel
text:
Très bien situé, si vous recherchez un endroit calme tout en étant au coeur de Times Square.. c'est lui. 4 chambres par pallier (préférez les chambres côté verrière sinon vous êtes devant les échafaudages et sur rue passante et bruyante). Pas de réception, juste un corner. Un bar, restaurant petit mais bon. Attention, le prix des chambres changent du simple au triple en fonction du taux de remplissage. J'ai réservé en aout pour décembre pensant faire au mieux mais en fait vous pouvez faire des affaires à la dernière minute... du moins dans cet hôtel. Pas ou peu de service, de peignoir ou autre ou de shampoing/gel douche etc.. so bring some with you! 
Hôtel pas décoré pour Noël.. c'est dommage quand même!

title: Great setting but…
text: I will say that the staff, location, restaurant food and ambiance of the hotel are amazing, but the double queen room we were given  (201) was extremely underwhelming and disappointing. When we walked in, I instantly felt scammed. I will say it was clean, but the pictures due to angles and filters made it appear to be a lot more than it was. And for almost $500 for a night! They won’t get me again.

title: Great location, rooms and staff!
text:
We stayed here for a week at the start of December and cannot recommend it enough! The location is perfect, the rooms are immaculate, the food is great and all the staff are lovely! Nothing was too much trouble - cheers to Sebastian and Shona! 
We would definitely stay here again 😁

title: Ewige Wartezeit, teure Nebenkosten
text:
Das Positive: gute Lage, sauber
Das Negstive: schlechter Service, lange Wartezeiten, überfordertes Personal, sehr teure Nebenkosten 
Unser Flug wurde verschoben; Anreise ein Tag später; wir haben 16 Stunden vor dem Geplantem Eintreffen im Hôtel dies gemeldet. Trotzdem mussten wir den vollen übernachtungspreis zahlen. Das Frühstück dauerte ewig, über eine Stunde Wartezeit 
Nie wieder dieses Hôtel

title: New Yorks Hidden gem
text: To Bernie, Shona, Sebastian and all the rest of the staff thank you for making our holiday so enjoyable. I cannot use elevators so this is why I chose this boutique hotel. The hotel is literally a couple of minutes from Times Square. The rooms are very clean and the beds are so comfortable.  We chose to eat a few times at the hotel and the food was really good. What made it special was  the staff though as they was so helpful and made you feel like you had known them for years. Will definitely be recommending this hotel! Thank you

title: Best kept secret in NYC
text: Absolutely the best place to stay in NYC especially with this perfect location!  Everything was impeccably clean and all the people the were with the hotel and restaurant were as helpful, kind and friendly as they could be. We wouldn’t even think about staying anywhere else!!

title: Wonderful place
text: We feel very blessed to have found this hotel out of all of the places to stay at in NYC.  Wonderful employees, owners and managers.  Delicious food, cocktails and coffee at  the lovely bar. Exceptionally rooms with comfortable beds and double paned windows to keep the street sound out.  Very central to Times Square, pubs, restaurants and shopping.  Overall a very charming place.  Sebastian as well as the rest of the employees made us feel like family.

title: Quiet gem near Times Square
text:
Upscale boutique with well-appointed finishes makes this a great option near Times Square. 

My room was small, even by NY standards. My queen room was great for me but would have been uncomfortable with my wife.  There was not even a sitting chair, so be advised to opt for a larger room if this is important to you.  I expect there are larger rooms better suited for 2 people.  

When I needed to work I used either the common area on the first floor-either the front room that is set up for restaurant overflow or the actual restaurant.  By the way, the restaurant is great.  My room included food vouchers which worked well for breakfast. I'm not sure if all rooms include this. 

BTW, the restaurant or bar can be a good pre or post Broadway quiet oasis.  

Note that there is no fitness room and no complimentary gym affiliations

Please don't misunderstand my comments.  Marrion is a FANTASTIC option.  I just want to set expectations on what makes it great-- location, restaurant and upscale feel-- while allowing you not to be surprised with its limitations.

title: A truly lovely NYC experience!
text: Lovely boutique hotel with amazing proximity to it all! If you want a truly special NYC experience, this is the place. Super clean and nicely appointed with crisp, white linens. Staff friendly and knowledgeable, very personable. Had the pleasure of meeting owner, Anne, which made the stay even more memorable. Happy to support family owned businesses and look forward to our next stay here at Merrion Row. Erika and family.

title: Hidden gem near Times Square.
text: What a fabulous bar/restaurant literally minutes from Times Square. The food, service and staff were amazing, and the prices are so reasonable compared to many other restaurants in the centre of New York. If you’re looking for a small, friendly restaurant then you have to visit the Merrion, next door to Connolly’s on West 45th Street, just off Times Square. Thanks to Bernie, Shona and all the staff of this hidden gem.

title: Perfect
text: Perfect stay.  The kind of place you feel really comfortable in and don’t want to leave. Very clean, great ambiance. Staff is very personable.  Delicious food, great cocktails.  The building feels soundproof from the outside too.  A great escape from the hustle and bustle of the city.

title: Nice Boutique Hotel with a Touch of Ireland
text: One night stay at the Hotel. Room was clean and well-appointed. Wonderful rain shower.  Food and drink was good, with great service overall. Elevator accommodates 1-2 guests at a time, but the adjacent staircase is available for guests as well. My room faced adjacent buildings so no noise from the street or Times Square.

title: Excellent stay
text:
We stayed from Nov 2nd - 8th, the hotel was great, we don't always need luxury, but this was perfect for us, the bed was so comfortable, room was spacious enough for the two of us, could have more clothes storage but we managed. Bathroom was spacious too, so glad they provided a hairdryer!
Big shout out to Sebastian, our server most mornings for breakfast, gave us many recommendations on what to do each day, and was very friendly and chatty, very nice guy, will miss him!

Will definitely visit this hotel the next time we come :)

title: Clean and comfy, safe and friendly!
text: This was our first trip to NYC and we loved the convenience of Merrion Row Hotel. The staff is incredibly helpful and friendly. The bar/restaurant food is delicious and the waitstaff and management are the best! We had two rooms and both were clean and comfortable. Despite only a 2-night stay, housekeeping cleaned our rooms and brought clean linens. That feels luxurious in this age when so many hotels don't clean the rooms each day. The location was perfect for all of the sites, walking to a Broadway show, Central Park, the museums. We commented that coming into the front door we were met with a nice clean smell--pretty important after being on the streets of NYC! Next door is the Perfect Pint--a great place to get drinks and hang out a bit before heading back out to sightsee. All of us agreed that if we go back to the city, we will stay at Merrion Row.

title: un bon choix
text: Petit hôtel situé sur la 45eme à deux pas du fameux Time Square et des Théâtres. Idéal pour rayonner du Sud au Nord de Manhattan avec le métro. Malgré le quartier très bruyant, les chambres sont bien insonorisées. C'est aussi un restaurant et un bar assez cool. Le personnel est très aimable. Comme partout à NY les prix des chambres sont élévées, mais ici le rapport qualité prix est très très correct. Une bonne adresse.

title: Perfect!
text: I stayed with my daughter for the weekend.  I really cannot say enough good things about the hotel.  The room was immaculate and comfortable.  There was a spacious first floor lounge area, friendly and inviting bar, and sunny cafe,  The hotel was a quiet, peaceful oasis, surprising since it's located between Times Square and Fifth Avenue.  Shona, the manager,  was friendly, informative and delightful.  This is the best hotel experience I've had in NYC and will be back!

title: Visit to New York City
text: Five star stay at Merrion Row Hotel, wonderfully located just off Times Square. From the moment we arrived, it was like home from home in the heart of NYC. A warm welcome from Shona and her team, wonderful room, comfy beds and gorgeous bathroom, topped off with super breakfasts and attention to detail from everyone in the hotel. Merrion Row is small and beautifully formed, we would recommend a stay here if visiting NYC.

title: Great experience
text: We arrived in NY having booked a hotel very close to Time Square. The hotel was awful so rather than go back there we stayed out in the city and had a drink at the merrion. We were so impressed we checked out of our original hotel that we had booked for 5 nights and booked in here instead. Everything was great about the place, the rooms, food, cleanliness but most of all the staff. They were so friendly, accommodating and helpful. We have an 11 year old daughter so was nice to go back there in the evening and relax. Thanks again to Shona and the team for making us feel welcome

title: Magical night in the Big Apple
text: This little boutique hotel was magical. It was quiet, very clean, and the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable. We slept through the night, which rarely happens on vacation. Located close to Times Square, restaurants and theaters were within easy walking distance. The hotel’s manager and staff were very friendly and helpful. We needed to get to a specific location the next morning and they booked a black car service for us, checking the following morning to make sure they were on schedule. In addition, the Public House restaurant located on the property offered a delicious breakfast the morning of our departure. This hotel made our short stay in the city delightful and we cannot wait to stay there again.

title: Excellent choice
text: Good location. All new and clean. Good shower and bathroom. Nice pub with an amazing staff. Cleaning staff is VERY gentle; they let you new towels and bottles of water, even when you let a "no disturb" at your door. Nice complimentary "welcome pint" and "continental breakfast"(which is simple but works for a free meal). Free and fast wifi for guests. Comfortable bed and good linen and pillows.

title: Amazing stay with friendly staff
text: Hidden gem in Times Square. Excellent location. Amazing staff. Laid back atmosphere. Pub staff was the highlight of our trip. Authentic public house atmosphere. Clean rooms and comfortable beds. Can't wait to return!

title: Public House breakfast
text: My husband & I came to the Public House because he wanted an Irish breakfast for his birthday (he’s a frequent traveler to Ireland). He had the Irish breakfast & I had the lemon ricotta pancakes. Everything was delicious! The dining area was really pretty with lots of natural light & I enjoyed all the art on the walls as well. Shona, the manager, was very welcoming, and when I asked about some of the art she took the time to chat with me. The servers were attentive & nice as well. We enjoyed the whole experience and will definitely be planning a date night to come back and enjoy some cocktails, because they all looked really good. I would also love to stay here some time as well! Definitely recommend.

title: Excellent experience
text: Beautifully designed boutique hotel with the sweetest staff. Everyone was excellent they went above and beyond to make us feel comfortable and welcome. Small rooms but hey you’re in NYC. The design was amazing, modern and comfortable. Great lobby and restaurant. No complaints, we will definitely return.

title: Not typical terms
text: This hotel advertises 15% off 3+ nights but it doesn't work when you try to book.  They also have a 72 hr cancellation policy which does not work for business travelers needing to change dates.  Front desk is not at all helpful and that just leaves you feeling resentful.  Hotels should be about service.  This one is not.

title: Extra charges
text: The staff was nice and the accomodations were clean but my room had no desk which was difficult since I was in NYC on business. My biggest complaint is that the hotel will charge an extra $25 per night for items that are billed as complimentary that are given to guests on the first night regardless of whether they have requested it. The so called complimentary items are a small continental breakfast, 2 beers and internet. The only service I even used was internet. I even asked the front desk on the first night if internet was free and she said yes. Either build these things into the price or give guests the optionality. The method now is clearly deceptive which is why I won't ever return or recommend this hotel.

title: Great staff
text: Great place to stay - location cannot be beaten. Clean well appointed and a hidden gem - however what makes this hotel special is its staff - polite, professional, friendly, informative, engaging big mention to Seb who made our stay a delight.

title: Limpio, pequeño y con un ruido ensordecedor
text:
Nos hemos alojado en este hotel boutique.
El personal muy poco servicial, cogimos con desayuno… y nos costó más el capuccino que no entraba en lo que ofrecían.
La habitación es pequeña no, lo siguiente no se cabe con las maletas.
La cama súper pequeña, y muy poco confortable.
Pero el ruido es ensordecedor, se escuchaba como ventiladores o máquinas en el altillo y no se puede descansar, como un motor de Ferrari día y noche.
La limpieza escasa, dejamos un papel en el suelo y allí se quedó, no reponían a diario los jabones.
La ducha solo funciona la parte superior no hay otra manguera tal y como se ven en las fotos.
A la llegada le dije al de recepción sino tenían habitación más grande y me dijo que precio pavo 150$
No lo recomiendo, antes de la pandemia estuvimos en el Room Mate Grace y he está al lado y ni punto de comparación.
Mi marido tiene una reunión de trabajo y no hay ni escritorio… parece una ratonera… pero el ruido es inviable! En mi vida he estado en un hotel que parece una locomotora.
El personal del mismo…. No te solventa ni te ayuda a nada

title: Amazing boutique hotel
text: This is a fabulous hotel located in a great location, just off Times Square. The staff are wonderful and go above and beyond to ensure you have a fantastic stay. The rooms are spotless with super comfortable beds. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.

title: Our absolute favourite pick in New York!
text:
Finding the right hotel in New York while not breaking the bank can be compared to finding a needle in a haystack. There’s hundreds to choose from spread out over 59 square kilometres!

We recently celebrated our 25th Anniversary and stayed 2 nights at a hotel in the Lower East Side, and 3 nights at the Merrion Row Hotel and Public House near Times Square.

Along with the many other hotels we stayed in while traveling the East Coast of the USA in August, hands down the Merrion Row was our absolute favourite. It reminded us of the small boutique hotels we often stay in throughout Europe with such personal service and unique charm. Everything from check-in to check-out completely exceeded all of our expectations!

The hand-picked staff are friendly and pleasant, all going above and beyond whatever the request. Our compact room was tastefully decorated and absolutely spotless. The a la carte breakfast included with our stay was such a treat every morning, enjoyed in the bright cozy restaurant nook. The location of this hotel is also second to none. We were a block from Times Square, a very short stroll to the Theatre District and not far from Central Park making everything super convenient. It’s also close to a lot of good restaurants and not once, did we feel unsafe walking back to our hotel afterwards. We truly couldn’t have asked for a more perfect location.

I also want to thank the management for the thoughtful, unexpected and very much appreciated surprise along with a lovely note wishing us a Happy Anniversary. Nowadays added touches such as these are extremely rare. You all truly made our stay in New York one we will not forget!

title: Beautiful hotel in Times Sq
text: The Merrion Row hotel is situated perfectly at 45st just 30sec walk from times sq. The staff are so attentive and lovely, particularly Shona and Pedro. The rooms are DEVINE...absolutely stunning and beyond what I expected in New York. Midwest Radio plays in the hotel, in the lift and along the street and it feels like a home from home!
