The hotel is joined onto the neighbouring Connollys Irish Pub and, like the Merrion Row, the staff and service are second to none. Ruth, Anita and Lorraine made our visits feel like home. A special mention to Orla for her attention and friendship, and to Bernie Reilly - an absolute gentleman. Looking forward to our next visit

title: Lovely boutique hotel in the heart of the action!
text: We had a lovely stay at Merrion Row. It is the perfect location to walk to many of the sights and shopping in NYC. The rooms were nicely appointed and the bed and bedding was really comfy. Continental breakfast was included and Nelson and Sebastian gave us great service every morning:) We will be back for sure!

title: Christmas break
text:
We had an amazing stay at Merrion Row. The hotel is very centrally located, a couple of minutes walk from Times Square and also very close on the other side to 5th Avenue. 

It is only a small hotel and the rooms reflect that, but they were modern and well equipped. After some initial issues with an interior room which was very dark with no natural daylight, this was quickly sorted and we upgraded to an exterior facing room. 

Breakfasts at the hotel were really good quality and there was a wide choice available. 

The staff at Merrion Row were definitely the best part. The size of the hotel meant that the service was very personable and we felt like we knew everyone well by the time we left. Vito was truly incredible and spent so much of his time showing us the best things to see and do around the city. The staff at breakfast and also on the bar on an evening were also amazing.

Overall it is a lovely hotel and we would return.

title: I’m convinced
text:
At first, I wasn’t convinced. The lobby was dark and seemed kind of deserted and I didn’t experience that famed hospitality right away. The place just seemed deserted.

Went up to my room and I started to warm up a little. The hallways and rooms are immaculate and quiet and really tastefully decorated. It really does feel like a Dublin townhouse with attention to detail in the furnishings.

By the time I left I understood the rave reviews and the service did finally catch up to rooms. I loved the Irish radio played in the mornings and the genuinely friendly and somewhat informal staff and I slept great each night.

Housekeeping was a little inconsistent and the neighborhood is filthy and crowded—safe enough though—those were the downsides. I come to NY a lot and this is the dirtiest and grossest I have seen it but the Merrion Row is a sanctuary.

title: Broadway getaway
text:
Boutique hotel is a nice treat in the heart of Times Square, clean, great location, and friendly bar staff.  Unfortunately, there is no seasoned management on premise and that is a big downfall. When asking if my room was ready, a repeated 3pm checkin was the response, no effort to see if the room was ready, while fellow travelers had access to their rooms. And while we were waiting a gentleman sitting near us in the lounge asked if we were checking in to the hotel, we said that we were trying to ( it was approximately 2:30). He stated that he was part owner of the hotel, and instead of saying he would see what the delay was, he  began "mansplaining" that it takes time to clean various rooms, as if I wasn't aware of this?!  At three minutes to 3pm, the front desk person (without checking anything) said my room was ready. 
If you are a light sleeper or late sleeper beware, the door slamming could wake the dead. Sounds from people in the hall and other rooms were as if they were sitting on your sofa. One night the screaming and fighting in one room was so crazy I called down to the front desk at 1AM to complain. No apology, no response that we will get someone upstairs immediately, the screaming went on for over an hour.
The bright side, the bar staff was great, students from Ireland, a sheer delight and the young man at the front desk from Secaucus was professional, and remembered our names. With a seasoned manager, this place could be a real gem.

title: Estadia incrível
text:
Hotel muito bem localizado, limpo, com funcionários educados e atenciosos. Sem dúvidas tornou a nossa experiência em NY muito melhor.
Quarto espaçoso, limpo, confortável, tudo em ótimo estado.
A localização é perfeita, a poucos passos da Times Square, facilitando a locomoção pra qualquer lugar, com as inúmeras opções de linhas de metrô por perto.

title: Excellent stay at the merion
text:
We stayed for 3 nights in a double queen room (2 kids + 2 adults). The location was fantastic (300 meters from all the hectic atmpsphere in times square). Despite being so close it was very quiet. Staff was super friendly (especially Pedro) and very helpful.
Bath was spacious and very clean. Beds comfortoable.
All in all,  very good value for money

title: Incroyablement calme et hyper bien situé
text:
Vraiment un hôtel parfait à New York, à 30 secondes de Times Square. Bien qu'au cœur des activités (5ème avenue à 5 minutes, Broadway à 1 minute, etc.) l'hôtel est incroyablement calme et reposant. Il est de taille humaine (4 étages) ce qui permet de ne jamais perdre de temps à quitter ou regagner sa chambre : on est dehors en moins d'une minute.
Tout le personnel est aimable, accueillant et très réactif à toute demande. Le (petit) déjeuner est inclus et une pinte de bienvenue est offerte. 
Les chambres sont certes de taille réduite (comme presque tous les hôtels de NY...) mais design, bien insonorisées, confortables, pratiques et extrêmement propres. 
Ce n'est certes pas le moins cher des hôtels du quartier, mais la différence de prix est parfaitement justifiée par le calme ambiant et la qualité des prestations. 
Ce sera désormais notre hôtel pour tous nos séjours à Manhattan.

title: Great experience
text:
I would give 4.8 out if 5 if I could. Staff was excellent. Everyone was very nice and helpful. Location was great for access to all parts of Manhattan, but particularly for the theater district. Easy to take the subway to uptown or downtown. 
Rooms are small but nice and sufficient. Beds were comfortable and shower was nice. Very close to time square but not a lot of spillover noise. I am sure it is even better if you are off the street. Would recommend for couples especially. We will return.

title: Um maravilhoso oásis perto de Times Square.
text: Excelente hotel com um atendimento personalizado e extremamente amável e prestativo. Um café da manhã maravilhoso! Restaurante muito bom! Decoração muito agradável e aconchegante. Ótima localização para teatros e as diversas linhas de subway. Um verdadeiro oásis na loucura de Manhattan e especialmente Times Square. Voltaremos com certeza.

title: You wouldn’t know you’re in Times Square
text: We recently spent two nights at the Merrion Row and had a great time. The hotel is darling and the best part for us was how quiet it was despite its busy Times Square location. Room was clean. The staff members were warm and attentive. We hope to stay again. Thank you!

title: Like it!
text: Great staff, comfortable beds, nice and clean bathrooms, central location and delicious breakfast. The breakfast dish avocado on toast with poached egg was fantastic. For a stopover or short stay on Manhattan this is good value for money.

title: Night Away for 50th Birthday
text: Absolutely fabulous! Four of us went to NYC for my husband's 50th and the Merrion Row & Public House was one of the best parts of the trip.  From the friendly & accommodating staff and the quaint but well appointed rooms, to the incredible food at dinner and breakfast along with a great location, this little gem had it all. We have already told several people to stay there on their upcoming NYC trips.

title: Incredible!!
text: Wonderful, boutique hotel in an amazing location!  The hotel is close to everything but extremely quiet.  Comfortable bed, great shower and intimate  little spot to eat in the lobby.  I promise you will enjoy your stay.  For business travelers-it is worth breaking away from the chain locations.

title: Lovely Irish Themed Hotel with Efficient and Friendly Staff - Totally Surprised By This Quaint Hotel
text: Lovely staff, lovely hotel and lovely food! From check in to breakfast to check out wonderful service.  The room was compact but there was room for everything! Clean and comfortable - the bed was hard to leave in the morning! Food was perfect!

title: Gorgeous. Modern. Cozy.
text: The hospitality here is unmatched. I was blown away by the attention to detail and thoughtfulness of the entire staff. Stella will make you feel right at home with her lovely Irish accent while serving you the best coffee at their continental breakfast!

title: Absolutely perfect
text: I can’t say enough good things about the Merrion Row. I found it randomly on a booking site and I’m so glad I did. Impeccably clean room, great food, friendly and helpful staff, and a perfect location. I will 100% be back. Thank you for a fantastic stay.

title: Great choice!!!!!
text: This is a superb choice for anyone who enjoys a hotel with central location combined with good quality combined with cosyness and kind service. The hotel is only half block from the big screens or Times Square, but still with no noice or other disturbance. The room was modern and stylish with a good size bathroom. Breakfast was excellent, large variety of choices but still very much affordable. Staff was GREAT!!

title: The good and some bad …
text:
This is a very cute boutique hotel in Times Square. Loved how private it felt and even though the rooms were pretty small, I found them to be thoughtfully arranged, very clean, and well-decorated. The staff, especially at the restaurant were just wonderful! So pleasant and lovely. 

Okay now the bad and I hate to leave any negative comments but truly, as another reviewer mentioned, the sound insulation is pretty bad. Especially for a 4 star hotel. The walls are fine, clearly they’ve had insulation added. But the source of all the noise is the doors!
Every morning I heard everything from the housekeeping, doors slamming and people talking in the hallways. Starting at 8:00 am on some days. Which made it pretty hard to sleep.  Now if you’re a person/family that wakes up at 7am anyway to start your day, it’s probably fine. But anyone who plans to have any semblance of a “late night” in New York should probably look elsewhere. 

The rest was wonderful though! If the sound issue was remedied, it would be superb.

title: Terrible noise issues
text:
I needed a hotel in the Times Square area, and was pleased to find a boutique stay with such great reviews. While there were some positives of my stay- entering the hotel does feel like a respite from the craziness outside, we enjoyed our dinner at the restaurant, and the rooms are attractive in design- unfortunately, the noise issue was one of the worst I’ve ever experienced at a hotel. 

My first room was adjoined to another and I could hear a family inside crystal clear through the door. I called down to ask to switch rooms and was moved to a more spacious room a floor up, which I appreciated. At first it seemed much quieter; however, later in the night, I started hearing music and voices from the room across the hall, and as soon as the couple in the connecting room returned home, I could hear every single thing going on in their room. It was even worse the next morning when housekeeping started cleaning. It made for an incredibly loud, stressful, and not restful stay. Based on other reviews, the hotel clearly must know this is an issue, and yet there is not even a white noise machine or earplugs provided. There is also an extra $25 fee charged for things that really should already be included (wifi, water) and an unimpressive continental breakfast not worth the cost. Ultimately, I just can't recommend a stay here.

title: Favoloso! Grazie di cuore
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato presso il Merrion Row dal 4 al 10 Giugno ed è stato favoloso. È stato tutto perfetto, dallo staff alla direttrice. Pulizia della camera top, posizione che fa invidia. Grazie di cuore di tutto. Sono stati 7 giorni soettacolari
Ci torneremo sicuramente

title: A very nice place
text:
We really enjoyed our stay at the Merrion Row Hotel.
Everyone was really friendly, the room was perfectly clean and silent,  and we always enjoyed our breakfast.
Unbeatable hotel for this price.

Thank you

title: Wonderful Hotel and Staff
text: I love this hotel. It is clean and comfortable and exactly what I wanted it to be. The staff are friendly and happy to have you as guests. I plan on staying here again when I come to NYC. It’s is small enough of a hotel that you get to know the staff and they get to know you. I absolutely recommend this hotel.

title: GREAT place to stay in Times Square
text: The place is very cool and sexy.  The room and bed was beyond comfortable and the restaurants food was fantastic. Staff is very accommodating. I’d definitely stay there again. It’s also in a great area and very convent to Everything in Times Square.

title: Awesome hotel in a fantastic theater district location
text: Everyone in the hotel was personable and pleasant. They were helpful when needed. The room was clean and comfortable. The location is ideal for those who want to spend time in the theater district. I will definitely return to this fine hotel.

title: Book This Spot!!!
text:
I just completed a week long stay with the Merrion Hotel and I can’t recommend this hotel highly enough. I traveled solo so the idea of a small boutique hotel with a bar and eating establishment attached really caught my eye. I also planned to attend shows on Broadway so I wanted a location which made walking to the theater a close walk… which it was.
I booked a King Studio and was very happy with it. The room was immaculate. I was a little thrown by no closet but the standing wardrobe in the corner was perfect for both hanging my garments and it had hooks attached to hang both my handbags and carry on. Every spot in the room was utilized for both comfort and storage without being overwhelming. The bathroom is very nice sized and again space was utilized but very comfortable.
Now let me get to the part that really put this spot over the top and that’s the entire  staff.. both hotel staff and staff in the adjoining small  bar and restaurant. 
The bar/restaurant area was such a wonderful and welcoming spot to start my day with a latte followed by breakfast, have a latte after a day out and have a wine before I started my evening out… and I did all three more than once. And on top of the welcoming atmosphere the food was great!

I feel so fortunate to have found a spot in NYC that feels like home and I can hardly wait to return!

title: Above and Beyond!
text: This hotel is in the heart of Times Square, yet it is so peaceful and relaxing.   The staff was so helpful and friendly, the room was spotless and the food was outstanding.  My husband and I have already planned a second visit next month.

title: Charming and cozy, don’t miss the atrium room
text:
Charming hotel steps to Times Square. We stayed in 403 which was small, but very well appointed. Excellent decor that was contemporary yet classic at the same time. I loved the tile in the bathroom. Definitely my favorite part is the atrium room in the back of the pub. It was so peaceful and bright, and a lovely oasis from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Pub had good food and the breakfast was on point.

If you have a lot of clothes, don’t stay here. It was fine for us but will not be good for someone who has typical suburban spacious American expectations. If you can recalibrate to what is reasonable to expect in a city, you’ll love the charm of this boutique hotel.

title: Perfect anniversary get away!
text: It was the perfect location to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary - close to the theatre district & Times Square.  Breakfast was delicious and we had great service at the bar!  We loved the quaint atmosphere & would love to go again!  We were on the 5th floor and it was very quiet.

title: Highest recommendation
text: Highest recommendation. The staff was outstanding from the desk clerk to maid staff and especially the waiters and hostesses in the bar and restaurant. We visit NYC often and plan to make this our home base for future visits. The food choices in the restaurant were varied and so good that we ate most of our meals there. The rooms and hotel itself were very clean and well maintained.

title: Great location and quiet!
text: We had a lovely stay at the Merrion Row Hotel.  The location is great, particularly if you are seeing Broadway shows like we like to do.  The hotel is quiet and we loved that it's a small hotel as at times, we felt like we were the only guests!  We did spring for the slightly larger room and had plenty of space (for an NYC hotel - they are all small!)  We appreciated the courteous service and will definitely look to return on a future stay.

title: Wonderful hotel highly recommend
text: Fantastic location next to Times Square and all Subway services. Well appointed, quiet comfortable rooms. Excellent restaurant and bar. Very friendly and helpful staff. This is an unassuming gem and we will definitely stay here again.

title: Perfect stay
text:
Myself and my daughter stayed here for 4 nights. Everything about this hotel was perfection. The location is a stones throw to Times Square and yet with the windows closed it’s almost silent so easy to get a good nights sleep. The room had 2 queen beds which were so comfortable and although the room is small it has ample storage and is to be expected in a New York boutique hotel. The decor is stunning and the bathroom was very opulent with a fantastic shower. The food was delicious and reasonably priced. But the thing that makes this hotel 5 star in my mind is the staff. They go above and beyond to make you feel welcome. Bernie the owner was so welcoming to us and Shona the manager felt like an old friend! The hotel felt like home to us while we were in New York and made our trip even more special. I would never stay anywhere else again and highly recommend to anyone. 
Emma & Aoife (from Limerick)

title: What a weekend!
text: The Merrion was a great spot for our long weekend in the City. We went to a concert at Radio City, a Broadway show and visited family and friends, and the Merrion was a great respite before and after all of the activities. Shona, Sebastian and everyone else were wonderful. The room was NYC cozy, and well-appointed. The hotel is small and the service is personal.  We will definitely be back. Thanks for everything!

title: Wonderful experience
text: We spent a 3 day, two night weekend in NY last weekend, I had never been there before. I was blown away by the kindness, cleanliness, and quality of service from this hotel/public house. The stay was made especially great by the manager on duty Shone, the young lady at the front desk Anais, and the waiter/server/bartender Sebastian, all of them went out of their way to make our stay there wonderful. I had no idea what to expect, but now that I do, I would never consider staying anywhere else next time I am there. It felt like coming home every time we walked in the door, and only a half block off Time Square to boot. As a base to see Broadway shows, or just a great central location, this could not be beat! The only very slight negative I could think of is that they seem to have a music loop that plays over again every day, not a big deal for most people, but I just don't care to hear any song, even one I like more than once in a week, but again, this was minor, the service was outstanding, the room nice and clean, and the staff could not be improved even if you tried. Very highly recommended!

title: Neat and clean with friendly staff
text: Very clean rooms, nice atmosphere, and friendly staff. We took a chance on this boutique hotel for our family vacation after having stayed at many larger chain hotels in NYC in the past, and I'm very happy that we did. The staff is very helpful and made us feel welcome. The restaurant and bar offered a great selection of food and beverage in a nice atmosphere. After our first meal there the family quickly decided to eat dinner there every night. The room was very clean and in great condition.

title: Great place near Times Square
text: I had a great but brief stay when I needed to be near Times Square.  Service was very friendly and helpful.  Rooms are small, but very neat and tidy.  Nice atmosphere in the lobby.  Would definitely come back.

title: Recomendado
text:
Excelente atención y ubicación cerca del time square, resalta Sebastián como un excelente trabajador y empatico, volveremos sin duda.
Buen desayuno y las piezas limpias y comodas, el baño limpio y la calefacción adecuada.
Excelente para pasar unos dias en Ny

title: Excellent Hotel
text:
We travelled to New York from Dublin, Ireland for our wedding recently. Merrion Row came recommended to us from an aunt who had attended a wedding meal there months previous. Having checked the hotel out online, we decided to go the whole hog and book it for our wedding meal and our stay. We really could not have made a better choice! Everything about the hotel oozes class. Shona, the manager of the hotel, is such a lovely person and went above and beyond helping us organize the meal. My now wife Emily had left all table decorations with Shona the morning of the wedding, and by the time we arrived there later that afternoon, it was set up perfectly. The food was superb and we really could not have asked for any better. 
In terms of the room, we stayed in a premium king room for a 7 night stay. The room was spotless clean, larger than expected and the bathroom made me want to remodel my own. The bed was so comfortable too. It was a struggle to convince ourselves to get up and get exploring every morning. All the staff were lovely and really helpful, particularly Shona, Chanel and Anais. We will absolutely be staying here again the next time we venture to NYC

title: Great Hotel in a Great Locaiton
text: Just spent a week here and it was great.  Room was nice and the little amenities were very much appreciated.  Pillows were super comfy as was the bed and the hotel staff couldn't have been nicer.  Food was excellent from the kitchen and everyone was super attentive.  Place was very clean and just what I wanted.  Right on 45th so very close to Times Square.  Like this place way better than the bigger chains and I'll definitely be back.

title: Excellent Experience, Location & Staff
text:
Booked this hotel from reviews on tripadvisor only

from the moment we arrived we were warmly greeted at reception. Really quick check in and off to our room, 4th floor - 404.

The hotel has been recently refurbished throughout and everything has been fitted to a very high standard.

To be honest room was a bit on the small side but very well equipped with all you would need, including a room safe. 
Bathroom was excellent and boutique hotel quality.

Location of the hotel could not be better to be honest. Close to Times Square and next door on the street are two very good Irish bars. The bar next door has very well known bands playing and the atmosphere is superb, staff great and really make you feel welcome.
Although bar next door, room was really quiet and didn't hear any noises when we went to bed.

We were there for St Patricks Day, If you come to NYC for this event, definately book this hotel, like you're celebrating at home.

What really makes this hotel is the staff. Shona made us feel like family and was always there if you needed any advice, assistance or just a chat.

I think I spent as much time with Sebastian (aka Bruno Mars) as my wife. He had my coffee made every morning before breakfast scheduled time, superb service from morning till night and really top bloke.

Anais behind reception was so welcoming and friendly. Literally nothing was too much to ask, she was on it and provided whatever you needed.

Last but not least Bernie the hotel owner, really nice guy, went out of his way to chat, ask how your stay was, anything you needed 

All the other staff members were very warm and friendly as well.

The staff here truly made you feel like family. Really fell on my feet booking this hotel and would definately re-book if we ever return to NYC

Thank you all, wish you all the very best

Rob & Roma

title: Perfect small boutique hotel in NYC
text:
This is the perfect small boutique hotel and home away from home. 
The room that we had was small, typical size of Manhattan hotel, but it is beautifully finished and with a large and stylish bathroom. the bed is extremely comfortable and the sheets and pillows are all high quality.
The public space in the hotel is beautifully decorated with carefully selected art works.
My daughter and I loved the breakfast at the hotel. Unlike a typical hotel breakfast, the quality of the food in the restaurant at Merrion Row is really really good. We did not need to go out to find places for brunch. The restaurant has a room with gloss roof top that allows the sunlight to come in and having breakfast in that room is one of the most relaxing time of the day. 
On top of all these, the most amazing experience at Merrion Row is the service and warmth from all the staff. Hotels in New York City have seen way too many travelers and visitors and often times, one can’t remember where one stayed the last time and what happened during the stay. But we will definitely remember Shona our manager, Sebastian the waiter for breakfast, and the attention they have given to us. 
We will definitely be back.

title: Excellent Hotel
text: My stay was lovely. The room was impeccably clean and well-designed. The staff was also excellent, especially Shona. The owner is also a very kind and personable gentleman. The breakfast I had in the restaurant was very good and extremely fairly priced, considering it's New York. The location is fantastic, as well. I highly recommend this hotel and hope to visit again.

title: Visit for drink St Patrick’s Day
text: Called in to see if we could get a drink after watching the St Patrick’s day parade. We were shown a seat at the bar and have some nice drinks. Asked if we could have food and choose from the menu. The food was fabulous, really enjoyed it and would recommend it. Very nice bar area and great staff. Workday have gone again if we had time. Well worth a visit

title: Loved the Merrion Hotel and Public House.  Perfect Irish hospitality in a great location #Midtown #Theater district
text:
We absolutely loved Merrion Row, a small, Irish hotel in the theater district!  Great Irish hospitality from everyone we encountered.  From Bernie Reilly, owner of the hotel, and 2 adjacent Irish pubs, Connolly’s and The Perfect Pint, to Shona the manager and Anais at the front desk as well as all the bartenders and wait staff…so friendly and helpful!  We loved the daily breakfasts as well as a special Irish dinner on St. Patrick’s Day.  Also fun to try some great Irish whiskeys and good wines as well. 
Our room was quiet, clean and tastefully decorated. 
Can’t beat the location for the theater, restaurants, shopping. It’s a great value.  We’ll definitely be back!

title: Wonderful location, great food and  best of all...THE SERVICE!!!
text: Our family stayed for a week at the Merrion Row to visit NYC area colleges, see our kids perform and see a few Broadway shows. It could not have been a better week and largely because of the wonderful people at the Merrion Row! The hotel itself couldn't have been more perfectly located -- right between the shops of 6th Avenue and the shows of Times Square. When you step inside you feel like you've stepped back in time to an era when hotels gave singular service and knew your name. Bernie, Shona, Sebastian, Nelson, Dixon ... they all accomodated our every need, from special requests at breakfast to personal escorts through the crowds to the parade on St. Patrick's Day! The accomodations are gorgeous, rooms lovely, beds comfortable, bathrooms divine, and the food at Merrion Row is absolutely delicious -- every item is better than the next. And for those who are worried about the Times Square noise, they have clearly soundproofed well because we slept like babies, even on St. Paddy's night. We will never stay anywhere else in Mahattan. Thank you Bernie, Shona and crew for carving out this piece of perfection in the heart of New York!

title: A Four-Leafed Clover in the Apple!
text: You won’t find a friendlier hotel in all of New York City.  I’ve lived and worked in NYC for 30 years and never stayed at such a warm and friendly hotel.  A lovely, welcoming experience, in the heart of Gotham, where you can quietly unwind after all the excitement and energy.  If you’re from out of town, or looking for a weekend getaway…this is a great option!

title: Fantastic public house
text: While we haven't had the pleasure of staying at the hotel yet, we stopped in for lunch and couple drinks. First off the hotel is absolutely gorgeous and immaculate. The back patio and glass roof lets in tons of natural light and is decorated like a nice garden with the string lights and white brick. All the framed photos of scenes of Ireland and all things Irish, were obviously chosen with care. I especially loved the sheep grazing. The drinks were fantastic, the Heineken pints are the best I've had this side of the Atlantic, and The manager Shona from Derry was a delight to talk to and only too happy to help us out with whatever we needed. In a massive, fast paced city like New York, it was nice to find this gem and feel a bit like you've been transported back to Ireland. Can't recommend it enough and can't wait to return.

title: A quiet, calm oasis in busy Times Square
text: We LOVED this hotel. Great staff. Super friendly. Pristine, fresh, new-feeling. Stylish spaces and room. Easy check-in (and out). Enjoyed a pint when we arrived and a great breakfast in the garden. This will be our go-to hotel in NY now. Been searching; search is over.

title: Top O the Morning
text:
Location could not be better , the exact middle of Times Square !
Every detail of the remodeling was done with taste and is immaculately maintained.
Staff was professional and courteous. Nod to Sebastian. 
We had the pleasure of meeting and conversing with Bernie the owner ,
Roe $ Co ;) TY
Highly recommended boutique hotel.

KC & BC

title: Highly Recommended on All Fronts
text: In looking for a hotel recently, we learned about this option. Reviews were uniformly positive, so we booked for a 3-night stay (mid-week). Our experience was great! Starting with the staff...we found them uniformly helpful, responsive, and friendly. This applied to the  front staff as well as those working in the pub and dining room. Location....for us, could not be beat. Mid-town, just a block or two from Times Square but at the same time not in the midst of Times Square. Room...We had a room with 2 queen beds, which was plenty spacious by NY standards. Bathroom was clean, well-appointed, and included a most relaxing "rain forest" shower head. Our reservation included a continental breakfast, which was excellent. Menu included other breakfast options as well. All in all, nothing but positives experienced during this stay. We recommend most highly, without reservation.

title: The place to stay.
text:
Outstanding small hotel. The staff is exceptional, ready to assist any way possible - we felt like we were staying with family. We forgot one of our cell phones in the room safe. The staff went the extra mile to have the phone sent overnight via fed ex to our next destination.

We stayed in a king size room. The room itself was on the small side, but we were very comfortable. Being able to set our room temperature was a definite plus. The location couldn’t be better. We walked to the restaurants and the theatre, and just a block from Time Square. Although in the middle of things it was pretty quiet. We were in a street front room and had some street noise at night, but we were able to sleep. Rooms located on the back of the hotel would be quieter. 

The complimentary continental breakfast was very good, orange juice, egg, a small croissant and a small bowl of fresh very fresh fruit - loved it. Other breakfast options are available at a reasonable price. The steel cut oatmeal and vegetarian omelet which I had were top notch. They also offer lunch and dinner. While we didn’t have lunch at dinner at the hotel, but if it’s anything like the breakfast offerings you won’t be disappointed. 

Highly recommend this hotel. Would we stay again? In a heart beat. We will be back. This has become our place to stay in NYC.

title: NYC’s best kept secret
text: This is the 2nd time my husband and I have stayed at Merrion Row. We love every minute of our visits and we will be back again and again! Shona and Anais always do their best to make us feel welcome and accommodate us in every way possible. Their attention to detail is wonderful. They are centrally located and convenient to every, single thing you could hope for. Located next to Connelly’s Pub (open til 4am)  makes late night drinks and food super accessible and fun:) We enjoyed wonderful breakfast in the hotel restaurant, as well. Sebastien, our breakfast server, took great care of us. Our reasonable room rate included a welcome pint and free continental breakfast. Can’t wait for our next weekend get away.

title: Wow, from start to finish..Great Hotel
text: Stayed at the Merrion Row Hotel and Public House in January with my family, we had an amazing time in this hotel and of course in Connollys Bar next door.  This hotel is so central to Times Square and the Theatre District.  Shona was so welcoming on our arrival and throughout our stay all the staff went above and beyond to make our stay a memorable one.  The food here is exceptional especially the breakfast giving you the choice of a fresh Irish Breakfast or a continental with the added bonus of Irish Tea. The rooms are exceptionally decorated to high standards, beds & all furnishing so comfortable. The hotel is full or character with lots of lovely photos from Ireland incorporated throughout the hotel.  Cannot wait to return again.  A special thank you to Bernie and Anne for all the lovely treats received during our stay we cannot recommend this hotel enough and look forward to returning in the future.

title: Fantastic
text: Absolutely wonderful stay at the Merrion Row. My family were visiting from Ireland and they had the best time! The vibe of the hotel is very modern yet homely, the rooms are beautifully designed, very spacious and so comfortable. They have an amazing breakfast and also the bar/restaurant had the most delicious food and drinks. The staff (Shona and Bernie especially) went above and beyond for us and made it the most enjoyable stay in New York so far. We can’t wait to come back!!

title: Classy small hotel with bar and restaurant
text: Had a wonderful stay in room 301, which looks out on 45th. Very comfortable, very quiet, and very good food at all the meals. Rooms are well-designed and furnished, with a comfortable bathroom with shower. Staff were all friendly, attentive and skilled. Only a short walk to Times Square and the theaters, very near the 7 line, not far to Grand Central Station. We liked having a good restaurant and quiet bar immediately downstairs, with a more lively bar directly adjacent (just through a curtain behind the counter). The entire establishment has about 28 rooms which gives quite an exclusive feel. Very clean, nice pillow selection, good feeling of quality throughout.

title: Terrific Times Square family hotel
text:
Perfect stay at the Merrion Row Hotel. My family of five booked two adjoining rooms. The design of the rooms is beautiful.  Beds were comfortable and housekeeping service was friendly and excellent. 

The hotel itself is charming and cozy. Location is excellent - tucked away around the corner from Times Square and short walking distance to all the theaters (we saw 4 shows this trip). You feel like you are part of a family during your stay.  Everyone we interacted with at the front desk was friendly and professional.  We had several requests during our stay and all were handled quickly in a friendly manner.  

Would definitely return and would recommend this boutique experience for any family traveling to Times Square.  We are the breakfast twice on the quiet patio as well - service here was excellent also.

title: Fantastic!
text:
My husband and I decided to stay here for our 12 year anniversary based on reviews and location. Our hope was to have a nice, local hotel close to most of our planned attractions. Merrion Row far exceeded expectations. 

The atheistic, which I'll start with because that's what you notice first, is on point. From the entrance to the restaurant and your rooms, it feels comfortable, warm, and welcoming. Our room was towards the "back" and there was little to no NYC noise. I've slept in many a NYC room in which I awoke to street noise. Absolutely not the case here. 

The staff are outstanding. You can tell they enjoy working here and are happy and helpful. I truly felt they cared and were making an effort to get to know us. The restaurant staff quickly remembered our coffee and beverage preferences. As a former food service employee, I valued this greatly. 

 The food! The food is fantastic. We ate every breakfast here every morning (the salmon and scrambled eggs and the avocado toast are winners.). We also ate dinner here after a Michelin Star restaurant lunch and it was as exceptional. So exceptional in fact, that we ate all three meals here the next day. New York is full of great restaurants, and this is undoubtedly a hidden gem.

 I cannot recommend this hotel enough. I'm hesitant to write this as glowingly as I have, as I hope it stays a bit of a hidden gem, but my greatest hope is that they succeed and we can continue to come time and time again.

title: Perfect Hotel
text:
Location location location! Half a block from Times Square one way, half a block to 5th Avenue the other way. Could not be better for a NYC visit. A very short walk to Broadway theaters, shopping, food and transit. 
Ask for a room at the back of the hotel. They are completely silent... no street noise at all. 
The hotel is a couple of years old, and was shut down for Covid during much of the time so the decor, bathrooms, fitting, beds, sheets... is brand spanking new. Everything is immaculate. 
Rooms are small (Hey, its NYC) but well designed, and very stylish. 
And the staff!... my wife found a new best friend in Shauna (sp?) the hotel manager! Everyone was incredibly helpful and genuinely friendly. 
Will be our first choice of hotel when we return to New York.

title: Wonderful Theater district hotel
text: This place is a gem and is our new go-to hotel in NYC. Although it is one block from the crowds, noise and madness of Times Square, the rooms are quiet. The staff is beyond friendly, going out of their was to talk to us, make great meal suggestions, and find out where we were from, bring is robes to our room, get us ice, whatever we needed. Shona the manager was wonderful, Sebastian, our waiter was a doll, and has family in our little hometown. These people, and the desk receptionist from Woodside Queens made our stay fabulous. It felt like coming home. The rooms were small- they all are in NYC, but very comfortable, efficient, and QUIET. Our friends stayed at a brand name hotel a few blocks away and heard fire engines all night. We heard nothing.  We will be back! Thank you for a great time

title: Mother-Daughter Broadway Trip
text: Stayed December 19-22, 2021 and the hotel was FANTASTIC!  Quiet, safe, CLEAN, lovely!  VITO at the front desk is the best concierge/all-around-great guy. Vito set us up with great places to visit, eat, and he arranged for a private car back to La Guardia airport.  We never met the owner of Merrion Row, but did meet most of the pub/restaurant staff and the manger - she was great!  Can't recommend this hotel enough, and I will be returning in June and absolutely staying again.  European shower is fine (let the hot water run to catch up to the upper floors) and the bed was very comfortable.  Great New York hotel -- hard to find the really good ones.  This private boutique hotel is a gem.  I've been to New York 7 times and this is THE best on 45th -- quick walk to Broadway, Times Square, Radio City, you name it.  Thanks for everything Vito and Merrion Row xo

title: Pre-Christmas family trip
text:
Deciding last minute to show our kids Christmas in Manhattan left few choices for rooms. I kept returning to the Merrion hotel on our search because of the beauty /location/and guest service reviews. 
We decided to take the plunge despite the agonizing nightly fee. 
The hotel was BEAUTIFUL. Any glitches in service (our room wasn’t ready and we had to stay in an accessible room with three females and no counter space in the bathroom. That was the only real bummer. ) were handled as quickly as possible by the staff. 
The breakfast service and atmosphere was phenomenal and the bar was a great place to unwind and recount our day. Bye bye big chain NY hotels. And thank you Vito, Shaunna, and Sebastian (can’t remember the evening server’s name I’m sorry). Well done to the kitchen staff! 
We hope to see you again soon. Have a lovely holiday season and many thanks from North Carolina.

title: Cozy, quiet and friendly
text: Like some hotels in Dublin and London, you couldn't swing a cat in the room. They were small. But the amenities were fine, and the beds were clean, warm, and comfortable. As well, considering its location in the Theater District and Times Square, the room was very quiet. And the best part was the staff! Both at the front desk and the bar and restaurant were excellent. Highly recommended for short stays in Midtown Manhattan.

title: Straight out of the Movies!!
text: Merrion Row Hotel is not only amazing, but they make you feel like you are part of the family!  From the gorgeous hotel rooms, with the most amazing luxurious bathroom you could ask for, to the bar and restaurant that appear straight out of the movies.  Everything is top notch & as clean as you can imagine.  The bartenders, servers, manager, front desk personnel, and of course the infamous Bernie make you feel like you have just stepped foot into your home away from home!! The food at their restaurant is off the charts as well!  Breakfast, lunch and dinner I give the chef 5 stars as well as all the wait staff and bartenders.  Shaunna, Daniel, Vito, Dixon, Sebastian, Sarah, Sean, and Bernie are so amazing I would be honored to call them our friends!  We will be back Merrion Row!!

title: Hidden Gem with Fantastic Staff!
text: We stayed three nights at the Merrion during a recent trip to NYC in November to see La Boheme and it was one of the highlights of the trip. Every detail of our room and the hotel in general was top notch. The room was impeccably clean and the design and execution on the renovation was excellent. We had the good fortune of meeting the proprietor and sharing some Irish Whiskey (Roe & Co.) with him on a few occasions. He could not have been a nicer guy. The same could be said about all of the staff. The front desk workers were helpful and attentive, the bar tender was excellent. The hotel has a small staff so you see the same faces everyday. We developed a real fondness for everyone who worked there especially the sweet Irish girls who worked in the Public House and the property's general manager who treated us like old friends. I wished our trip was longer and I plan on staying there on my next trip to NYC.

title: Amazing Hotel and Restaurant
text: We stayed at Merrion Row for a girls weekend trip to NYC. The hotel is beautiful and so well maintained. Its a perfect balance of traditional Irish charm and upscale modern hotel. The staff is incredible! Everyone you come in contact with is so professional and makes you feel like you've been coming there for years! The food was so good! I wish I had enough time to try every single menu item! I highly recommend the Shepards Pie & French Onion Soup, yummm!!!! 5 Stars all around, cant wait to come back!

title: Great hotel and even better staff!
text:
We stayed 3 nights at Merion and loved it, the housekeeping cleaned our room so well we were in and out a lot and they organized everything in our room for us, it was such a relief not returning to the clutter of 3 ladies getting ready in a hurry! Vino was a life saver he showed us were to go and the quickest was to get there to maximize our time in New York, he was very friendly and very knowledgeable a definite asset to the Merion row hotel.

Michaela

title: Perfect Mid-town Retreat
text: We chose the Merrion Row Hotel after reading about it in T&L Magazine, intrigued by it Irish theme, 28 renovated rooms, and proximity to the Theater District. It was perfect. Warm, friendly (impossible to move without someone asking if they can help), with a truly wonderful (albeit intimate) upscale Irish ambiance and feel. The room (2 queens) was modern, spotless, and upscale for the price point. The perfect refuge from the hustle if Times Square.

title: A wonderful experience from beginning to end!
text: The location, the cleanliness of the room and the entire property, the wonderful staff made our visit absolutely perfect.  The atmosphere is so very welcoming and friendly.  The food was excellent.  It has become my favorite place to stay in New York City.

title: The Public House restaurant at Merrion Row Hotel
text: This is quite a hidden gem.  The restaurant is in a bright, charming space in a boutique hotel.  Warm hospitality and great food and service make it a special place. It's definitely a great spot  for dining when in the Theater District.

title: Excellent food, great staff.
text: Great location in NYC close to Times Square. Recently refurbished hotel to a high standard. The food was excellent. Staff and management were very friendly and welcoming. Would highly recommend to people visiting NYC to stop by the Merrion.

title: Lovely midtown retreat
text: We chose the Merrion because of its proximity to the Thanksgiving parade route, larger space for a family and great breakfast menu. The hotel was perfect in these aspects and the service, kid-friendliness and decor exceeded our expectations. Highly recommend!

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text:
Wonderful service, linens and room in this perfectly situated Theatre District hotel.  Everything was just perfect!  
Rooms are typically NYC small, but more than adequate size.  The staff is great and very accommodating.  
Would highly recommend this hotel for an NYC visit focused on theater.  Great pub in the hotel and next door.

title: What a find!
text: We were lucky enough to stumble upon this lovely restaurant, which apparently had just re-opened after a long pandemic-related closure.  Great food, great atmosphere, great service.  They also did a wonderful job of working around my (exasperatingly) many food allergies.  We went back for breakfast and dinner -- and it's at the top of our list for our return visits to NYC.

title: A wonderful Irish experience
text: Beautiful boutique hotel with an authentic Irish feel. A fantastic bar that is a great place to meet with friends and a wide selection of Irish beverages. The staff was friendly, gracious and helpful. Special thanks to Vito who gave us many helpful suggestions.

title: Beautiful stay in NYC
text:
It s a small, personal hotel, just what we needed for a peaceful stay in Midtown. The staff was very attentive and respectful. The room was beautifully appointed, very comfortable and clean; no views. The restaurant staff was friendly and professional, no lack of attention and not too much attention, just right. Food at was simple and good. Drinks were surprisingly well priced. 

I will definitely stay at the hotel again when in Midtown, and definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a peaceful home like stay.

title: Estadia num bom hotel mas numa cidade imunda
text:
Pontos positivos: limpeza, casas de banho, decoração, e gentileza dos funcionários, qualidade da roupa de cama, iluminação.
Pontos a melhorar: qualidade dos colchões e do banho, aquecedores de toalhas, insonorizacao, manobrista, garagem como cortesia, vagas para carga e descarga em frente ao hotel para hóspedes, quarto queen necessitaria ser um metro maior e ter mesa ou cadeira no mínimo . 
Pontos que independem do hotel mas que pioram a estadia de forma significativa: lixo lixo lixo em frente ao hotel por todos os lados nas calçadas, localização , obras , vizinhança , ar poluído

title: Beautiful small hotel and wonderful staff
text: We stayed at the hotel for two nights and everything was perfect! This small hotel is very charming and  the staff is very attentive, professional and friendly.  The restaurant had delicious food and the service was excellent. The room was small but nicely organized, very comfortable and clean. Nothing was missing and we highly recommend it.

title: Incredibly charming hotel in  Midtown
text: It's a spectacular hotel.  The staff is superb, and my room was exquisite with lots of charm.  It was perfectly situated in the middle of Midtown, with great details like the soundproofing around the door to avoid hallway noise.  The bed was quite comfortable, and I really enjoyed the breakfast.  I would absolutely

title: A great weekend in a mostly empty NYC
text:
We stayed at the hotel in mid March 2020, just before NYC was locked down and just before all flights from the UK were cancelled. The city was very quiet and we had a very different, but very enjoyable time walking around Manhattan.

The hotel was everything we hoped it would be from the reviews we had read beforehand. 

Every single employee was helpful, courteous, friendly and great company in a mostly unoccupied hotel.

The food was lovely and the breakfast included in the $25 daily charge was just enough to start the day.

The bedroom was spotless, quite small, but had  a large bathroom. 

The location was great, just three blocks from Times Sq, but on a quiet street.

The price was also reasonable for a hotel of this quality.

title: Quaint and charming near Times Square
text: The staff at this hotel really go above and beyond.  The room is small but the bathroom is very roomy and the restaurant downstairs is delicious.  Its a two minute walk to the center of Times Square and there are a ton of pubs in the area as well.

title: Perfect Place for a NYC Visit
text:
From the moment we walked into the Merrion we felt welcomed. Mr. Troy was our first impression and it was an excellent one. The hotel is intimate and our hosts learned our names quickly, and us theirs. We were always greeted with a "Good morning" or a "welcome back".
We had breakfast our first morning and it was so good, we started our day with breakfast here at the Merrion. Mr. Patrick was our top man for breakfast. At night, Mr. Brian made the perfect nightcap.
The room was very clean, comfortable and well maintained.  We stayed in a king room (with Oscar Wilde's portrait) and were very comfortable. 
Whether you rate this hotel by it's staff, accommodations, or location to the Theatre District/Times Square,  it's a 5 Star rating. We know where to stay next time we visit NYC!

title: Ten Stars◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇◇
text:
I don't write reviews often but this little gem of a hotel deserves 10 stars and will be my new go to hotel whenever I travel to NYC. I booked online for best price and booked 3 rooms for a visit with my adults  kiddos to celebrate my birthday. Let me start with saying this hotel is  the real deal and  provided  the best customer service  I have ever recieved by a hotel.  Upon arrival Troy made us feel so at home and explained how to redeem our Welcome  Pints, how to get  extra water bottles  in room if needed, and offered to send robes and slippers to our  room  as well. In my room was a special note and dessert acknowledging my birthday celebration which was extra special. The rooms  themselves are so clean, new and so well decorated. They have everything you need and are actually look just  like the photos online.  The next morning the breakfast was fabulous!! If you choose to not get the continental  breakfast they offer you a credit towards other breakfast options. The coffee is so yummy and my avocado toast was the best I have ever had. I met the manager Erika and told  her how  much we were enjoying our rooms and  how every member of her team was so friendly,  helpful and professional.  This is the only hotel we will ever stay when visiting in NYC. My family and I felt  like we were staying at a wonderful family members home, and this team treated us like family. HIGHLY RECOMMEND♡♡
Thanks for making our weekend so perfect!

title: Charming hotel in centric location.
text: My husband and I stayed at the Merrion Row Hotel at the end of February for 4 nights.  The boutigue hotel is very quaint and charming - conveniently located walking distance to major attractions and steps from Times Square, but just far enough from the noise.  We stayed at a king "suite".  It was small but comfortable, true to the pictures.  The bathroom was also very nice and clean. The best thing about the hotel is the staff.  They are helpful, professional and friendly.  They made us feel very much welcomed and at home.

title: Herausragender Aufenthalt
text: Wir fühlten uns wie zuhause! Außergewöhnlich freundlicher und familiärer Service, tolle Zimmer inklusive kleinem, aber feinem Frühstück! Ich empfehle dieses Hotel ohne Einschränkung! Wir werden sicher nochmal kommen!

title: Truly amazing!
text: Every detail of our stay completely exceeded expectations! We booked 3 Merrion Row’s king bed hotel rooms for a weekend getaway for my mom’s 60th birthday celebration (1 couple in each room). The decor in every corner of the hotel and public house was cool and intentional, both the continental breakfast and regular breakfast were delicious, and the hospitality and service were above and beyond! We had a great time toasting each night in the Merrion Row Public House with their awesome staff as well. We absolutely can’t wait to visit and stay at Merrion Row Hotel and Public House again!

title: A cozy home away from home full of heart and soul - WHAT A GEM! WHAT A STAFF!!!
text:
I have NO clue where to even START with this review. Few places impress me with the force this place has. For MANY reasons. Up until this visit, the only place that has me making a "home away from home" destination has been the Captain David Kelly House in Centerville, MA. They are unsurpassed for comfort, cleanliness and human soul (if that were ever a category)... But to find a place in A GIGANTIC city like NY? IN THE THEATRE DISTRICT? COME ON! It's a unicorn, right? Hardly. This is a petite boutique hotel with a heart the size of Godzilla on steroids. Among so many giant hotels. OUR unicorn! Gold at the end of the rainbow! THE blarney stone!

Once a hostel, the owners and a mind-blowing team of dedicated staff gutted this place to the studs and created a cozy little piece of life that is incredibly comforting in the middle of hustle and bustle. Flanked by the hotel owners many vibrant and PACKED Irish pubs is this little thing of joy. For starters, we were greeted by Troy who is simply a master in customer relations and care, hospitality and overall a super loving, charming and caring professional. His knowledge and attention to detail and loyalty and deep caring for this little piece of heaven is so thick, you can slice it and serve it on a silver platter. Brian, one of the many exquisite bartenders... ahhhhh what an Irish Coffee can this guy deliver. Simply beautiful. Same for Patrick, and the many other staff members who are HAPPY-  truly HAPPY to serve you, keep the place IMMACULATE and deliver delicious food and service that is unsurpassed. I have stayed at RITZ CARLTON that can't deliver what this beautiful and cozy little welcoming joint can.

And I wish I weren't gushing because if you all flock to it, and I can't find a room there, a block and some change from Time Square and everything theatre, I will have to go back and ruin my review to keep all you vultures hungry for a piece of GREATNESS cramping what has become my new digs in NYC on a theatre-date weekend. Location? CANT BE BEAT! 

I can't say enough about the people, the food, the ambiance, the room comfort. It's tiny, under 30 rooms. And with little nooks and crannies to enjoy a delightful cup of coffee and a perfect croissant. Or enjoy the Irish breakfast. Or those PERFECT, STUPID PERFECT BREAKFAST POTATOES I'm still craving. Something so simple yet so perfect. Fish and chips? Best you will have, seriously.

Great service is always a reflection of a great leader. Hug Reina for me. She deserves a high 150 for creating a staff that is as welcoming, caring and happy as the dwelling she oversees. I CAN'T STOP GUSHING! OH TRIP ADVISOR! WHAT DID YOU DO TO US?! No one can really compare to this place. THIS is a higher level of standard

title: Absolutely Amazing
text:
My husband and I went for our 1 year wedding anniversary. We live in Manhattan and wanted to do a staycation. 

Our room was absolutely lovely. The bed was ridiculously comfortable. Sheets, towels, THE ROBES... (we ended up getting one of the robes for at home; they were THAT incredible) all incredibly lovely. The bathrooms are so well done. The decor is very aesthetically pleasing. We were greeted in our room right after check in with a lovely plate of sweets that said Happy Anniversary Tim & Alicia. Delicious and so thoughtful. We then went downstairs for our welcome drink at the bar. The bartender, John,  was very attentive and sweet. He ended up waiting on us for dinner later that evening as well. Dinner was divine and we were sent a dessert on the house to celebrate our special occasion as well. Every appetizer and entree we had was very good, which is not always the case for hotels in Manhattan... They clearly care about their product and service, and it shows. Frank at the front desk was incredibly welcoming and helpful. The manager, Reina, came to personally greet us on our way out after our breakfast at their Irish pub next door to the hotel. We have decided to make this a yearly tradition on our anniversary to come back here and I will certainly recommend this to anyone visiting NYC for any occasion. Highly Recommend. Thank you so much to the Team at Merrion Row for a wonderful get-a-way and treating us like royalty!

title: Wonderful stay
text: A great find that is centrally located. We enjoyed everything and everyone at the hotel -the welcome pint was a nice touch and breakfast was outstanding. Highly recommended! We will definitely stay again!

title: Nice lobby restaurant for non-guests
text: The Public House in the hotel:  I have been here a few times for a quick lunch with friends during the work day.  It's a nice location just off Times Square, the room way in the back of the lobby has a sunlit atrium that is very pleasant to sit in.  The food is pretty standard but well made.  My friends and I usually have some variation on the Greek or Caesar or grain salad with shrimp or chicken or salmon on top.  The portions are good, the added protein is always done right, and the service is always pleasant.  And the price is pretty fair.  You don't come here for gourmet but it is perfect for a work lunch or if you're a tourist in Times Square and want something close, relaxing and not like all the Irish pubs surrounding it.

title: A home from home welcome.
text:
I can’t praise the Merrion Row highly enough. The staff were very friendly and couldn’t do enough for us, the room, not huge but are any in New York, was spotless,beautifully furnished and very quiet considering how close you are to Times Square.  Our bed was very comfortable with luxurious sheets and duvet, my daughters sofa bed was equally as nice. Breakfast was tasty with all the favourites, try the full Irish, dinner was equally as good, we ate there twice during our stay. The bar seemed lively on a Thursday and Friday,not too boisterous though and the selection of beers was as good as my local craft beer pub in Shoreditch. In fact the hotel had a very good boutique feel about it. If you don’t want to be a faceless guest in a hotel of 500 rooms this is the one for you. 
I don’t have any pictures but trust the website.

title: Great Location but some Critical Misses
text:
Pros:  The staff is exceptional.  Dinner was yummy although the dining room was cold.  Close to Broadway and the subway.
Cons:  Plumbing is very poor-had to let the shower run 5 minutes to get hot water and  water pressure was so low that you can’t get the soap out of your hair.  Heat turned off in the room whenever we left and then took about 2 hours to heat up again so spent a lot of time in a cold room.  They aren’t upfront about the daily URBAN fee in their pricing (+$25/day) which lacks integrity.  Sorry, a good shower, heat and integrity seem like basics to me.  We won’t return for a second visit.

title: A truly wonderful find!
text: Myself, Mum & my sister stayed here last September (apologies for the delay in this review) and had a truly memorable stay. The room, Restaurant, Bar and amenities were all fabulous and the staff (Genna, Franc, Clare, Dixon, Sonny, Ciera, John, Linda, Joseph) to name but a few were all very warm, friendly, hospitable and nothing it too much trouble for anyone. They were extremely kind to my Mum (who is Irish and loved the picture of the "cows in the field in the Bathroom"!). The personal touches added to this Hotel (by Irish owners) really makes it feel like "home from home" and we cannot wait to stay their again. In fact, I've just booked again for a trip in September 2020. To add to all of the above - the location is perfect for lots of tourist spots in New York; the food is wonderful and the Bar has a really lovely atmosphere - open to non residents also.

title: Cozy, perfectly located hotel in Manhattan
text: This Irish-flavored boutique hotel was my  home for five nights,  I loved it.  Perfectly located one (long) block from the theater district.  Easy walking distance to Rockefeller Center, several subway lines and Bryant Park.  The staff was friendly, smart and helpful.  The hotel, itself, is only about a year old, so it is squeaky clean and well-maintained.  My only (minor) complaint is that---like almost all Manhattan hotels---the rooms are small and closet space minimal.  On the other hand, the bathrooms are large and nicely done---and, for Manhattan, the room price was certainly reasonable.   I definitely plan to recommend Merrion Row to friends visiting New York.

title: Hat mehr zu bieten als nur eine Top Lage
text:
Wir haben im Juni'19 zwei Nächte im Merrion Row verbracht und unsere Zeit sehr genossen. Im Gegensatz zu den meisten anderen Hotels mit guter Lage in NYC gibt man sich hier Mühe mehr zu bieten als nur die Lage.
Man ist in unter 5 Minuten direkt am Times Square mitten in Manhattan.

Die Zimmer sind für New York-Verhältnisse geräumig, sehr sauber und in sehr gutem Zustand. Keine Spur von abgenutzter Einrichtung, auch das Bad ist hell, modern und geräumig.

Das Frühstück ist gut, wenn auch (wie in den USA üblich) sehr einfach gehalten.

Das Personal war sehr freundlich, hilfsbereit und gut gelaunt. Alle machten den Eindruck, gerne dort zu arbeiten.
Am Abreisetag hat man unser Gepäck kostenlos bis Abends gelagert.

Wir können das Hotel jedem weiterempfehlen, der eine nette, gemütliche Unterkunft in bester Lage sucht.

title: I don't really write reviews...
text: ...and I wasn't going to write this review - because I didn't want anyone else to know about it, I didn't want it to be booked every time I want to stay there.  But I want it to still be in business, so here's my simple review: five stars. A small hotel - intimate and homey (but upscale), not a mammoth, NY mega-hotel.  Excellent room, recently remodeled. Excellent staff and service, genuinely cheerful and helpful.

title: Shall be back
text:
Got a great rate by booking early for a 2 night treat to myself pre some work and other travel. This only opened in this guise I understand approximately a year ago. It well deserves its top ratings on TripAdvisor. 

They had helped me organize a shuttle but oddly the ground transportation/Shuttle desks don’t know it. (They still have if listed as the Big Apple hostel). 

What a great redo - from a hostel to this bijou boutique hotel.

On arrival - Front door not obvious  - and all very discreetly signed. 

It’s a stunning location - literally aground the corner from Times Square and walkable to many attractions but in a much quieter street. 

Venue and Rooms are lovely -  However the true gems are the service and the hands on well trained and highly  empowered very friendly staff (with a mix of nationalities including Irish - highly fitting given the name and heritage). An example of the above and beyondness is the staff member who gave me their personal umbrella on a lashing rainy day they had run out of guest umbrellas. 

I was Upgraded to a premium room (and from 4th to 6th floor). It was a decent size and spacious for NY. They are well laid out and there is complimentary Water in rooms. (Plus a Free wine or beer Welcome drink). 

Only negative I recall was issues with the lift (which meant I had to walk 6 flights twice) but again the staff were very helpful and I always judge  on how issues are handled - and they were well handled. 

Finally - included in the ‘urban’ rate was a fine continental breakfast which consisted of a bowl of chopped fruit; perfectly boiled egg; mini croissant and (piece de resistance) a lovely detail -  Barry’s breakfast tea (a LARGE pot). It was served in a very Lovely whitewashed space (but on the rainy day a little chilly). 

I would definitely recommend for an NY trip and shall return with friends and family. Congrats to all involved.

title: Beautiful hotel with excellent restaurant (Public House) for group dining
text:
We have executives stay here as it is a convenient location close to our offices by station or walking from Midtown Manhattan. Nice rooms and good service. 

On a special note, my company hosted a group dinner for 30 plus guests at their inhouse restaurant, Public House, and I want to give a shoutout specifically to Aoife and Reina, our event managers. At the last second, they accomodated our 30+ guests and ensured we were properly staffed with our food preferences...even helped with our champagne toast! The restaurant itself has a fun/lively ambiance, is tastefully decorated, and our party found their food/drinks amazing. We have continued to have business dinners there and are always pleased with this level of servce - especially in midtown Manhattan!

title: Great staff and location! Underwhelming room, amenities and breakfast.
text:
The staff was absolutely fantastic! Emily in the dining room is awesome - you can't not like her. They were all friendly and helpful anytime we came in and with anything we needed.
Disliked  · Rooms are REALLY small and tough to stay in with 2 people. They’re not laid out well or efficiently and there’s barely any space to put your clothes. We were constantly running into and tripping over our suitcases as there's no room to put them or walk around them, etc. The hotel seemed to really skimp and try to save a nickel on  amenities. There weren’t hardly any towels and only one bar of soap to cover both the sink and the shower. Seriously. Our sink had a broken cold water handle that popped off whenever you’d turn the water. We left it laying on the sink so staff would see it the next day and be able to repair. Nope, they just set it back on top so it could keep falling off. We needed a needle & thread. They got it right to us and then charged our room $3.60 with no mention of doing so. No in room coffee maker or refrigerator. Hair that wasn't ours on the bathroom wall - never a good thing. We paid $12.50/person to have continental breakfast included each day of our stay. You get a very small, limited plate (no buffet) or they'll give you a $5 credit if you order something from the regular menu. $12.50 vs. $5.00?? (go figure)

title: Lovely!
text: Great location, warm and cozy accommodations, friendly and helpful staff.  Artwork and music from Ireland.  The morning complimentary breakfast was delicious.  Drink were terrific. A real gem of a place!

title: Lovely friendly boutique hotel
text: This Hotel was amazing. All the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. It is in a very handy location near Times Square, theatres and easy to get around from using the subway. It was so quiet once inside it is hard to believe the bright lights, busy streets of New York are outside. Would definitely stay here again.

title: situato a Time Square, il Merrion Row Hotel and Public House vi accoglie con la cultura dell'ospitalità irlandese...
text:
una reception aperta 24 ore su 24 e un ristorante e bar in loco. Bryant Park si trova a 5 minuti a piedi dal Merrion Row Hotel and Public House.

Il Merrion Row Hotel and Public House offre un centro business, una navetta aeroportuale e sale riunioni. Sono inoltre disponibili i servizi conceirge, WiFi gratuito e lavaggio a secco.

Tutte le camere sono provviste di TV via cavo a schermo piatto e bagno interno con accappatoio e set di cortesia con prodotti naturali rispettosi dell'ambiente.

Il ristorante Public House è un vero pub irlandese che serve piatti della tradizione celtica con un tocco newyorchese. Potrete gustare una colazione all'americana ogni mattina e visitare la caffetteria che propone caffè gourmet locale.

La posizione davvero strategica per visitare New York. A pochi passi da Time Square e a circa un chilometro da Empire State Building, Central Park, Rockefeller Center e United Nations. Comodissimo allo shopping sulla Fifth Avenue!
Personale davvero molto cortese e sempre disponibile per soddisfare ogni esigenza dei clienti

title: Delightful stay
text: Spent three nights here for a theater vacation, and we were very pleased. We selected it mainly for the location in the heart of the Theatre District so we could have quick walks to the shows and restaurants in case of rough weather (it was dry!), but we were bowled over by the genuinely friendly staff. Everyone from reception to breakfast waitress (hi, Emily!) to management was a pleasure to deal with. Our room was more than adequate - the place was thoroughly redone just over a year ago, and the boutique scale of the place is charming. We plan to return.

title: Birthday weekend to remember!
text: Traveled to NYC with my mother and my daughters to celebrate her birthday. Selected this lovely place based on location and reviews. We were absolutely blown away by the staff, most particularly Troy and Aoife, who went out of their was to make my mom’s birthday weekend something she’ll never forget.  Location is wonderful. The space is surprisingly quiet given where it is. Lodging is cozy and quite spacious for NYC. Easy access to everything. Will definitely be staying here again.  Love this place. What a gem!

title: Love Merrion Row Hotel
text: We were planning to be in town for 3 nights and before booking anywhere I read hundreds of reviews on different hotels. Merrion Row definitely lived up to every positive review! It's clean, so stylish, the staff is incredibly friendly. Shout out to Emily! Everyone was so kind and helpful. Public House is the restaurant inside the hotel and the food is so good! Best crab cakes I've ever had. You can't beat the location, it's literally in the heart of midtown but once you're in your room it's nice and peaceful. I highly recommend staying here!

title: Beautiful jewel box
text:
Wonderful hotel. Excellent housekeeping: spotless room and any requests were fulfilled promptly. The decor is gorgeous. We had a king bedded room. It was very small but not unexpectedly so for NYC: a bed, a chair, and a very small desk with a bench (not enough room for another chair). Hooks were well-placed, giving more storage room. The room was dark and quiet at night -- a nice surprise, given the location.

Continental breakfast is a very small croissant, a boiled egg, and a small dish of fruit. Kind of like a kids meal. Won't be enough to hold most adults for a full morning of sightseeing. It is brought to you by a server so you'll have a service fee added.

A small complaint and suggestion: The music is odd, inappropriate, and almost always too loud. It is pumped loudly into the tiny elevator (WHY?) On the first ride up to the 5th floor, we heard a couple of f-bombs, not sure what station or playlist was on at the time. We walked up and down 5 floors after that, mostly because the music was so loud it was assaultive, especially first thing in the morning. We stayed three nights. At breakfast, the music was either 80s dance tunes (such as Whitney Houston -- I Wanna Dance With Somebody), or country or talk radio tuned in from Ireland. It was just kind of weird, and did not suit the Dublin townhome aesthetic. Choose something that works with the rest of the hotel and stick with it.

title: A place that makes you smile
text:
It is vary rare that i would write a review but this hotel deserves this service!
Aesthetically a beautiful place, fantastic location and superb cruisine! The best of all was the team: who made this place truly come alive- their service was warm, attentative & personal. Big thanks to Troy and Brian especially, it was a hectic business trip myside yet they always left me with a warm feeling when coming and going from the hotel.

This is a place not to be missed!

title: Amazing stay 5*
text: A party of four of us stayed at the Merrion row hotel and public house for a week! I could not recommend this hotel enough! The hotel itself is absolutely stunning, gorgeous decor and so clean and tidy! The food is to die for and the portions are fantastic! The staff could not be any more attentive! They were so friendly and polite, nothing was too much trouble! One of our party has medical issues and they were so helpful with everything we needed! The rooms are gorgeous, clean and comfortable! We stayed in new York for my birthday and I arrived to a birthday card and deserts! So thoughtful! Normally on a holiday I can’t wait to get back to my home comforts but this week I did not want to leave! If you’re looking for a hotel close to everything, close to time square and grand central station etc but hid away and quiet this hotel is for you! This is a hidden gem in New York City and I will definitely be staying again! Thank you Merrion row for such a lovely stay!

title: A fine restaurant in Times Square
text: This restaurant was a surprise considering the location.  It is associated with the Merrion Row Hotel, steps from Times Square and it attracts a theater crowd.   Public House is an attractive space with good design.  There’s a great bar, an interesting menu of Irish and American food, friendly service.  It’s cheerful and calm at the same time.  An oasis in a desert.

title: Harry Potter visit!
text: This hotel has the most amazing customer service! Having come to the city for work and occasionally for pleasure, we’ve sampled many hotel choices over the years.  I have never been this impressed. The staff - without exception - is exceptional.

title: The Most Lovely Breakfast
text: My husband, granddaughter, and I had the most amazing dining experience here. The service was perfect and everyone we talked to was so nice and informative. Brian, our server, was amazing and very kind. Troy, the manager, was so helpful. The food was delicious. We will definitely come again.

title: Maravilhoso!
text: O hotel tem uma localização maravilhosa, fica à uma quadra da Times Square, à poucas quadras da 5 avenida, tem metrô próximo e é próximo de vários pontos turísticos que dá para fazer a pé. O quarto é super confortável, ambientes limpos e bonitos. Os funcionários são muito prestativos, especialmente o Joseph.

title: Charming, boutique hotel
text: Charming, boutique hotel in theater district.  Great for romantic weekend getaway in the city.  Friendly staff. Enjoyed drinks and finger foods in the hotel bar before a night out and a delicious breakfast in the on-premise restaurant the following morning. Would definitely stay again and recommend to anyone needing midtown accommodations.

title: A New Year’s Eve to remember.
text:
So these guys have so many 5 star reviews, why write another ?   

Well, dear reader, you may be reading their reviews and wondering if it’s possible to be so good.  And I wanted to leave you a note to say just how good.  

We came here for our New Year’s Eve meal.  And we arrived at 9. Were seated without any fuss, with a friendly host and the patron also welcoming us.  

We were treated like family and we had the best time.   It was topped off with a magnificent interval to our evening that we never expected and had no right to.  

The food was delicious.  The drinks were excellent.  The service tremendous.  

This is THE best place in New York for us. And we will definitely be back again.  

Thank you for making our NYE and for making our trip!

title: Very clean and very new inside!
text: These were the nicest people to help and serve and accommodate. They looked out for your well-being and your pleasure from the minute we walked in until we left. The food was outstanding in the public house. The location was steps away from Times Square. We frequented the Bryant Park Christmas Market several times and it was an easy walk.

title: perfect stay
text:
We stayed at the hotel for 8 nights, and felt like home. The staff is very friendly and the service excellent. The food served is delicious. The busy Times square is just a 2 min walk away, but the hotel is a calm and cosy little "island" to relax.
When going to NY again we will not hesitate to stay here again.

title: Fabulous staff,amazing hotel.
text:
Could not recommend this hotel highly enough. Lovely rooms, comfortable beds, great shower. Breakfast menu had wide range of options. 

Location excellent, central to most of the top attractions.

Bar and restaurant well run and welcoming.

Of all the positive things this hotel has to offer its best feature is its staff.  Sarah was so welcoming and attentive and made our stay very special. Sincere thanks to Ciara,Emily, Zulema, Joseph, Troy,Frank Dixion and Brian.   

Don’t visit without treating yourself to one of Brian’s drink specialties the Nutty Irishman.. totally delicious!

title: Xmas holiday
text: We spent 10 days at the Merrion Row public house and hotel in New York over the Xmas period, the room was great bed very comfortable bathroom great and I have to say from the moment we arrived to the time we left on check in and check out and throughout the week the guys were always so helpful Joesph Troy,Frank,Sarah,Ciara,Emily, Brian and Zulaman were always ready to assist with absolutely anything. A great friendly team and a lovely atmosphere in the hotel. The Hotel is in a great location and I would highly recommend.

title: BEST HOTEL IN NYC
text: The Entire staff was amazing. I was here for my birthday. They made everything special & my husband & I had the perfect trip. We will definitely be back. Frank & Joseph are the best they both went above & beyond for us.

title: Lovely small hotel in the heart of Manhatten
text: Loved our stay here at Merrion Row.
