Location was amazing - just few small steps from the hussle and bustle of Times Square and Sixth Ave. The hotel itself was very clean and the staff were great. The welcome drinks are a nice touch and the food was fantastic. Best for us was the unadvertised stair access to all floors. Finding this is rare in NYC but not all of my family like using elevators so the stairs were very welcome. Overall a great stay and thank you for making our trip so special

title: Muito bom
text:
Este hotel tem tudo o que eu procurava nesta viagem. Conforto, elegância, carácter, staff simpático e prestável, localização excelente, limpeza, cozinha saudável e de qualidade.

Os quartos não são muito grandes mas da para abrir a mala e sentirmo-nos a vontade sem aperto.

A decoração é sóbria e de muito bom gosto. Encontrei o meu novo hotel em NY.

title: Bon choix pour Manhattan.
text:
Bel hôtel à la décoration soignée avec une trentaine de chambres situées sur une cour intérieure où sur la 45th street. 
Chambres comfortables. 
Personnel à l’écoute et souriant. 
Rien à redire sur cet établissement. 
Très bon qualité prix. 

Petit regret et bémol : des bruits de centrale de climatisation en roof top qui était défectueuse les deux premières nuits et générait une gêne sonore.

title: Our new place to stay in NYC
text: Located on 45th St in NYC, this gem of a hotel is in the center of everything in New York. If you close your eyes, you would swear you are in Dublin, Ireland. The staff is genuinely friendly and will go out of their way to please. The boutique hotel has everything you need or want. We absolutely loved our stay. . They even have a free continental breakfast!

title: Boutique hôtel formidable non loin de Times Square
text:
Légèrement à l'écart de la sur-activité de Times Square, ce petit boutique hôtel mérite de s'y arrêter.
Hôtel parfaitement entretenu. Equipe vraiment sympathique et voulant rendre votre séjour le plus agréable possible, je recommande fortement cet hôtel.
Les chambres sont de taille raisonnable pour New York, propreté irréprochable. Salle de petit déjeuner agréable dont une partie est sous verrière.
Si vous appréciez d'être traité comme un client et non pas comme un numéro, je ne peux que recommander cette adresse.
Thé noir irlandais le matin (le propriétaire rappelle ainsi ses origines).
Je remercie toute l'équipe pour l'accueil qui m'a été réservé.

title: Perfection
text: This is where you should stay when you are in New York. This hotel is the absolute best. From the friendly staff to the hip restaurant to the well maintained rooms- everything is perfect. Plus, hard to beat the location which is walking distance from everything. I’ve stayed here twice now and both times were on point!

title: One of the Best Hotels I've Stayed At!
text: If I could give this hotel 6 stars I would.  Adorable boutique hotel right in the middle of everything.  Everything is within walking distance. The hotel staff was so friendly and helpful, which made the trip that much better.  The rooms were clean and the Public House downstairs was the perfect spot to hang out.  The Irish flare was so well done.  Oh, and we each got a "Welcome Pint" which I was definitely stoked about.  All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone.  Thanks for an amazing experience!

title: Great Boutique Hotel
text: We had a wonderful stay at this beautifully designed hotel! The staff are so friendly and hospitable, particularly Ciera. The restaurant is cozy with great food. The hotel is clean, comfortable and quiet in a great location. We would very happily return!

title: Great, perfect place to stay in NYC.
text: This place is all 5 stars.  The location, rooms, the bar, the dining area, free continental breakfast but best of all . . . . the staff!  They are all great and willing to do anything to make your stay more comfortable and enjoyable.  You can't go wrong with Merrion Row Hotel.  If and when we go back, we'll be here.

title: OTTIMO HOTEL NEL CENTRO DI MANATTHAN
text:
Arrivati in pieno periodo natalizio in questo delizioso e piccolo hotel a due passi da time square ma Incredibilmente silenziose le camere  nonostante la posizione.
Staff gentilissimo molto disponibile per ogni richiesta 
Pulizia ovunque,colazione continentale compresa nella tassa di soggiorno  e come bonus anche un drink a persona.
Al piano terra ristorante e bar tutto in stile irlandese
Camera minimalista ma con tutto l'occorrente,compreso HIFI gratuito e TV a schermo gigante.
Molta pulizia ovunque
Non ho dato 5 stelle nel gradimento perchè la camera era davvero piccola ma è un hotel che consiglio a tutti

title: Esplêndido
text: Hotel irlandês com serviço ao cliente fenomenal, eu e minha esposa fomos recebidos com uma hospitalidade fora do comum, fomos muito bem tratados e respeitados, uma simpatia que fez toda diferença na viagem. O café da manhã é maravilhoso, há uma opção gratuita para os que não tem muito apetite pela manhã, e há opções pagas que são pratos irlandeses deliciosos. A localização do Hotel não poderia ser melhor, alguns metros da Times Square, e ao lado de um Pub sensacional (também irlandês) Connolly's. Definitivamente o hotel e a cultura irlandesa marcaram nossa viagem, voltarei de certeza! OBS.: Fiz minha reserva pelo Expedia com 10 meses de antecedência e paguei um preço excelente.

title: A Irish Gem in a busy city
text: Found advertised on an in-flight magazine earlier in the year, what a great choice this turned out to be! An Irish-owned boutique hotel, very close to Times Square and Bryant Park.  A very warm welcome on our arrival, a peaceful haven from the hustle and bustle of the city outside.  As soon as you walked in, it was quiet and cool with Irish music playing (Irish radio station direct from the Emerald Isle).  Room very cosy, clean and comfy beds - always essential. We dined in the first night, which was delicious and the breakfasts were excellent, served by delightful Irish waitresses. Thoroughly recommended.  Two minor niggles - please stop using plastic straws at the bar (remember the environment) and provide larger bath towels!

title: A truly amazing experience
text:
Wow is really all my two girls and I can say. We stayed here for three nights. Myself and my two daughter (9 and 7). From the moment we walked in we were treated incredibly well. Warm welcome, great room and the food at the restaurant is phenomenal. Right in the center of the city. This will be our go to hotel whenever we come to the city. 

You get a free welcome drink, free bottled water and free breakfast. One of the little things I loved is how they do breakfast. The free breakfast is continental, but if you want something more you can order whatever you want and they discount the bill the cost of the continental. I have never seen a hotel do this. It is usually free or pay full price. It is these small details that make for a great stay. 

Thank you so much. We will be back.

title: Wonderful experience!!
text: It was the perfect hotel for us. Could not have been a better location. The staff was incredible. Every one who worked there was so friendly and polite. They all went out of their way to make you feel welcomed without being intrusive. Rooms were very clean and comfortable. Food was excellent. This is a very well managed hotel. Would highly recommend.

title: Great Quick Stay
text: We loved this hotel. Warm and welcoming.  My son and I stayed for just a night and were on the go but it was a nice sanctuary for breaks.  Room was perfectly clean and pretty.  Our view was a courtyard of buildings which was nice because it was super quiet.  It's in a great location with tons to do right nearby.   The past 3 years we stayed down the street and loved that hotel but wanted a change.  Happy we did.  Very hospitable staff. We had breakfast in the morning before we took off and it was very fresh and excellent with a great server.   We would definitely stay here again. Truly a peaceful friendly place.

title: Great location
text:
Hotel is conveniently located at Times Sq within minutes of shopping and billboards. No lobby but all staffs were very friendly and helpful. Never once you feel clueless. Loved the vibes. 

Room assigned was rather small. Basically only a queen bed occupies the whole area. Be prepared but what makes up is clean and artfully decorated room. Toilet is functional too. No amenities though.

$25 a night resort fee is charged but comes with continental breakfast (top up is possible for better selection) and wifi and as well 2 bottled water per day. 

Overall recommended hotel.

title: Fabulous restaurant
text:
I enjoyed the best breakfasts and dinners at the Merrion.  All very innovative, beautifully cooked and presentation was just right.
The setting is a pure delight, with lovely lighting, including candles in the evening. Nice paintings/prints depicting Ireland.
The waitresses are so delightful, friendly and very welcoming. Irish of course!
Really made my trip to New York pleasant.

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
Wow where to start...
We were welcomed on arrival ahead of the check in time and were warmly greeted with our room being ready. What a lovely stylish room it was too. The bed and pillows omg to die for so comfy! 
The bar staff were super friendly with their selection of drinks and cocktails. 
The location is just fantastic. I was a little concerned as to if we'd be in a good area and we were not disappointed being in the centre of everything. Managed to sleep perfectly without any noise issues that I know can be a problem being in the heart of the city. 
The continental breakfast is a perfect start to the day. 
Every staff member is a credit to this wonderful hotel always happy and polite. 
Working in travel I'm picky with hotels but would definitely stay here again and wouldn't hesitate to recommend this fantastic hotel.

title: Wonderful Stay in November
text:
This is a gem in the middle of the chaos that is NYC. A short block from Times Square. The staff are especially accommodating and helpful. Nice public house area and the King bedroom was outstanding ,modern and very clean. A special thanks to Linda who unfortunately is heading back to Ireland soon. Macys parade was at end of the block.
We did enjoy or stay very much. Thanks again.

title: Excellent Location, Wonderful Hotel Experience
text: We booked this hotel for two nights over the Thanksgiving holiday. All we had to do was turn left out of the hotel and walk a minute to get to the parade route! It is located right in Midtown at 45th and 7th/6th Avenues so it is right next to Times Square, but you’d never know it as it’s nicely tucked away from all the bright lights and crowds. The rooms are great-the decor really is representative of traditional Irish hospitality. Staff were helpful and friendly-we’d definitely stay here again!

title: Amazing boutique hotel
text:
Where do we start....at the beginning would be good! 
A warm welcome from Joseph as we came through the door, friendly and very helpful. 
We were given the keys to a cosy room for two, small but perfectly formed, on the 5th floor. 
Throughout our stay the staff were extremely welcoming, helpful and friendly. We mostly dealt with Joseph, Ciere, Linda and Hugh who were happy to chat and guide us with local information etc....were also pretty good at serving the tipple of our choice for several evenings 😉🥂
The food in the restaurant is spot on, in a city serving burgers and fast food at every turn, it was great to have some Irish classics, and I can definitely recommend their curry! 
The free breakfast is a continental, comprising of a croissant, boiled egg and a fruit bowl. If this doesn’t take your fancy you can also order from the menu at extra cost. 
To sum it up, if your looking to stay in New York, close to the hustle and bustle of time square, but far enough away to have peace and relaxation, then look no further! The decoration is spot on, the hotel is in great condition and is very comfy/cosy. 

Great hotel
Great atmosphere
Great staff
Great food
Great drinks

We are pretty picky when choosing hotels, and I’d happily recommend this to anyone, and will return ourselves in the future.

title: Girls Getaway
text: The hotel was cozy, the bed was comfy, the service was superb, the food was delicious and the location was convenient! I wouldn’t change a thing (except maybe a little soundproofing in the walls) and would go back without hesitation.

title: Outstanding Discovery
text:
Wonderful service, very quiet confortable room, lovely bar and resturant right in Midtown head shoulders better than all the name brands I have frequented in the past!
Yhis is now my go to when in NYC and recommending to my collegues as well. A wonderful surprise for a last minute trip.

title: Fantastic location-
text: We really enjoyed our stay at Merrion Row. Very close to everything but quiet and peaceful inside the room. Staff was very pleasant and helpful. They did an amazing job of cleaning our room daily. The reason for 4 stars and not 5 is due to the “urban fee” of $25 per night that you are NOT told about prior to your visit. They practice false advertising in their pricing online. This is not legal! The food in the restaurant was fantastic although we received very poor service from the blonde waitress at the restaurant. She seemed to forget about us constantly and this happened on 2 visits. My husband’s order was wrong, our drinks were empty and my husband had to keep getting up to go to the bar to ask for items, even the check.

title: Hospitality, convenience and style
text: My stay was wonderful and all of the staff was terrific - from check in to check out.  Friendly, warm, efficient and very very helpful.  The room was beautifully appointed, the bed was comfy and the bathroom was stylish and spotless.  The location can't be beat - steps from Times Sq, Rock Center, MoMA and 5th Ave shopping.  I enjoyed it so much I booked another longer stay in December!

title: Perfect in every way
text: I know I’m not the first one with this title but nothing could sum it up better. Clean as could be. As welcoming as it could be. The food is as delicious as it could be. The design taste is practical and beautiful. The staff is as friendly and cheerful as could be. Fair-sized rooms. Quality construction.

title: Small in size, mighty in customer care
text: This small Time Square boutique hotel felt special from the moment I enter the lobby and check into my room that was decorated smart and tastefully.  The team showed  up for me in a big way when I left my prescription glasses behind and on Saturday, they went over and above to find a way to get them sent over night to the west coast.  Great attitude, good food.  I will be back.

title: Première super visite de New York !
text:
Emplacement idéal en plein cœur de New York (Empire State building, superbe Gare de New York, 5ème Avenue.... etc...).
Personnel très agréable et accueillant, à l’écoute.
Ambiance familiale et détendue.
Propreté irréprochable.
Au cœur de Times Square mais au calme !

title: Séjour parfait
text: Rien à reprocher emplacement parfait personnel agréable chambre spacieuse avec de la place salle de bain parfaite hôtel calme petit déjeuner copieux personnel sympathique proche Time square et Broadway

title: Beautiful hotel, fantastic location, amazing hospitality!
text:
A beautiful boutique hotel, in a fantastic location 2 mins from Times Square, the Merrion Row, NYC is home away from home,  The understated glamour and relaxing vibe make it a haven after a hard day's shopping & sightseeing in NYC. 

The stylish bedrooms were immaculate with everything you possibly need, charging points, extremely comfortable beds and no noise despite being a 30 second walk from Broadway..

The staff cannot do enough for you and nothing is too much trouble. The food is also amazing, especially the breakfasts.

This is the only place to stay in NYC. I can't recommend it highly enough.

title: Quietness, style & polite staff
text: Recommend highly. This is a small charming hotel in the theater district. The room is decorated with stylish European comfort. The bathroom is roomy and has a tasteful decor. The comfortable bed is dressed with high quality linen.  The furniture looks clean and well care for. The clients here are quiet. Frank and Joseph are 2 polite young men at the front desk, and Leesa. One night, the ac in my room broke. In the early morning, Reina , the amazing hands-on manager (truly an Exceptional leader) sent 2 persons into my room to help me move into another room with speed. The bar area has its own subtle charm and the adjacent garden room is always bright and cheerful,  even on a miserable wet rainy day. We stayed here for 5 nights and my boyfriend slept so well here that he said he could stay for 2 more weeks. We really enjoyed eating at 'Glass House Tavern', 'Trattoria Trecolori'

title: Perfect in every way!!!
text: My daughters and I just spent a 3-day weekend in NYC and thoroughly enjoyed staying here. We felt very welcome from the first minutes, and we got to know most of the staff at the desk, in the restaurant, etc. They were very helpful! The place is immaculate, rooms are spacious for NYC, and the restaurant is reasonably priced and terrific! 1 block from Times Square, but very quiet and peaceful. A+++

title: Wow - what a fantastic hotel and staff!
text: I feel I would be doing the Merrion Row and its awesome staff a disservice by not reviewing our recent trip. Location, quality of the rooms, cleanliness, lobby area, restaurant and pub were all faultless, but the greatest asset is the staff. To an individual, they could not have been more friendly, professional or helpful - not what one necessarily expects in a big city. Merrion Row has really got the formula right, and I genuinely could not suggest anyway to improve the experience. Look forward to our next stay. Thank you!

title: Perfectly located for out of towners
text: Great location, friendly staff, good soundproofing from the busy Times Square area, comfortable beds.  Really liked the proximity to several subway stops.  Although the room was compact it was very functional.  Excellent WiFi.  Good value for a high priced area in Manhattan.  The bathroom was a good size, although the ventilation not sufficiently robust.  Nice breakfast options.  Would definitely return.

title: Absolutely loved this hotel!
text:
This was my first trip ever to NYC and I couldn’t have been more pleased with our accommodations. We were there for 5 days/4 nights. The hotel was beautifully decorated, quaint, clean, cozy, it smelled nice, and the staff was extremely friendly, welcoming, and accommodating. We probably had the most interaction with Frank (front desk) over the course of our stay and he was wonderful. Very friendly and helpful and just a pleasure to interact with overall. 

I was equally as pleased with the food. I had the continental breakfast the first morning and really enjoyed it. The second morning I branched out though and tried the lemon ricotta pancakes and the American bacon. O. M. G. Those pancakes were FABULOUS!  I ate them for breakfast 3 days in a row. Ciera (not sure of spelling) was my server each morning and she was lovely.  The combination of the food, service, and cozy atmosphere was a great way to start each morning!

As for the room itself, it was beautiful and comfortable. I loved the view of the courtyard/restaurant from our window. The room was also very well insulated from any street noise or noise from other guests other than the rare sound of a door closing next door. 

Now onto one of the most important factors for me: the bed was extremely comfortable! I’ve had 2 spine surgeries and often find it very hard to get comfortable when I’m sleeping. I slept like a champ every single night of our stay!  If that had not been the case my trip wouldn’t have been as enjoyable. 

I would highly recommend Merrion Row to anyone traveling to New York and have actually already recommended them to all of my friends on Facebook. I sincerely hope to stay there again someday.

title: Fantastic!
text: I booked one night as a last minute. What a fantastic surprise. Everything about this place was great! Will stay there again. The rooms are fairly new and comfortable. The ambiance was great. They had room service with great food. Just fantastic.

title: Mother/Daughter Getaway
text:
Merrion Row Hotel was awesome, so beautiful, so cozy. We totally enjoyed the Public House.  The bartender, Hugh, was so friendly and knowledgeable about New York.  Our waitresses were extremely nice, Linda and Chiera.  But most importantly, the front office staff, Frank and Joseph, were most accommodating.  They supplied us with a refrigerator , helped us with our heat in the room, our travel arrangements to and from the airport, and printed our boarding passes, etc., etc.  

The food, at the Public House was amazing, especially the smoked salmon and beet hummus.  All of the meals were outstanding.  

The location was fabulous, so close to Times Square.  We will definitely stay at Merrion Row in the future.

title: New Boutique Hotel In Theatre District
text: Spent a long weekend in NYC with family. Took in a show on Sunday, Lady Liberty on Monday and basketball at MSG on Tuesday night. I favor boutique hotels over larger hotel chains because of the personal connection you make with hotel staff. Merrion Row staff was welcoming, super nice and accommodated every request we made during our stay. Location was close to subway, great resturaunts and Broadway shows. Beds were very comfortable, room equipped with a large flat screen TV and nice size shower. For our purposes, it checked all the boxes and I would visit again.

title: Absolutely outstanding staff and a nice boutique hotel!
text: Staff were amazing from start to finish of my stay - always helpful and ready to provide any information needed. Hotel itself was small but nice, very well laid out and nice contemporary decor. The superior king room was slightly smaller than expected and didn't have much storage space for clothes but overall very pleased and was worth the money.

title: What a wonderful find this was!
text:
We loved our stay at this hotel! We would absolutely recommend it. From the moment we walked in, Frank at the front desk was wonderful and accommodating, and this continued every day. He thoroughly explained the “Urban Fee” that we were going to be charged and what it covered ahead of time, so there were no surprises. The bar staff (specifically Ciera and Hugh) were super friendly and prompt. It’s an Irish hotel, and many of the staff are from Ireland. 

The mattresses were super comfortable. In fact, my sister (who has a stress fracture in her neck) said it was the best she had slept in a long time, and even asked for the name of it (Casper)!There was lots of lighting in the room, but blacked out for late sleeping, and we loved how quiet it was -no hall noise-and being able to look over the courtyard/bar.

I had never been in a wet room before and kept looking for a shower curtain or shower door - There’s not one. There was no fan in the bathroom, which was our main issue -with no shower door or curtain and no ventilation, it stayed foggy and damp. It looks like there may be a place for one that just hasn’t been put in yet. But the hot water and pressure were good (takes a while to warm up, but feels great). They brought us a mini-fridge for our ice packs and my daughter’s milk. 
The breakfast menu was delicious, but the continental breakfast (which is included in that Urban Fee) was a bit lacking. I don’t eat boiled eggs, and that was the offering every day, along with fresh fruit and a pastry. It is a beautiful boutique hotel, so it needs to be simple, not a big buffet. It’s not really kid friendly (which I’m fine with -although Frank was very friendly to my daughter and gave her hotel chocolate all the time!). We easily went next door to Cranberry and got muffins and bagels and fruit, so it was really fine. I recommend this place wholeheartedly and will absolutely tell my friends and book it next time I am in NY. You can beat the location-1/2 block off Times Square.

title: A secret gem near Time Square
text: A real gem, boutique hotel experience really close to Time Square. A really friendly and personalized service, dedicated staff and delicious home-made food. It's like being at home in the center of NYC. Will go back next time in I'm in town.

title: Excellent Location, Friendly Staff
text:
The location is perfect for Broadway shows and walking to shopping and restaurants.  The hotel is small enough to offer personal attention and seems like a European hotel.  The room that we had was compact and the one complaint was that the HVAC system would direct cool air at your heads while sleeping, which would seem to be fixable.
The continental breakfast included a hard-boiled egg, a small dish of mixed fruit, and a mini-croissant, plus coffee or tea.  Other options were available and were more substantial.

title: Accueil au top
text:
Pas grand chose à redire.
Accueil très chaleureux 
Service au top
Chambre un tout petit peut petite pour 4 avec les valises (que nous avons mis sous le lit 👌)
Juste le canapé lit un peu dure pour les enfants donc à proscrire pour grande personne.
Le grand lit au top 👍
Établissement cocooning loin des grandes chaînes sans âme.
Rapport qualité prix correct et vous êtes au centre de New York.
Nous vous conseillons de prendre une carte de métro et vous serez à moins de 15mn des toutes les grandes attractions de Manhattan.

title: IRELAND COMES TO TIME SQUARE!
text: Every year my wife and I take turns planning a surprise trip for our anniversary.  This year was my turn and I chose NYC for the location and tickets to "To Kill A Mockingbird" on Broadway.  I then did a search of hotels close to Broadway and came upon this little gem.  As my wife and I both LOVE Ireland this was an easy choice.  What a wonderful experience!  Tucked away less then 5 minutes walk from the Shubert theater and Time Square this cozy inn is a true taste of Ireland from the accommodating staff, to the menu in the restaurant, to the whiskeys in the bar, EVERYTHING reminds us of the hotels and inns in Ireland.  The rooms are tastefully done and extremely comfortable.  Now, that being said, they are small in size compared to what some people are used to but keep in mind, your in the heart of New York City!  And also, anyone who has traveled to Europe will tell you as well, the rooms in their hotels are smaller.  They do offer valet parking for a fee, however, be prepared for sticker shock if you drive in.  Do what we did, take Amtrak into Penn Station and grab a cab for the 10-15 minute ride to the hotel.  Food in the restaurant is top notch, AND AUTHENTIC!  Being a food snob I get tired of American Irish pubs trying to pass off "Shepherd's pie" using ground beef instead of lamb.  Not at the Public House.  A lovely presentation of traditonal Shepherd's Pie complete with ground lamb and all the traditional veggies and gravy, absolutely delicious.  Their take on a Traditional Irish Breakfast is spot on, though they also add baked beans to theirs, which is more of an English thing.  The white and black puddings are as good as any I have had over in Ireland.  I was introduced to a new Irish Whiskey in the bar that has become my instant favorite, "Egans".  Smooth with a slight sweet after taste.  Its the first whiskey I have been able to drink neat.  I can go on and on about how great this little 28 room hotel is but I think you get the idea.  The next time you're looking for a trip to NYC, visit Ireland in Time Square, it will become your new home in New York just as it has become ours.

title: Weekend in the city
text: Awesome little boutique hotel 3 blocks from Rockefeller Center, 1/2 block from Times Square and you would Never know it. Very quiet, clean and a restaurant to die for. All the servers we had were From Ireland. The bed was firm, just like we like, and though we reserved a smallish room, it is NY, we were quite happy with it. The first night the wife found the pillow was to big and the second they brought her one that was perfect. Service was top notch I gave the hotel contact info to our Christie’s specialist as a recommended place to stay, I will stay here again our next trip.

title: Bucket List Trip
text:
Our great friends and us booked this “Bucket List” Trip wanting to visit the Big Apple and see the many awesome places it has to offer. I am so happy we booked our hotel with Merrion Row and Public House! I classify this hotel as  “Chic Boutique” with a taste of Irish tradition. Most of all, I cannot say enough compliments about Raina and her staff! They are the nicest and most helpful staff we’ve ever encountered, and we have traveled to many places! Even the final day when we had a 6:15 AM pickup for the airport, they found time to get coffee for us! Maybe a small gesture to some, but much appreciated by half awake travelers 😀
I saw where some reviewers mentioned the small rooms, but welcome to NYC, as most are not very large. The rooms are quite adequate and are nicely appointed. The only recommendation I would have is a slightly larger armoire to hang and store more clothes. Not a knock, but something us bigger guys like.
The restaurant and bar was very nice and again the staff was wonderful! Taking care of our breakfast to dinner or appetizer needs in a quick manner. Always with a smile and asking if everything met our expectations. I’ve always heard that the Irish are nice and congenial people, and we found out first hand as much of the staff were from Ireland. Linda and Ciera were very helpful and always smiling! Great job Raina on hiring such a wonderful staff! 😀
If you’re going to book a hotel in Midtown, close to Time Square and many more attractions, I highly recommend Merrion Row and Public House! Enjoy your first pint on the House!

title: A Piece of Irish Charm in the Heart of Times Square
text:
I'm in a quandary, if I tell you how great your hotel is, then we'll never get a room again. My husband and I just returned from a spectacular two days in the Big Apple (despite the weather) and the best part was staying at your hotel. The rooms (while a little small) are lovely, thoughtfully designed and very comfortable. The bathroom was great, the toiletries lush and the water pressure (always an issue in the city) perfect. Despite being steps from Times Square, our room was very peaceful. The pub was a great experience and the food is very good with some authentic Irish dishes. Best of all though, the staff, all pleasant, courteous, funny and a blast with which to deal.

Keep up the good work and we will be back!

title: Exceptional Staff
text: We have just returned from a brilliant 3 night stay at the perfect Merrion Row Hotel and Public House at Times Square. In many years travelling it is hard to remember staying in a better hotel. Located a 2 minute walk from the heart of Times Square it is remarkable that you can enjoy such peace and quiet here. The hotel is chic, smart, intimate and carefully looked after by the amazing team. Rooms contain all that you need for a City Break and are meticulously looked after. Breakfast options are varied and food in the evening ranges from snacks to full meals. All the food we had was beautiful. Without doubt the main strength of the hotel  (and there are many) is the staff team. From Frank, Joseph and Alexis in the Customer Services department through to Linda at breakfast and Hugh in the bar, all the staff are friendly, helpful and genuinely curious about how your stay is going. They offered advice, enquired about our plans and checked on our activities throughout our stay. We encountered an unparalleled personal touch which will ensure that we return again. A huge thanks to all at the Merrion Row for making our stay in NYC so special.

title: Friendliest most courteous staff I’ve ever seen
text: Terrific locations, steps from Times Square. Quiet isolation despite location gave “ homey” b&b feel. Staff extremely helpful, courteous and consistently goes”extra mile”. Food and bar excellent service

title: Beautiful hotel, excellent location
text:
An absolute gem of a hotel, which is so close to Times Square. Beautifully decorated throughout, our room was extremely comfortable and kept very clean.
The staff are extremely attentive and we received a warm welcome whenever we entered the bar or dining area.
Lots of personal touches made this a stay to remember; we received a bottle of bubbly as the hotel were aware that we were celebrating a special wedding anniversary. 
We would definitely recommend Merrion Row.

title: Perfection! I want Merrion Row to stay a secret
text: beautiful boutique hotel was tucked away off TSQ but incredibly quiet. Convenient to theatre for Wicked and with two teenage girls it was an easy walk up to 5th Avenue to The Met next day. My girls even commented how nice & friendly everyone was. Staff was eager to share history and pointed out exposed bedrock of Manhattan downstairs. It's hard to describe how attentive & genuine our experience was.Did I mention how quiet and cozy it was inside? Room was clean & tastefully decorated and very comfortable bed. Excellent service, delicious food at public house and if you've been to Ireland you'll love their special touches (welcome pint, Irish radio station and photos throughout). Upon our welcome I was certain I died and went to heaven: U2 was playing, I was given a complimentary pint of Guinness and staff handed me some chocolate. Trust me its gorgeous, personalized service that is rarely experienced anymore and you'd never know you were feet from TSQ once you're inside. Loved Merrion Row Hotel! We will be back!

title: Great small hotel
text: Came to the city for our anniversary. Wanted to see Hamilton(less than 2 blocks away). Location is excellent between 6th and Broadway, near Times Square. Small boutique hotel with only 28 rooms, but the intimate setting is part of what sets this hotel apart from so many. It allows a level of service not seen in other places. For example, we had the "do not disturb" sign on the door, so houskeeping honored that but hung fresh towels in a bag on the door for us. That was a step beyond. The bar area was nice with a good selection of cocktails and beers. EVERY staff member was friendly and went out of their way to be helpful in any way they could. The room was comfortable, clean, well appointed, and of very reasonable size. We were quite pleased and absolutely will stay here again when we return to New York. A big thank you to the entire staff, you made our trip!

title: In NYC for a couple of plays.
text:
"To Kill a Mockingbird" was the top of our list of things to do so the location of the hotel was perfect. A very easy walk to Times Square and Rockefeller Center which meant all of the Broadway plays, amazing restaurants and fun bars were not far from the hotel door .. no long expensive cab rides to do what we had planned.
From the first greeting to the last goodbye the staff at the hotel were all very accommodating .. personable.
The restaurant and pub are comfortable and lively and the food was delicious .. from the breakfast sandwiches we had in the morning to the crab cakes we had for dinner one evening.
I know we will be returning for another stay at this hotel.

title: Awesome Atmosphere
text: Visited the bar with a few colleagues for happy hour.  The staff was very polite and accommodating.  Food and service was excellent. I have no complaints and would absolutely return on a more frequent basis.

title: Love this hotel!
text: I truly loved the experience at this hotel. If you're into sophisticated luxury and unique places I recommend you stay here. The decor was luxurious with has delightful surprises in the style of the finishes and fixtures. The staff was great in particular Joseph and Frank at the reception desk are very helpful. This is the perfect spot if you want to be in the middle of the time square action but also want a little peace and quiet when its time to relax.

title: Charming, Hidden Gem in Times Square!
text: WOW!  Merrion Row Public House & Hotel absolutely blew us away!  This charming boutique hotel is located in the heart of Times Square, literally just 1/2 block away.  With only 28 rooms, consider yourself LUCKY if you’re able to snag one of these rooms!!  The entire hotel is gorgeously decorated, it’s inviting and welcoming.  The staff go above and beyond in every facet...they’re so personable, polite, and friendly.  The welcome pints of beer (or glass of wine if you choose) are a nice touch!  Over the course of 3 nights, it literally became to feel like home.  The included continental breakfast was fantastic each morning!  After a full day in the city, each afternoon we found ourselves longing for some rest and relaxation in the hotel bar, enjoying a pint of beer or a glass of Irish whiskey (go with the Egan’s!!), recharging, before venturing back out into the city each evening.  The hotel literally makes you feel like you’re in Ireland.  Love, love, love it!!  I’m going to recommend this hotel to everyone I know traveling to NYC!!   Don’t stay at the large chain hotels....stay here and get the ultimate experience!  The staff felt like family, and we were actually sad to leave!!  Shout outs to Linda, Hugh, and Joseph!  Thanks for an amazing stay!!

title: Literally amazing!!!
text:
I had an absolutely INCREDIBLE customer service experience with the staff at Merrion Row, specifically Joseph from guest services. He went above and beyond to make the stay for my parent’s wedding anniversary absolutely special.When they arrived there was a lovely array of macaroons and a sweet little poem…I couldn’t believe it! He setup the car from the airport with no problem, I was thrilled!
He let me know when they got to the hotel after taking a car for the very first time…I was so happy and they were so happy and felt so well taken care of.
I can’t say enough good things. They loved the hotel and said it was spectacular, I can’t wait to stay there the next time I’m in the city so I can give Joseph a hug and enjoy a stay at this hotel myself!!

title: Wonderful stay
text:
I just traveled for 2 nights with my 2 children and husband to merrion row hotel.  It is in a great location, perfect for walking from the train station , to times square and the theater district.  I absolutely loved the location we were able to walk everywhere easily without taking cabs.  
The hotel is very nicely decorated and smells great as soon as you walk in the door.  It has a restaurant as well but we didn't have a chance to try that.  The rooms were clean and stylish.  The bathroom was gorgeous.  The two men at the front desk were always pleasant and helpful.  They also give free water and chocolates which my girls loved.
I would definitely come to this hotel again and recommend it to others.

title: Five star service!
text: Outstanding service! It was our first trip to New York and the staff was friendly and informative.  Prime location right next to time square.  The room is gorgeous. Pictures dont do it justice.  Loved it so much,we will be staying here on the next visit to the Big Apple.

title: What a find
text:
Less than a year old, the Merrion Row has completely redone a former inn just blocks away from Times Square.  The rooms are tastefully done, with everything new and spotless, and perfect location for a visit to the city.  Don't be concerned about being close to Times Square, our room was almost too quiet at night. All the staff go out of their way to be pleasant and helpful.  Especially Joseph who manned the front desk, and their restaurant server Linda.  Both always had a smile, a welcome greeting and made any request we made cheerfully done.  Great breakfast fare, and they have a "welcome pint" (choose Guinness of course) for a touch of Ireland. 
We can't wait to return.

title: Lovely Staff, Great Location
text: I stayed at the Merrion Row Hotel for 5 nights at the end of September, while on a business trip. I have tried many hotels in the area over the past few years, this is definitely one of the best. More than anything, the staff are amazing. They are friendly and accommodating, even called me by name (how do they remember??). I had an issue with the noise in my room at night and they speedily offered to switch rooms for me to a quieter room. The rooms are small (as they all are) but very comfortable with a nice sized shower/bathroom and all the facilities needed. I am definitely going back next time!

title: Pleasant Surprise in Great Location
text: I couldn’t have been happier!  I booked the Merrion because of its location and other reviews I read.   It opened in December 2018 so it was new and clean.  It only has 28 rooms and they look after them well.  The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom had a nice-sized walk in shower.   Traveling alone, I liked the fact that the elevator required the key card for access.   The front desk people were friendly and accommodating.   The food in the pub was great and the staff there was terrific too.  They had Irish radio playing which was an added touch. I received a welcome drink and continental breakfast, along with water in the room.   It was pouring out and they gave me an umbrella to use until I picked up my luggage.   I live in New Jersey but will be coming back for a night in the city with my husband so we can stay together at the Merrion.  It truly is a hidden gem!

title: Outstanding facility and services.
text:
This boutique hotel is located minutes away from Time Square.  The location is central and convenient as a hub for city site-seeing.

The room was excellent, nicely appointed, comfortable and the bathroom was beautiful.

The service is exceptional.  The front desk staff are welcoming, and very helpful.

The bar and restaurant staff are excellent.

The food is excellent as well.

title: Wonderful gem in the theater district
text: We had 3 delightful days at Merrion Row.  Everything was perfect -- it's brand new, very clean and smartly planned.  The staff is wonderful, the beds are comfy, the food is great, and we were utterly charmed.  terrific attention to detail and we LOVED everyone working at the hotel.  We'll be back again!

title: A calm oasis in the heart of madness.
text: A truly amazing stay at this lovely boutique hotel.Firstly the hotel was located on a quiet street,just 3 min from times square.in the theatre district.From the moment we arrived we were made to feel so welcome,there was a free drink at the bar for us and chocs in the room.The continental breakfast was good, we had scrambled eggs and bacon on two occasions and it was divine.The staff were very friendly and accommodating,especially Joseph and Troy.Hotel was spotless, bed comfortable,the room was nice and cool,with a spaciou bathroom.We truly enjoyed our stay at Merrion Row and would highly recommend it.

title: Couldn't have been happier!
text:
Times Square can be horribly loud and crazy, but this little hide away was a quiet gem!  The employees were kind and friendly, and the food was restaurant quality with a nice bar.

The bathroom counter had plenty of space for a couple's toiletries.  The closet is small and open but totally efficient for a short stay.

title: Magical stay, start to finish
text: Got a great last minute deal for a one night stay in early October with our 13 yo daughter. What a fabulous place! Felt so welcomed from the moment we walked in. Lovely, new and chic from top to bottom. Free upgrade to a king studio. Upbeat music in the elevator. Fabulous room and bathroom with state of the art lighting. The most comfortable bed with huge, fluffy pillows and magically soft sheets. Resort fee entitled us to a free welcome pint in the tavern, and perfect, fresh and delicious continental breakfast of fruit, croissant and egg in the light-filled atrium, served by our lovely Irish server. Excellent location, steps from Times Square. Really, I can’t say enough. Can’t wait to return!

title: Truly a hidden gem
text:
This place is truly a gem in NYC! I would never, ever, EVER think that I would have enjoyed a stay in a Times Square hotel, but this is truly an oasis despite being located in the middle of everything. Particularly good location for theater buffs. Shockingly quiet for its location. Not great for large groups or people who need tremendous amounts of space, but perfect for my wife and I who were in town sans kids for a quick Birthday trip.

But the most important benefit of this hotel is its staff. Franc and Joseph in the front are consummate pros. Every question or request was answered and fulfilled immediately and perfectly. Even things not requested were anticipated - we had left the “do not disturb” sign on our door while we were out. When we came back, there was a bag hanging on our door with extra towels and toiletries explaining that while they wished to honor our DND request, they didn’t want us to be without fresh supplies. I (okay, really my wife) enjoyed a delightful little birthday macaron plate mentioned in other reviews. We got extra pillows and another suitcase valet stand with a smile and only minutes after the request. Our bartender Hugh in the associated Public House was quick, accommodating, friendly, and massively entertaining. The young lady whose name I never got, who served us breakfast a couple times, was super friendly and efficient.

In short, we had an amazing time at Merrion Row. It was one of the finest service oriented establishments at which we have stayed, we wouldn’t hesitate to recommend it, and we will definitely be back!

title: Good hotel but not for everyone
text: I stayed at this hotel for one night for business. It’s a tiny and very clean hotel. Staff was nice and welcoming. Location is great right on 45th street between 6th and 7th ave. Saying that it’s not for everyone. It’s a very tiny hotel with tiny hall and one tiny elevator. No lobby. Breakfast starts at 7am thus, not for business travelers that need to leave before 7am. Breakfast was supposed to be included with the $25 resort fee they add to the bill however when I asked to get coffee at 6:45am I was told it would take 15 min to make which of course I did not have.

title: Row Hotel NY
text:
Rude stuff!
We were four friends in two rooms. 
The hotel has no lobby. There is a tiny space for maybe five people to sit. 
The rooms are small, claustrophobic and not clean. 
Don’t go there!
We were amazed how rude the stuff in the reception  was.

title: Great Property!
text: Perfect place to stay for a trip to NYC.  Staff is super friendly.  Small hotel so they know you by name and know what you like for breakfast.  Rooms are NYC size but very efficient.  Location is great, between Times Square and Fifth Avenue.  Highly recommend this as your NYC hotel.

title: Joseph D Suarez is this hotel's saving grace
text: I had to tweak and confirm some things with my 2 reservations for my stay during a very busy nyc travel week. My first call was rerouted to their central office and the lady i was connected was incredibly rude and her attitude was borderline offensive. After explaining myself to her for an hour and pleading to be connected with the hotel directly she finally told me there's nothing she can do and I need to speak to the hotel directly (eye roll, genius). I have no idea how she's employed in customer service and really hope our call was recorded and reviewed by her manager. I spoke to several people at the hotel who were also really rude and totally unhelpful. I was told they would call me back because they had to answer other calls and hung up on me. Shocker - they never called back. However, the reason why I'm not rating this with 1 star but 4 stars is solely due to 1 person: Joseph D Suarez. He gave me clear cut answers to what I thought were simple questions and in a very professional and courteous manner! He gave me his direct email and gave me confirmations of everything requested. I can't say enough good things about my communication with him. Joseph's peers can learn so much from him.

title: Unique NYC hotel experience
text: Brand new, only 30 lovely rooms, dead quiet despite only 100 yards from Times Square, and the most tremendous and helpful staff you could dream of. Seriously, where in NYC do you get such a personal and comfortable guest experience nowadays? Everything from arrival to departure was spotless. Rooms on Manhattan are generally small, so don´t expect any spacious monster suite. But expect a cozy, clean, functional and cool room that will do the job. Comfortable beds and large bathroom. The modern Irish touch, from the staff to the interior, is unmatched on this side of the Pond. I have stayed at many fancy, trendy hotels on Manhattan through the yeras (On Rivington, Bowery, Dream Downtown, Standard etc, and also lately Wythe and William Vale in Williamsburg). From now on, I will recommend ANYONE going to Manhattan for whatever reason to stay at the Merrion Row. It is truly unique. Not the cheapest, but worth every buck.

title: The Perfect Spot
text: With a distinct Irish flavor (many employees have a wonderful Irish accent), Merrion Row is the place to consider home. The building is old, yet completely redone with modern, stylish rooms.  It very close to everything, very quiet and a very charming place to stay. The continental breakfast is very nice with a full menu also offered. The service is excellent and sincere. We happen to be members of the Hyatt  which is down the Street, but would stay at the Merrion again anytime!

title: LOVED this hotel!
text: We recently stayed 4 nights at the Merrion Row Hotel. The staff were friendly, warm and accommodating. They made sure that our every need was met. The hotel was clean, stylish and comfortable. We loved the Irish feel! The location was perfect. All we had to do was walk out the door and begin our daily adventures. If we plan another trip to the Big Apple, we will definitely be staying at the Merrion Row again.

title: NYC
text:
The Merrion Row hotel is a redevelopment of an old building. The decor complimentary to the age of the building. From walking through the door there is a fantastic aroma. Every member of staff we came across from the moment we arrived to the moment we left were fantastic, nothing was too much and always done with a smile.
Hotel is quite small, but it has everything you need. Restaurant, bar with plenty of draught beers and a lounge area. There is a lovely covered courtyard where you can eat breakfast.
Our room was small less than 13’ square (4m)  with very little storage so lots of tripping over of suitcases. It was however clean and the bed very comfortable.
You are given vouchers when you  arrive for a welcome beer and “free breakfast “
The breakfast is small, a tiny amount of fruit and either danish or 2 slices toast. Extra slices $2 each 
I found it slightly annoying being billed a service charge on a free breakfast . I thought it was me just being British but over heard other guests commenting also.
Hotel is great for Broadway and Times Square, both are a 2mins walk.

title: Perfect stay at a perfect hotel!
text: We recently spent 14 nights at the Merrion Row and loved every single minute of our stay! The (mostly NY/Irish) staff were warm, genuine and welcoming and couldn’t do enough to make our stay perfect - it was like coming home to family when we arrived back at the hotel each day. The rooms are beautifully appointed, with some great design features to help a New York sized suite seem bigger than it was. Bed and bedding were very comfortable! We stayed in room 301 which faced the street but was whisper quiet! Our teenage daughter slept on the (large) sofa bed which was also very comfortable. It’s a boutique hotel with just 28 rooms and is superbly located in a busy area of New York, near all the attractions but is a calm, quiet and elegant oasis to come home to. The breakfast food was delicious, as was the dinner we ate there. The bar and restaurant are warm and inviting. Outdoor courtyard with a clear roof is a lovely place to dine. Highly recommended! We will be back!

title: The Merrion Row Hotel is perfect!
text: We spent 5 wonderful  nights at the Merrion Row Hotel in September.  I picked this hotel based on the reviews from several booking sites despite my hesitation at staying so near Time Square. The reviews were correct; it is perfect if you like elegance, personal service, warmth and friendliness from everyone who works there, beautiful clean rooms. A true sanctuary that allows you to enjoy the hustle and bustle of NYC knowing you can escape to the Merrion. We stayed in room 406 at the back of the hotel.  It was spacious, quiet and well designed with a large and beautiful bathroom.  The bed was very comfortable.  A few reviews mentioned “thin walls”, while we could here murmurs from next door it was not an issue.  I would like to thank everyone at the hotel for their friendliness and willingness to help. Our special trip to New York was all the more wonderful because we chose the Merrion Row Hotel.

title: Clean, Quaint and welcoming, Engaging Service Oriented Staff
text:
This is my second stay at the Merrion, it's a welcome home away from home.
The Hotel manager and her staff are extremely customer service oriented.
I highly recommend it as I've done all the big hotels, the Merrion just provides that extra layer of comfort at the end of a busy day

title: I cannot rate it high enough
text:
From the moment I arrived and inhaled the amazing scents of this hotel to the "Welcome Pint" and included amazing breakfast, from the wonderful staff, housekeeping, front desk and wait staff at the hotel bar and restaurant, this place is simply amazing. The rooms are elegant and the use of space is fantastic, Super clean and new.

This is a 5++ star hotel in my opinion and it is not to be missed. It is around the corner from times square, but inside thew hotel you feel like you are miles away form everything as it is quiet and relaxing.

If you like Noodles do not miss Xi'an Famous Foods up the street!

title: Perfection!
text: My sister and I took my parents to NYC to celebrate their 50th anniversary with a Broadway show and lunch at Le Bernardin.  We couldn't have been happier that we stayed at Merrion Row.  Frank (and every staff member we encountered) was so thoughtful and made my parents feel very special.  The hotel is beautifully decorated; the rooms are cozy and light-filled (and spotless!), and the location is perfect.  It's small - just 24 rooms - but is designed so that you don't feel cramped in any way.  Many thanks to Merrion  Row for the beautiful Irish hospitality and welcome - we will be back!!

title: A gem of a Hotel
text:
An excellent hotel, made special by the super staff. Every staff member
was friendly, helpful, efficient and obviously proud to work at the hotel. Service also first class, if
you asked for anything within minutes it arrived. The rooms are small, but designed to maximise
the space, modern and  spotless. The hotel is very close to Times Square, but we had no noise issues and it was handy for the subway and of course Broadway.
The bar and entrance to the hotel are welcoming and stylish. We would certainly be happy to stay again at the Merrion Row.

title: Highly recommend
text: This hotel is absolutely perfect in every way! It’s perfect for couples and family’s. We stayed here for a week and didn’t want to leave. Every single memeber of staff here made us feel at home and nothing was ever too much trouble. It’s a perfect location to do anything, Central Park, Times sqaure, Broadway is only around the corner. The rooms are spotless and the beds are super comfy!! Breakfasts are great and so is the bar! Wouldn’t stay anywhere else now when we come to New York.

title: Perfect!
text: We chose this hotel from an endless list of possibilities.My husband and I had wonderful experience here.This is a small hotel,very warm and welcoming.We were greeted warmly upon check-in. Our room was lovely. The king size bed comfortable.We were surprised to find personal welcoming touches. The bathroom was beautiful and everything extremely clean and neat. The hotel has a bar and small restaurant on the property. We had a delicious breakfast in the morning and enjoyed some time spent at the bar. Every employee we encountered made us feel so welcome. They are excellent ambassadors for the Merrion Row Hotel. There is no doubt that we will be back. If you are looking for a small,intimate hotel with outstanding staff then you will love the Merrion Row Hotel and Public House.

title: Location n Friendliness
text: Our experience of this hotel was amazing, staff were so friendly and helpful from start to finish.  Room was ideal with comfortable bed and so clean. Breakfast v good and location was just perfect for us , ie beside Time Square Subway Broadway Central Park etc etc and of course shopping in Maceys,.   We definitely will be staying again.

title: Absolutely Lovely!
text: Beautifully decorated rooms and lobby. I loved having breakfast under the glass ceiling. Room was well designed with space to put out toiletries. Lovely lobby bar and work area to grab a drink or cappuccino. I loved the Irish music playing in the elevator. Bed was very comfortable and rooms were very quiet- can't believe I was so close to Times Square.

title: I didn't want to leave!
text: I didn't want to leave! The entire staff were so kind and thoughtful and went above and beyond. I enjoyed just talking to them! The location is ideal, close too Times Square and the Theater District but the hotel was so quiet. My room was small but the design is so well thought out. The bathroom is just gorgeous and the bed and linens and amenities were first rate. The food is tasty and the bar makes a great latte. As nice as the hotel and amenities are, it's the staff that really create a most memorable stay. Thank you everyone for being so nice and caring and kind! You helped make my trip a great one!

title: Sanctuary
text: We visited the restaurant and sat outside under the porch/conservatory. We picked the restaurant after looking at the menu online. After eating our way through so much pasta, pizza, burgers and really rich food it was lovely to see such things as shepherds pie. ( a taste of home). The service was impeccable, truly friendly but not overbearing. The only down side is that we thought it was a tad expensive compared with other restaurants in the area.

title: Great Place Near Times Square
text: Service was first rate. Room was very quiet, super clean, and nicely decorated. My husband and I had tickets to a Broadway play and everything we wanted was within easy walking distance. It has a lovely bar and the drinks were excellent. Dinner and breakfast offerings were very good too. We plan to stay here again!

title: Lovely, homey, and comfortable hotel
text: We were hoping to find a clean, not too shabby, hotel in our price range. We got much more than that. Merrion Row is freshly remodeled with wood floors instead of carpeting, generous bathrooms, and an attractive combination of modern/traditional design. It's very conveniently located.The service is outstanding, warm and friendly. We stayed for a full week and felt right at home.

title: Hidden gem amongst the chaos!
text:
The reviews speak for themselves. First class welcome and service from Franc and Joseph on reception, great chat and service in the bar with Hugh, room immaculate throughout. Classy take on a prominent hotel and street in Dublin, the Guinness wouldn't be too out of place versus Toners, O'Donoghues et al either.

Connolly's Bar next door well worth a visit also, Adam and the crew will look after you.

Looking forward to coming back on my next trip

title: Fantastic Hotel
text:
My husband and I had a very enjoyable holiday in New York. And Merrion Row made it extra special . The staff in this hotel are excellent.  We met Troy on our arrival. What a gentleman.  Made us feel right at home. Joseph and Frank were so helpful  giving us great site seeing advice. What can I say about the bar and restaurant staff, brilliant so nice and professional.  Huge,John,Linda,Ciere, Kellyanne. 
Thank you. Our room was lovely and had everything we wanted.and so clean. We were so near to Time Square, and that gives you access  to so much.We won't stay anywhere else in New York after finding this paradise. Roll on next year. Thanks Bernie.

title: Great Hotel, Great Location, Good Food, Friendly Staff and free wi-fi -  Would definitely recommend ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
text:
This is a lovely hotel, the staff are all welcoming and friendly.  Rooms are just as seen in the photos and very clean no issues here....with it being located just off Time Square we did not have any issues sleeping and the comfy beds also helped with this.  Good location for walking to most of New York’s attractions. Good food at the hotels restaurant and the complimentary breakfast is a nice way to start off your day.  I would definitely recommend this hotel and would return..
Thank you for making our first time New York experience a good one 👍 Tina UK 🇬🇧

title: A hotel? A home! Wonderful hotel, fabulous staff and flawless accommodations
text:
We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at your hotel and I can strongly encourage anyone to choose the Merrion Row Hotel and Public House - for their own benefit.

Troy, who greeted us upon arrival, was a fantastic representative of your hotel and does live by all values and standards a guest could hope for and a hotel could seek for. He is courteous, caring, diligent and funny. It didn't feel like checking into a hotel, rather being welcomed to our new home for the very first time and that welcome being held by a family friend. Every hotel and every guest should be entitled to "a Troy" - he was fabulous. 

Our room was immaculate. Hotels in NYC are, in many respects, difficult, especially when it comes to the standard of cleanliness and the wear-and-tear on furniture (in a bad way) and I have been on a streak of bad luck, despite 4* and 5* hotels. Your interior designer deserves an award. Your housekeeping staff has maintained the level of cleanliness that I seek to maintain at home. Even smaller things, such as your iron and ironing board, were above what I see in NYC hotels.

The barkeepers are a good chat; the vibrant crowd guarantees a good chat with NYC-locals who like to visit the bar for their after-work drinks.

We will most certainly be returning during our next visit and I will continue to recommend your hotel among family & friends.

title: Sunday Brunch
text: We had a wonderful brunch for 8 at the Public House.  The light, airy space paired with a few brunch cocktails and super friendly staff made for a perfect start to Sunday.  The menu had a nice selection, with the option for bottomless mimosa/bloodies.

title: Maravilloso en todo sentido!
text:
Hotel acogedor, elegante realmente encantador.
Comimos varias veces, la sopa de tomates deliciosa, la hamburguesa Beyond. Muy ricos sus french toast. 
Bien atendido muy simpáticos y servicial todo
 su personal, cien por ciento
 recomendable.
Volvería de todas maneras.

title: Truly exceeded all expectations
text: Joseph and all the team made us totally at home from the first minute. The service we received at all times was so friendly and personal - plus a welcome drinks.  The room was at the rear of the hotel and was very clean, comfortable and quiet. The superb Irish breakfast really set us for a long day exploring all the must see attractions which are genuinely within walking distance and the Times Square metro very close by to easily reach other destinations. The theatres are also on the door step. The hotel is ideally situated just off Times Square and just far enough away to avoid the crowds so was a perfect base for our four night stay. Would not hesitate to stay there again and can absolutely recommend the Merrion Row hotel - a little gem

title: Incredible experience!
text: We were at Merrion for just one night but I will come back for sure! The room was both beautiful and comfortable, the breakfast simply delicious (try the avocado toast and the lemon pancakes) and the staff very kind. Highly recommend!

title: Hidden Gem
text: Hosted a business function for 25 people in the atrium room. The Hors d’oeuvres were awesome. We ordered mini crab cakes, kale and vegetable dumplings, short rib waffle sliders, beef tenderloin tips, and vegetable tacos. What a hit, with the short rib waffle sliders getting the highest rating. I would highly recommend either having lunch or dinner here, or better yet, hosting a function in this private room. Great food and OUTSTANDING service.

title: Excellent Stay
text: Had a wonderful stay at Merrion Row. Such a unique place with a comfortable feel. Reina, Hugh and staff were incredibly helpful and welcoming. Rooms were very clean and spacious enough for a boutique experience. Also, pre-check in was incredibly convenient. Looking forward to my next stay.

title: Lovely boutique hotel in the heart of Times Square
text:
Can’t say enough about this hotel. The staff were wonderfully inviting and professional 
 The room was large and impeccably clean.  The included breakfast in the beautiful glassed in restaurant was lovely. And the welcome pint an awesome touch.

title: Excellence All Around!
text: I’m so sorry it has taken me a month to get to this review!! I had been watching Merrion Row online since it opened last year and have wanted to stay there ever since! I had the opportunity to stay a night and it was fantastic! We do travel to the city 1-2 times a year, and room size in the city can be small. On top of that, I’m picky when it comes to accommodations. I do not need luxury, but cleanliness and well appointed basics matter to me. Our room had a window seat overlooking 45th St. and I absolutely LOVED the room, the flooring, bedding and the bathroom! We were meeting up with family who were staying close by, and when they came in with us, they were in awe and wished they would’ve stayed the week at Merrion Row instead of where they were! The service was outstanding! Each employee was kind and made sure we had everything we needed. I had trouble working the thermostat, so mgmt came in as we went to dinner and it was perfect upon our return. The bar is charming, the patio area is so cute! I’m sorry we didn’t have time to sample their food... next time, though!!! Because there will definitely be a next time!  Outstanding Merrion Row! Thank you!! Will be back soon!!!

title: A great staff and more...
text:
The Merrion Row staff bent over backwards to help us through a mixed up hotel reservation. It was the Saturday night of Labor weekend, and finding a hotel was not easy.
The mix up was never the hotel's fault, and we will definitely visit Merrion Row again.
The place is spotless, the food is great, but again the service and staff are the best. Valet parking was easy and quick. One of the nicest hotels in NYC, and I've been to a lot of them over the last 30 years. 
Great menu, great quality, great atmosphere. Looking forward to staying there next time I'm in the city. Adjusted their menu for me too.  It's a cozy little classic, a gem in the Theater district.

title: Fantastic Hotel!
text: this hotel is a 10 out of 10.  We arrived about 3:45 and our room was available so we were able to check in right away. We received an email the night before to pre- check in which was convenient.   The person who checked us in was very welcoming and did a great job.   It’s a quaint, charming Irish hotel.  Yes, it is small but it’s New York!  We were in a king studio on the 4 th floor.  I liked that you could take the stairs or the elevator.  The staircase is incredibly charming. The walls are brick and they have very interesting  art work. The carpet on the stairs is a runner.  Again, a nice design feature.  The hallways are narrow but not surprising for a New York hotel.  They were clean and I love the white doors.  They looked like doors you would see in a condo versus a hotel.  The rooms were compact but we had plenty of room for the two of us.  I was impressed with how they stored the luggage rack.  The beds were super comfortable and the sheets were high end and felt great.  I am very picky and have to say this is one of my favorite hotels.  It’s off a side street in Times Square. We came to see a show and the location was perfect fir the theater district.  We walked to our theater in 10 minutes.  We had dinner and breakfast at this hotel.  The dinner was good not great but still fine. I had the halibut and it was a little over done.  My son had the Salmon and he said it was excellent!  The breakfast was delicious and reasonably priced for New York .our waitress for breakfast was Ciere and she was amazing. She is from Ireland and very friendly!    The ambiance in the dining area was lovely and they have a small charming bar.  The Merrion Row hotel is a MUST if you are staying in Times Square. Everything was perfect,  a wonderful end to end customer experience!  I can’t wait to come back!

title: Gran hotel cerca de Times Square
text:
Es un hotel nuevo con todas las ventajas que esto supone. A 5 min de Times Square, es un hotel céntrico pero sin el bullicio del centro, por lo tanto por las noches no oyes ruidos molestos. La habitación es bastante grande y el aseo amplio, destacaría la comodidad del colchón y las almohadas, se duerme muy bien. El personal es amable y siempre se prestan a ayudarte o resolver dudas. El desayuno continental es de calidad con un bol de fruta fresca de calidad, bollería que podría mejorar pero no esta mal, el cafe americano que puedes acompañar com leche caliente. También os recomiendo el desayuno a la carta, tienen de todo y muy bueno.
En definitiva recomiendo mucho el hotel tanto por la calidad de sus instalaciones y de su personal.

title: NY 19
text:
Just perfect
HospitalItu, location, warmth, everything as it should
Rooms are clean, modern and confortable
Breakfast was delicious 
Staff friendly 
Greaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaatttttttt jobbbbbbbbbbbbb!
Sorry but the minimum review is 200 words

title: In love with The Merrion Row hotel !
text:
This little boutique hotel is everything it sets out to be. 

Very welcoming, very modern and the most friendly people working here will make you feel like you’re family.

Don’t worry about staying this close to Times Square... or even next to an Irish pub... -it’s quiet... just get yourself a robe and a pair of slippers and you’ll never want to leave again !

It’s rare for me to discover that the photos a hotel lists on their website really resemble, what the hotel is really about, but in this case;  what you see -really is what you get, and it’s awesome !

Can’t wait to sit in the cosy breakfast area once again for my next stay !!

Reina, the hotel manager is the perfect host you can imagine... and everyone else I was  in contact with during my stay kept a smile on my face :)

title: freezing and fine
text: this is a suprirsing hotel clean and wonderful rooms ... clear and yet warmhearted ... THE hotel is kept at nordic tempreatures ? But this is  such a nice hotel and friendly and welcming and the rooms feel as if one were in a home. ANd the price for NYC is moderate ..and the room has great lighting *

title: Charming boutique hotel near Times Square
text:
My daughters and I loved our stay at the new tiny boutique hotel, Merrion Row. It has an Irish theme with beautiful photos of Ireland and quite a few employees from Ireland, as well. The bed was comfy, room style, chic, and best of all, 
quiet!   Frank and Joseph went out of their way 
to make our stay lovely! 
    We loved the breakfast! 
This is a great place to stay if you’re seeing Broadway shows!
  We were 3 in a King suite. The bed was very comfortable. Only improvement could be the sofa bed which was too hard.  All said, we highly recommend this lovely little inn!

title: Gem in the heart of Midtown
text: What a fabulous place to stay.  The location is perfect, the staff is incredible, the hotel is charming, and they treat you like guests in their own home.  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who is traveling to NYC!

title: Hurricane holiday
text:
This place is SO under-rated.  It’s new, clean, semi-minimalist Irish chic.  

The staff are fantastic.  Pedro and Franc are friendly, professional and efficient. Reina is amazing.  She’s a professional and a problem solver who - along with her colleagues - knocks customer service out of the park... even when guests are having a bad day.  

Hugh in the pub is warm and friendly and the food was well beyond normal hotel fare.

I find it hard to believe anyone would have a bad experience here.  This place us run the way hotels and guest houses should be run - by people who actually care!

title: Great hotel. Dislike the neighborhood.
text: This hotel was very nice. Extremely clean, comfortable beds, nice spacious room for New York with big shower. Staff was very nice and helpful. The only reason We gave it a four was we did not like the Times Square area. Dirty and way too crowded.  Also there was no refrigerator in the room or exhaust fan in the bathroom.

title: Absolute Gem
text: I have been to NYC a few times,usually staying in the Broadway district to catch a show.  This is BY FAR the best hotel I've stayed at.  It is a gem of a find and I hope it keeps all of its character.  The facilities are excellent with amazingly appointed rooms.  While small (it is NYC), they are functional and have plenty of room.  The hotel common area and bar/restaurant is excellent.  The location couldn't be better yet it is very quiet.  Above all else, the staff is AMAZING.  They answered all pre-arrival questions with more detail than required.  They always were courteous and offering to help make our stay as enjoyable as possible.  I just can't say enough of how impressed I and the rest of my party was.  This is definitely our go-to hotel in New York.  You won't be disappointed.

title: The best place!
text:
It's Excellent. We love it. Excellent place and attention. The Best hotel in New York.

It's located near Times Square, the 5th Avenue and Bryant Park. The attention given is excellent and it gives you the possibility of having a delicious breakfast! Marvellous!

title: Best of both worlds! City glamour mixed with a cozy & homey appeal.
text: My husband and I had a great stay at Merrion Row!  - Not big city folk but enjoy coming for a night out, we certianly enjoyed the reserved and calming atmosphere Merrion Row offered while being amongst the hustle and bustle of times square. The staff was lovely and beyond accommodating. We enjoyed our stay - would stay again and will certianly recommend to friends!

title: Fabulous
text:
Super boutique hotel in a great location. All of the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful  Nice bar and restaurant 
Comfortable bed in a decent sized room for a few days in Manhattan.  Lovely retro decor  and unexpected bonus of a welcome pint !

title: A lovely little gem in the middle of Time Square
text: We spent our 28th Wedding Anniversary weekend at Merion Row Hotel and Public House and WOW did we choose wisely! The moment we stepped inside we literally sensed (they have their own amazing signature sent piped throughout) that this was not going to be a typical NYC stay. Merion is a beautifully appointed, intimate hotel with a staff that is warm and welcoming. The rooms are on the small side (hey it’s midtown in NYC) but beautifully furnished, spotless and with high end bedding. Our heartfelt thanks to Frank, Joseph and Troy who were attentive to our every need and even had a delicious plate of macaroons and fruit left in our room for our celebration! The bar and restaurant spaces are beautiful and the Conservatory was a lovely breakfast spot for the included complimentary continental breakfast. As if that isn’t enough, they also give you a welcome pint! When we head back for a stay in NYC, we will happily stay at Merion Row Hotel and Public House.

title: An Irish Find!!!
text: Discovery time for a new restaurant in the theater district. Beautiful decor. Phenomenal staff, manager and waiter. All new we coming from Open Table and anniversary. Fabulous shepherds pie and pork chop. Definite return.

title: Highly recommended!
text: We spent 4 nights at The Merrion and are very enthusiastic about this boutique hotel. Here’s why: super friendly staff, wonderful rooms with toiletries (which smell really nice), very clean, lovely decoration, pleasant atmosphere, great food (we had avocado toast for breakfast and a magnificent pub burger for dinner: so yummy and fresh!) and perfectly located near Times Square & Bryant Park. We highly recommend this place. Hope to visit again some day, Andreas & Mariska.

title: Gem of a hotel
text: I stayed here on a quick girls trip with my daughters (2 nights). I usually avoid Times Square, but we had Broadway tickets and wanted to stay close. The hotel is a small, quiet, beautifully designed gem! Our room was on the second floor. It felt more like a B&B...the staff remembers your name and are very accommodating. The breakfast is delicious, as was dinner and the drinks. I usually bring ear plugs...didn't need them. Would definitely go back and that is saying a lot, because I do not love the crowds and noise in Times Square.

title: Absolutely amazing
text: From the minute we arrived to the moment we checked out, my wife and I had an outstanding experience. The front desk/reception were very kind and receptive. The breakfast in the morning was delicious and the bar/restaurant staff were top notch. The room was very comfortable and clean. My best stay in NYC ever

title: Highly recommend
text: Beautiful rooms, friendly staff, convenient location, great restaurant/bar. I've stayed here twice and It's the only hotel I'll be staying at in NYC going forward. I recommend it to all of my colleagues.

title: true gem
text: So easy to walk by this hotel and not even know it's there on W 45th in the theater district, right off Times Sq, but walking by would be a mistake.  You walk into an oasis of civility and calm.  The front desk person who also functions as concierge is wonderful.  The small, intimate restaurant serves excellent meals promptly.  The rooms are clean and sizeable for NYC.  Only possible negatives are no late night room service and it's a bit hard to shave in the bathroom due to slightly limited lighting but a magnifying mirror is on the counter.  Probably the only hotel I've ever stayed at in NYC where the staff actually cared how I was enjoying my stay.

title: Fantastic
text:
This was an excellent meal ! Troy, the Maitre’d the was so welcoming . Our server was Gemma who was knowledgeable polite and courteous. Our bus person was William, who was spot on refilling water and removing plates as we finished . 
The food was made superbly . 
You will not be disappointed with this quaint atmosphere in the conservatory and the delicious food .

title: Best breakfast in New York
text: The very best breakfast in New York. Great service and food was excellent. Would recommend to anyone visitng Times Square area. Visited with family and tried different restaurants and diners but none of them were as good as the Merrion Row

title: Merrion Row Public House:  I am reviewing the bar and small restaurant only.
text:
