I have not stayed iin the hotel, but have enjoyed the lovely, small bar and dining area in the back.  The dining area has a glass roof and gives the ambience of being outdoors. Because the bar and dining area are small by New York standards, they are more inviting and QUIET!

The limited number of menu selections I have had so far have all been superb.  The bar's mixologists are wonderful. Had a great, beautifully clear red cosmopolitan.

And best of all, the staff is absolutely outstanding: friendly, attentive, could not be nicer to a traveler from afar.

title: Charming boutique hotel!
text: I found Merrion Row on Hotels Tonight for a great deal! Nervous about a last minute booking, I was blown away by how charming the hotel is! The staff was so hospitable & caring. You are greeted with a free drink & complimentary continental breakfast ticket. The rooms, while quaint, were very clean with a touch of modern! My favorite part was the patio by the bar. We had a great time shutting the bar down with a John! Definitely worth checking out. A quiet and charming find in the bustle of the city!

title: Very Nice Boutique Hotel
text:
The hotel was renovated in late 2018 and has very clean rooms, nice bedding and amenities. The rooms are somewhat small but acceptable. The staff was very helpful. We would stay here again

The location could not be better. 1/2 block from Times Square. Perfect to access to the theater district and the midtown area.

title: The best stay ever in NY
text:
This hotel, the staff, the room, the service...everything is exquisite and delightful here. So delightful, so classy, so quiet when you consider you’re just a few feet away from Time square. 
I had the best stay ever in NYC two days ago with my son. Will definitely come back. 
Thank you!

title: Perfect Boutique Hotel!
text:
Great place to stay in NYC! Quiet, although very close to Times Square. Superb service (They made everything possible! Thanks again!!), very comfortable and clean, classical british/irish style, newly opened begin of the year. 
Bar, breakfast and food/dinner was very nice too with an irish focus. A lot of great beers on tab. 
Highly recommended for a personal, stylish and cosy hotel in Big Apple!

title: Geweldig
text:
Niet alleen is de ligging van het hotel fantastisch, maar ook de kamer was super! Ruim, modern, schoon, heerlijke bedden en mooie badkamer met een geweldige douche.
Het personeel was heel vriendelijk, veel verschillende bieren aan de tap en het restaurant had een leuke kaart.
Het enige puntje van verbetering zou wat mij betreft zijn dat er een kier zat in de kamerdeur waardoor er licht van de gang naar binnenkwam en je mensen op de gang (als die er waren) vrij goed kon horen.
Een volgende keer zouden wij hier zeker weer verblijven!

title: Frank and the rest of the staff are top notch!
text:
I can’t say enough about your property, but more importantly, your staff!

From check-in with Frank, engaging talk with your manager and bartender at night, and breakfast conversation with the morning staff. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and felt comfortable and welcome.

I have employees, and I know the challenges of having them take ownership in an endeavor. 

All I can say is Well Done!

title: Theater and dinner
text: This hotel is recently renovated.  It is very clean, and ideally located for the theater.  i would highly recommend to my friends.  It is not a big name chain, and does not have a big lobby and such.  The breakfast was excellent, and the staff was very friendly.  It is in the section where all of the Irish pubs are, and less than a block from Times Sq. and the theater district.

title: Terrible check-in experience, room was OK
text:
We only stayed at the Merrion Row Hotel for one night for a quick trip to see a Broadway show. We arrived at the hotel at the check-in time of 3pm and were told that our room wasn't ready but that it should be ready very soon. We were told to wait in the lobby and they would let us know as soon as the room was ready. We waited patiently for nearly an hour without any update from the hotel staff, during which time we saw 4 or 5 other people check in with no issues. I went back to the front desk to check on our room and was told that it was ready. It was a little upsetting to have sat around seemingly unnecessarily. We were really looking forward to getting to the room to have a chance to shower and relax for a few minutes, since we were on a tight schedule and had just spent about 14 hours traveling and going around the city. I tried to make it clear that I wasn't at all happy about having to wait around, but Frank didn't really seem to care. He gave us our keys, and we hiked up the stairs to the room, only to find that the keys didn't work. Someone else helped us get the keys fixed, but it was annoying to have to deal with this on top of the long wait.

The long wait to check in was especially frustrating because I had gone through the process of "pre-checking in" at the hotel's request, specifying the time I was planning to arrive, so that they could have the room ready.

Our room was supposed to include WiFi, but we were never told the password and after the long wait to check in, we wouldn't have had time to use it anyway. Apparently the WiFi was included as part of a $25 "Urban Fee" that was tacked onto the room rate.

The room itself was as expected for the location. It was tiny, barely big enough to fit the bed, but was comfortable enough. There were no outward-facing windows, which made the room a little depressing.

The room was fine, but based on the awful experience with check-in, I don't think I'll be staying at the Merrion Row Hotel again. It's a shame, because I really wanted to like it.

title: What a treasure!
text: This wonderful hotel has altered my usual policy against staying in the Theatre District. The staff made me feel at home from the moment I walked in the door. Reina, in particular, anticipated my every need. The rooms are beautifully appointed and sparklingly clean. And the bathrooms! Let me tell you about the bathrooms. They are spacious and chic. What a find!

title: The best!
text: We frequently come into the city for overnights and stay in various 4 or 5 star hotels. This hotel is a gem!! So much better than the big chains as we were treated like VIPs even though we were only there for 1 night to celebrate my daughter’s 11th birthday. They even left her a beautiful and delicious birthday treat in our room. Beds were super comfortable and room was spotless. Quiet rooms too. This is now our go to place for nights in the city.

title: Cozy boutique hotel in midtown with Irish flair and hospitality
text: We spent 4 nights at the Merrion Row Hotel in 2 rooms (teenagers in a room with 2 queen beds, parents in a king studio).  The location (45th between 6th and 7th) is perfect for seeing all of the major sites in the city and you are a short walk from major subway lines that can take you all over the city.  Easy walk to Times Square, Bryant Park, NY Public Library, Rockefeller center, Empire State Building, Central park, St. Patricks’ Cathedral, 5th avenue shopping, NBC productions, the Spy Museum, and the Plaza hotel to name a few.  The hotel is decorated nicely with high end finishes and furniture that reminds you of an upscale Irish home.  With only 28 rooms, you feel as though you are staying in a lovely, quiet, row house, when in fact you are in the middle of one of the busiest cities in the world.  Many of the staff are Irish and still speak with an accent, they play Irish music and news in the common areas.  The bar is a welcome respite from the bustling city streets to enjoy a pint of Guiness after a day of sightseeing or meetings.  A continental breakfast is included with the room, which is a huge plus (you can also use the voucher toward a full breakfast if you so desire).  The dining area has a glass ceiling which allows for natural light to make the restaurant even more inviting.   Dinner options are basic but tasty, portions are relatively large.  The staff make it a point to know your name and can help with anything you might need during your stay.  The common areas are comfortable and offer a sitting area with two couches and a large desk for small meetings or working solo.  The rooms are somewhat cozy but comfortable and consistent with the Irish row house theme.   The king studio features a pull-out couch bed, and the two queens are also murphy beds so you can put the beds away for more room during the day.  The windows are high quality so you don’t hear the noises below.  We did occasionally hear noise from other guests inside the hotel, but nothing intolerable.  Bathrooms feature marble and traditional tile with gold/brass fixtures.  I would definitely stay here again.   Connolly’s pub (owned by same family) is right next door and features traditional Irish fare and a rooftop bar with live music on the weekends.  Hotel is a great value for the money.

title: Outstanding hotel and impressive staff
text:
We came for a business trip and selected the Merrion for our first stay.
The hotel was more than clean and impressive and the food outstanding. 
Can't say enough about Frank, Regina, Jon, Holly and Joseph for their "over-the-top" hospitality.
Will definitely return next time in NYC.

title: Perfectly small and welcoming
text:
We very much enjoyed our stay at the Merrion Row Hotel and Public House. The staff is fantastic and although we enjoyed our interactions with each staff member, Franc definitely stands out from our stay. Our room was comfortable and modern, and the downstairs spots were beautiful. 

And the location is perfect! It is close to several subway lines and is blocks away from most Broadway shows. However, our room (unlike other hotels I've stayed at in the area) was quiet. We didn't get a lot of street noise at night and couldn't hear the non-stop people traffic from Times Square.

title: Anniversary Trip
text: My wife and I came into the city for our anniversary.  We spent hours searching and researching hotels to find the right place.  We were super happy about staying at the Marrion Row.  Our room was amazing and the location was perfect.  All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and hospitable.  We typically don't eat in the place were we stay so we can experience different places.  But we did have breakfast and it was great.  All in all we were very happy with our decision to book with you.  We look forward to being able to stay again in the future.

title: Great Boutique Hotel!
text: Merrion Row is a small slice of quaint, Irish heaven in the bustling metropolis of NYC. Extremely close to Times Square (if you dare go), close to several subway stations and Broadway. It was quiet and classy chic. Absolutely a hidden gem.

title: Phenomenal hotel with the best service
text: I can't compliment this hotel enough - lovely boutique hotel, clean, quiet, right by times square. But most of all the service - Mark, Joseph and the staff could not do enough for us - gifts when we arrived in the room, recommending what to do in NYC and so much more. Would certainly stay here when going back to NYC and would recommend everyone else do so as well!

title: Awesome Location & Fabulous Hôtel and Service
text:
We stumbled upon this hotel while deciding last minute to add a couple days in New York at the tail end of our trip . My daughter wanted to be close to the hustle and bustle of Time Square and I wanted to have something clean and tasteful with a boutique hotel vibe . The Merrion Row Hôtel was just the ticket and our stay was perfect. Spacious rooms, excellent amenities, a welcome drink on arrival and personable and helpful staff.
The icing on the cake was being able to walk out your door and being literally in the heart of Time Square . Truly the best of both worlds and I recommend this hotel 100 percent!

title: Unlikely find ...
text:
I took the hint from Tablet reviewers and booked for 2 nights recently.  From the moment we arrived the vibe was completely different than a typical hotel, friendly, relaxed, like a small club.  The staff is truly exceptional.

The rooms were spotless and well appointed and in our case on the backside #306 - completely quiet except the occasional pinging of the elevator in the evening. It's a small corridor and that is probably the case in every room. That was honestly the only failing of the hotel if you want to be very picky.

The upsides are a wonderful Irish themed hotel that make you feel like you are in Dublin (even the staff is largely Irish) and a great location if you are like we were seeing a show. Had breakfast twice and bar snacks and everything was just grand.  

Wouldn't  hesitate to recommend to a friend.

title: Refined and Relaxing New Gem in the Heart of Times Square
text:
Checking out of this hotel today, I did something I have never done before: book our next vacation at the same hotel before I even left. 

The hotel, not even a year old, is designed with understated, tailored, Irish-inspired details that make it feel like a trip away within a trip away. Walking in off bustling Times Square, beautiful marble, wood, linen and brass is featured throughout the 1920s structure. The artwork and even some of the music highlight some of the rich Irish culture. 

Our room, while it was small, featured crown molding, crisp white linens, was immaculate, and sooo quiet. The spacious bathroom had great natural light and was almost the size of the sleeping area.

Upon arrival, we were welcomed by name by Joseph--right away personable in a big city. We enjoyed complimentary drinks in the bar and conversed with our bartender John about his Irish homeland. 

At breakfast, the staff was welcoming and efficient. Holly and Sammy served us a great hot breakfast with Irish tea. The potatoes --served with the Irish bacon and eggs really stood out—creamy and perfectly seasoned, like no breakfast potatoes we had had before. 

Before we left, we met Mark, the manager, and as we complimented his hotel and staff, he proudly offered his assistance with anything while we were in town. 

Beginning to end, this stylish boutique hotel offered personalized hospitality at its best—making it all the more unique in midtown Manhattan and guaranteeing a return stay from us!

title: Fantastisch boutique hotel op 200 meter van Times Square
text: Het personeel is erg vriendelijk, de kamer heel schoon, bed ligt fantastisch en als extra kregen we iedere ochtend een goed verzorgd ontbijt. In het kleinschalige hotel merk je niets van alle drukte en hectiek van Times Square. Het hotel ligt super centraal om New York te ontdekken. Echt een aanrader.

title: Awesome boutique hotel in midtown
text: The entire experience was exceptional.  The room was bright and well maintained.  The staff could not have been more accomodating, from check-in to check-out.  The room was quiet (which is always a trick in the city) and convenient to Times Square, Broadway, and Grand Central Station.  Breakfast was well proportioned and the pint at check-in very much set the mood for the stay.

title: Small boutiques warm hotel
text:
Unexpected great stay at the Merrion Row and Public House. -
Joseph took care of us the minute we walked in and we were hooked right from the start. Thank you for your warm hospitality:) We will be back.

title: Excellent Stay
text:
The hotel was new and clean, the restaurant had excellent food, but what stood out to me was the staff. Very friendly. 
The location is perfect for sightseeing. I’ve stayed in other NYC hotels and you could always here the roads, honking, sirens and traffic. This hotel is half a block from Times Square and our room was very quiet, we heard nothing at all. 
I highly recommend it.

title: A Times Square Gem
text: We were three generations visiting New York to see Harry Potter on Broadway.  Most of us have come to view hotels near Times Square as impersonal warehouses which you excuse because all you need in New York is a place to sleep.  The Merrion Row Hotel and Public House is the rare exception. The hotel’s central location is perfect for seeing a Broadway show; our room was impeccably clean, comfortable and quiet; and the included breakfast was beyond delicious.  But what makes the Merrion Row so special was the staff, who, if you can believe, became like family to us. Each was bright, energetic and attentive, very professional and very friendly. Overall, this was a magical experience for our family,.

title: A Gem
text: Great location and service at this beautifully finished boutique hotel. The staff is amazing and goes out of their way to make sure that guest experience is perfect. The hotel restaurant/bar also offers great food and drinks.

title: Best in NYC
text:
If you are ever in NYC and want to know what a true Irish hospitality is, then you need to stay at the Merrion Row hotel. Merion Row is many things including a cozy atmosphere, clean rooms, delicious food, and comfortable beds. But the most important advantage of this hotel is the amazing people who work there.
 Every time we visited NYC we would stay at well known established hotels, so when we found Merrion Row we were a little hesitant as we have never heard about this hotel. But we did not regret any second spent here. Because those who often visit NYC can confirm that it’s really hard to find a hotel with good combination of location, service, cleanliness (!!) and comfortability. Especially if you are traveling with three children of different age, from 3 to 17. Combination of all of the above is the best at the Merrion Row hotel. Our next trip to  NYC we will definitely start with reservation at Merrion Row Hotel. Thank you Frank, Joseph and Genna for making our stay so much better. Special thanks to Mark for doing a tremendous job keeping up the hotel to the highest standards in this business. Recommend to anyone with any type of visit, business or leisure, solo or family.

title: Top class hotel - HIGHLY recommended!
text: I cannot recommend the Merrion Row highly enough!  The rooms are lovely but what stood out was the staff.  They were all, without exception - both friendly and professional and happy to help with any enquiry or request.  They made us feel very welcome from the moment we arrived.  I will be back - hopefully very soon.

title: Best Boutique Hotel Downtown NY
text:
Should you be after a Hyatt or Hilton type of accommodation, walk away.
This is BOUTIQUE we're talking about at the Merrion.
This starts with a low-key entrance, leading to a tiny reception area. And this is where the magic gets started. Personalized appreciation of your visiting, welcome drink at the bar (I said "drink", not just a jar of water with plastic cups), neat decor all over.
The stairs and corridors are equally nice, before getting into a superbly appointed room. Like any hotel in NYC size is pretty limited but the whole space here is used to its best. The decor and furniture are high quality, the floor is wooden instead of the ugly carpet at any other hotel chains, the bathroom features an Italian-like rain-shower.
After so many stays in NYC, so glad to have at last found the place I will undoubtedly come back to at any opportunity.
Ah and I was about to forget, enjoy the continental breakfast - simple but effective.

title: Underwhelming stay
text:
Pros: friendly staff, new facilities, more than adequate room size, and overall cleanliness (a bit on this below). Would work well for families visiting NY and wanting to be right next to Time Square. 

Cons: 
Location: the location on 45th street near Time Square really didn’t work for me - street clogged with tour busses, vendors and pretty dirty street with water dripping down from air cons from above. If you want/need to be Time Square, this would work for you but if you want any charm from the surrounding area, I’d go elsewhere. 

Noise: all Studio King rooms have adjoining rooms (which I found out a few days before checking in), and means you can hear your neighbors quite well. I’m a light sleeper, and I had to wear earplugs after waking up at night. Check before booking about which rooms do/don’t have adjoining rooms to avoid this if you’re a light sleeper like myself.

Housekeeping: not great. I stayed for four nights, and on the third day there was no bathrobe and no bath mat (staff promptly brought it up once I called), and on the fourth day, housekeeping hadn’t cleaned the drained as pictured. Didn’t see the general level of cleanliness I’ve experienced in other hotels, like straightening stuff in the room properly.

Food: had breakfast for three mornings and tried three different menus - all very very average, unfortunately. The oatmeal was runny, the bread for the avo toast wasn’t toasted, and the omelette was fine. 

Mattress, pillows and linen: it like the mattress was pretty lumpy (maybe it was the topper that got lumpy?), pillows were too fat and the bed linen (and bathrobe) all felt flimsy... maybe it’s the hotel’s style but it certainly didn’t feel like I was slipping into a great bed going to sleep at night for me.

Reading others’ great reviews, I was really looking forward to staying here, but it was truly underwhelming for me for the above reasons.

title: Nice Place to Stay in NYC
text: Very modern and update hotel very close to Times Square and the theater district.  Rooms were very fresh and well appointed, staff was very friendly and helpful.  There is also a restaurant where we had both breakfast and lunch, each was very good.  Continental breakfast was included with our room and if you ordered off the menu instead, they gave you a 5 dollar discount.

title: A Gem in NYC!
text: There are so many hotels to choose from in NYC but we are so glad we stayed at Marrion Row!  It was a special mother & son trip and we had the best experience.....the staff was amazing and so helpful EVERYTIME!  I travel a lot, for work, so I have had my fair share of mediocre hotel rooms with clunky and loud AC units, paper thin walls and questionable levels of cleanliness.  It was lovely to have a newly renovated room with a quiet AC and a super clean bathroom.  Thanks again for a great trip…we will definitely be back.

title: Fantastic experience
text: I have stayed in several hotels in the area and this is, by far, the best. Great service and a friendly staff put this small, quiet hotel at the top of my list as places to have a repeat stay. My eight year old daughter loved eating breakfast in the Conservatory and it is a comfortable place to spend time reading g while having coffee.

title: Clean hotel/ good location / 2queen beds
text: A rare gem in times square area, for a room with 2queen beds, that’s already a steal, plus the location is right off times square, can’t beat that. We also love the breakfast area and the food and appreciate the complimentary continental breakfast.we will come back definitely

title: Business Trip to New York & Got to Stay at the Merrion Row!
text:
This review is delayed but I stayed at the Merrion Row in May for a work trip. I was so pleased with everything about the stay! I was greeted by Reina at check in and she was an amazing host and friendly face throughout the trip. I really appreciate her attention to detail, recommendations and help with travel. I travel a lot of work and she made me feel very welcome to the Merrion Row. 

My room was clean, stylishly decorated and very comfortable. It was fairly small but aren't they all?? It was still plenty of room for me. My room was on the street side and wasn't too noisy. 

I dined at the restaurant on the first night and really enjoyed the food and appreciated the welcome beverage. I had a glass of Murphy Goode Sauv Blanc and it was nice. 

I definitely recommend a stay at the Merrion Row.... Oh yeah, and the location was superb! Close to Central Station & Time Square.

title: Beautiful Quiet Room in the City
text:
Came to Merrion Row after an experience at a very noisy hotel with very small rooms. Was pleasantly surprised to see how beautifully decorated the rooms were, how spacious they were, and also how quiet the rooms were despite the hotel's proximity to Times Square. 
We were also very pleased with the service - will definitely be coming back!

title: Un oasis en Times Square
text:
Gracias al hotel y a todo su personal nuestra estancia en Nueva York ha sido fantástica. Es un pequeño pero gran hotel. Su comodidad, limpieza y ubicación lo hacen perfecto. 
Nuestra habitación era doble y el tamaño era confortable, esperabamos que fuera más pequeña y nos sorprendió. Perfectamente aislada del ruido exterior e interior. 
Todo el personal ha sido maravilloso y siempre nos han atendido con una gran sonrisa y nos han facilitado todo tipo de información (especialmente muchas gracias por todo, Joseph Suárez).
Echamos de menos vuestros desayunos, la música irlandesa y el maravilloso olor a limpio que te hacía sentir en casa.
Desde luego, si tenemos la gran suerte de volver, será a este hotel.

title: Total focus on the guest
text:
We stayed four nights this week and it redefined my hotel expectations! The location is unbeatable for Broadway and Times Square, and very convenient to public transportation. A good breakfast, plentiful amenities and a quiet atmosphere plus a comfortable bed in a well-equipped room.
But the factor that makes it unique versus other fine hotels I’ve visited in 4 continents, is the absolute focus from the staff on the guest. Everyone cared and desired to help, with a natural smile and friendly conversation that came across as authentic. Truly cared to make us comfortable and cared for. My wife and I will definitely try to revisit.

title: Big things come in small packages
text:
My wife and I just returned from a 3 night stay at Merrion Row.  The first three rules of real estate are "Location, Location, Location" and Merrion Row is the place!  Half a block from Times Square, and 2-3 blocks from multiple subway stops. 

As close as the hotel is to "the action", the rooms are very quiet.  One night when we returned, there was construction on the street outside (jackhammers, heavy equipment, etc).  Once the door to the hotel closed, you'd never know it. 

All of the staff was very friendly and helpful.  Joseph in particular was very helpful and always had a smile on his face.  My wife had a box shipped to the hotel from a friend, and Joseph remembered the name on the box when we checked in (reservation was under my name). 

Continental Breakfast, Wifi, and a Welcome drink are all "included" as part of the resort fee.  

The only negative (and it really isn't much of one) was the size of the room.  It was ~10x25', with another 15x8' bathroom area.  Since it was just the two of us, and we were only in the room to sleep, it worked out great for us.  

There were plenty of outlets on both sides of the bed... both standard outlets and USB ports... a great find in this day and age (cell phones, tablets, CPAPs, etc). 

Would gladly stay there again.

title: 18th birthday celebration
text: What a wonderful place to stay! The staff are absolutely amazing and went out of their way to make our stay special as it was my daughters 18th birthday. Upon arrival we found a lovely birthday message and gift in the room which was very much appreciated and a lovely surprise for my daughter. We stayed in a premium room with two queen beds which was extremely clean and had plenty of room for the two of us. It looks exactly like it does in the photos. The free continental breakfast was a nice touch and the location is excellent. I know others have had issues with noise but this wasn’t a problem for us as our room was lovely and quiet and we both slept well. I would highly recommend this hotel and want to say a massive thank you to the staff for all your help and for making it a special and memorable stay for my daughter and myself.

title: Magnific Hotel
text: I stayed here for 3 nights and wish it had of been longer. Fantastic location, attentive and exceptional service from all the team.  Bed was so comfortable, rooms and hotel were extremely clean.  Definitely a gem of a boutique hotel, I would highly recommend Merrion Row and would stay here again for sure!!  All the best to the team and keep doing what you are doing.

title: Excellent hospitality and fantastic location
text:
A massive thank you to all the lovely staff at Merrion Row for making our trip so fantastic. Stayed here for 5 nights and cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Everyone went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible. Great location - right near Time’s Square and Bryant Park. Ate in the hotel 2 evenings as the food was so good. 
Thank you Merrion Row!!

title: Excellent choice for a hotel in NYC
text: Small and cosy hotel with great location and clean rooms, nice and helpful staff (especially Mark and Linda), great choices for breakfast as well as for lunch or dinner. Overall it is a really nice hotel where they manage to create home-like experience for their guests.

title: Treasure near Times Square
text: An utterly delightful gem of a hotel! We go to New York a few times a year & we've found the place we will always stay when we're making our Broadway visits. Other hotels are a place to sleep, Merrion Row enhances your trip. Every staff person was warm and welcoming. We ate in the Public House twice, not including the complimentary continental breakfast, and both the service and the food were excellent. The size of the hotel made us feel as if we were in a B&B and we felt very secure. The decor is lovely and our room was extremely nice, with an exceptionally comfy bed and so quiet we couldn't believe how close we were to Times Square.

title: Wow!
text: Right in the heart of Times Square but SO quiet I slept like a baby! They had all the amenities I needed. Great bed, fabulous staff, excellent dinner in the pub...I will be back. Awesome experience! Well worth it!

title: Great NYC Experience!
text: We had a FANTASTIC time at Merrion Row on our recent vacation.  It was just steps away from hectic Times Square, yet our room was quiet and relaxing for our family to wind down.  One of the best parts of our stay was having excellent service from Linda and Willie during breakfast each morning.  Joseph at the front desk also gave us great recommendations to visit during our stay.  What was probably most memorable was that everyone there, including the GM Mark, would hold conversations with our son by name, making him feel like a valued VIP guest just as much as us adults.  I cannot more highly recommend this great hotel!

title: This is a fantastic hotel
text: The location is great, just steps from Times Square, yet the room was so quiet even though we were on the 2nd floor! Beautiful finishes, thoughtful touches, comfortable bed and linens, and, most notably, the friendliest staff I have encountered in a long time. We also had breakfast on site and the food was just terrific. HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

title: Tucked away just of Times Square
text:
small hotel, with very friendly and efficient staff. 
The rooms were pretty compact but very well appointed and had almost everything you'd need. This hotel is right off times Square so if you want to be in the hub of everything this is a great choice, we had no street noise and felt like we were a million miles away from everybody. 
FYI:We stayed for 4 nights and the whole time i was dissapointed that there was no full length mirror in the room which i normally think of as a basic room item, on our final morning as we were leaving i saw that there was on on the outside of the bathroom pocket door !!!

title: Excellent location, stunning clean room, wonderful staff. Highly recommend!
text: Loved it! Stunning boutique style hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Extremely helpful staff (in particular Joseph :)) exceptionally clean room equipped with all the necessities. Loved the design style and attention to detail with all the fittings and finishes. Will definitely be back!

title: Biggest and Quietest Room I’ve Ever Had in NYC!!!
text: I took my daughter, sister and niece to NYC to visit Broadway and Times Square. I always go to NYC on business and ALWAYS avoid Time Square because it is crowded and people are loud at all hours of the night therefore I never get any rest. Since we were going for pleasure I wanted them to get the full experience. I found Merrion Row Hotel online and could not pass up an NYC hotel room that had 2 queen beds! Needless to say the hotel and room did not disappoint!! Not only was the room spacious but we had uninterrupted sleep every night (and this hotel is literally a block from Times Square)! I highly recommend this hotel for business and pleasure! The rooms were spacious, quiet and the hotel staff was amazing!! A must visit! A+++

title: Great Hotel with Equally Great Irish Pub Inside
text: Merrion Row is a fantastic little hotel in the heart of it all.  A great location complemented by some of the friendliest, most helpful staff I have encountered at any hotel anywhere. Joseph and Frank at the front desk and Linda and Holly in the restaurant were all particularly great. Very comfortable beds and well appointed bathrooms made it extra nice. The little pub in on the ground floor also provided a great meal or drinks choice in a quaint and quiet environment.

title: Trip with college son
text: Wow. What a wonderful hotel for our first time in NYC. I chose this place because it’s small and I assumed the service would be better here than a large place. I was right. It’s such a pretty and quaint little place. The restaurant, bar and lobby are beautiful. Breakfast was super good and our waitress was lovely and so sweet. It’s the attention to detail that makes it so nice. The bed was so comfy and the sheets and comforter omg! I loved the bathroom and decor in the room. What makes this the best is the staff. We were greeted by name every single time we came in/out. My son fainted during a city excursion and as we came back to the hotel to rest, an attendant in the lobby asked how our day was going. I shared what happened and told her we were headed to the room to lay down. We had not met this particular lady yet. She was so nice and concerned. I don’t know how she even knew who we were or what room we were in, but two minutes later they called the room to check on us and said they were bringing waters and ice. Awesome place. Will definitely be back.

title: Restaurant
text:
Great service. Great food. Fairly priced.
Can’t say much more. Good beer. Kids love it. Nice staff. Traditional Irish food. Filling in here....
Seems like newly opened with lots of ambitions. Go here while it’s cheap.

title: Quiet & Cozy in the heart of Times Square
text: Absolutely not a bad word to say about it! (OK, the rooms are pretty small, but that's the norm for NYC). It was one of the quietest, darkest hotel rooms I've ever been in, which made sleeping there great! And the restaurant was great! Had one of the best Shepherd's pies I've ever had, but also nice salads and soup. The salmon was also delish! Right in the heart of the Times Square area, but seems like miles away. Would stay there again in a New York Minute!

title: Excellent in Every Way!!!
text: Our family of 4 had the most amazing experience at the Merrion  Hotel!! From the moment we walked in we felt welcomed and at home !  The staff from the concierge to our lovely waitress at  breakfast were so kind, courteous, and helpful.   We really enjoyed the breakfast that was included every morning ! We also very much enjoyed the meals from the restaurant on location! They were delicious!! The hotel and room were all very clean and well maintained.  Housekeeping did an excellent job keeping our room tidy and well stocked with towels and amenities.  The hotel and staff were so inviting each evening when we came in from a busy day of sightseeing in NYC.  The location was excellent  in the heart of Midtown.  We had no problems walking or taking subway anywhere we wanted to go. I would highly recommend the Merrion Hotel! Wish I could give it more than 5 stars ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Fun location, great service but....
text:
First things first this tiny boutique hotel is located a mere block from Times Square so it’s fun to be right in the middle of everything but just set back enough to not be overwhelmed by street noise.

The interiors are modern and clean giving a very new high-end feel. However, the standard rooms are tiny, worth an upgrade to get a slightly larger room, for example with a couch which couldn’t fit in the standard room.

However, this hotel has a major problem and that is noise, no not street noise but internal noise. If you happen to be unfortunate to have a room with a connecting door prepare to feel like you are sleeping in a dorm with a stranger. You will hear every cough, every sink being turned on, every sneeze, every time they crumpled a plastic bag, everything.

I would have rated the hotel even lower because of this if it weren’t for beyond exceptional service. Always friendly and accommodating they went above and beyond to correct things and after this issue was highlighted they made arrangements so my neighbouring room wasn’t occupied which I greatly appreciated.

It is very unlikely I will ever stay here again though due to the noise issues. It is unfortunate because this hotel has so much going for it. I really hope they can come up with a solution to their significant noise issues. It should be a high-end sanctuary regardless whether they are fully booked or not.

title: Fabulous Hotel!
text: Stunning hotel. Extremely central, in the heart of the city. Friendly and helpful staff. Lovely food and extremely clean. Very easy to get to. Would highly recommend if going on a trip with a small amount of people!

title: Fantastic!
text: We just got back from a 4 night stay at the Merrion Row Hotel and Public House.  We had a room with 2 queen beds as our son was with us.  I was incredibly impressed with this hotel.  It's quite small as I expect of a boutique hotel but is beautifully decorated with modern, updated finishes.  The location is perfect if you are looking to stay near Times Square and very quiet.  The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful.  Mark was especially helpful and went out of his way to make sure we had everything we needed.  I didn't realize that a continental breakfast was included: choice of coffee, tea, juices and fresh fruit, danish and croissant.  All delicious.  We also enjoyed the welcome "pint" or beverage of choice.  The beds were comfortable and I was surprised how spacious the bedroom and bathroom were for a boutique hotel.  We will definitely stay here again.

title: A REAL GEM
text: So happy to have found a real HOME in NYC. Very classy. Starts with the woman who runs the food. Rooms are perfect. Common areas perfect. Perfectly clean. Nice size rooms for NYC. Food is terrific. Everything from veggies, salads, meats. Places to work during the day if you’d like to. Really comfortable bar and dining area. Try it.

title: just ok
text: unfortunately our experience here was just ok. staff was friendly and the room was clean, but it was very small and cramped, and the walls were paper thin and we had difficulty sleeping all night due to being able to hear every part of a jetlagged family's conversations next door.

title: A Beautiful Gem!
text: I had a last minute business trip planned and needed a hotel asap and I found was so happy to find this GEM of a Hotel! Great staff, clean rooms, awesome ambiance, super cute and yummy food at the Public House (which is a part of the hotel) and prime location (especially if you're a tourist). I would rebook this hotel time and time again!

title: Oasis in NYC
text: The Merrion Row Hotel is an oasis in the hubbub of New York.  The very friendly staff make you feel at home and the location means you are never far from anywhere in Manhattan.  The hotel is so clean & well appointed, the food is tasty and there is such a welcoming atmosphere in the bar!

title: Lovely oasis in midtown!
text: This is a charming, small, boutique hotel that has been recently renovated so everything is new and neat! The decor of the hotel is fresh and very tasteful. The staff couldn't be nicer. Our room was facing 45th street but was actually quite quiet, to our surprise.  We did not think the big over-sized pillows in the rooms were very comfortable but they didn't hesitate to bring us a different size. The beds are great! Not a huge midtown fan, though it's a great location for Broadway, but this hotel really feels away from it all.

title: Wonderful Place to Stay
text: We stayed here for 4 nights and it was a perfect place to stay. Great staff, great location. It’s close to Times Square but you wouldn’t know it. Even in the middle of midtown, it’s a fairly quiet hotel. We would definitely stay here again.

title: Homy Place in the Heart of NYC
text: A very comfortable and relaxed boutique hotel right next to Time Square. We loved the attention to detail and the very nice authentic staff. We already started to tell all our friends and colleagues about this place. The breakfast was also very good.

title: Clean, friendly, comfortable, and fantastic location
text: Merrion Row was practically perfect in every way: the decor, music, and atmosphere all smack of Ireland in the best way; the rooms were small (of course! It's Mid-town Manhattan!) but very clean and comfortable; the staff were incredibly friendly and helpful (especially the GM Mark, who I enjoyed reminiscing with about my own time in Ireland); the restaurant and food were very good, and it's literally a block from Times Square and a plethora of Broadway theaters. I'll definitely be planning to stay here again on my next trip to Manhattan. Go raibh maith agat!

title: Great location, cute boutique hotel!
text: The hotel location really can’t be beat! Being just off of Times Square you are in the middle of all the action and very close to all the theatres if you are planning to see shows as we did! The room was very clean and nicely decorated but for the price you pay and being a 4 star hotel, I think amenities could be better. The standard queen room is very small. It is strictly a room with a bed and nothing else. The bathroom is a moderately good size and nicely done. There is no closet in the room, no mini bar or small fridge and no room to set up an ironing board. While I was at the hotel I did not think there was a full length mirror, but apparently it’s on the other side of the sliding door which we always kept open and so never saw it. The bed and pillows were very comfortable and I did like the decor in the room and of the hotel overall. However, I feel that for the price you’re paying you can get a room with a bit more space and amenities in a similarly great location. Overall the service at the hotel was quite good and everyone was very friendly. If there were bigger rooms available I would consider coming back to stay at this hotel again!

title: Outstanding Stay!
text:
We frequently stay overnight in NYC and often in the Times Square area when seeing Broadway shows. I am always looking for something different/better and prefer to stay in boutique type hotels. I had never seen Merrion Row before and was instantly intrigued by the design, location and amenities. It turned out to be even better than I expected..... it has only been open since December so it’s brand new, clean, modern.... pretty perfect.  The interior design is fantastic— really well done.  The mix of classic and contemporary furniture, woven wool rugs, lighting, the grey and blue palette, the brass fixtures, the black and white tiled bathroom—-all come together to create a comfortable and welcoming space. Our bed was so comfy and it was super quiet at night; we couldn’t hear any street noise and slept soundly. We enjoyed cocktails in the pub and appreciated the wonderful selection of Irish whiskey! (Felt like we were back in Dublin!) Breakfast in the beautiful glass ceiling dining room was also excellent- good coffee and 
delicious offerings. The best part of our two night stay at Merrion Row was the outstanding customer service!! I don’t think we have ever been more warmly welcomed at a NYC hotel. Every staff member we encountered was friendly, helpful and absolutely lovely to deal with! We will be back!

title: Lovely rooms, great service and a great location.
text: The hotel is well maintained, good quality decoration and a cosy feel. The food was really good and always served with a smile. The staff wetter really friendly and made us feel very welcome. Breakfast was of a high standard with good variety. The location is excellent for exploring New York. Really close to Times Square, close to subway stations and walking distance to central station and Rockefeller.

title: Charming. Charming. Charming.
text: This hotel is truly an amazing gem nestled in the heart of Times Square. At check-in, I was met with a friendly host who knew my name and made me feel like an expected guest, welcoming me by name. My room was elegant, cozy, chic, and extremely fresh feeling. ) The restaurant/bar was just as charming as the rooms -- an amazing burger too. Loved every minute of my far too short stay here. Will absolutely come back and stay on future trips. Highly recommend this charming gem of a hotel.

title: Oasis in New York City
text:
Merrion Row gets it just perfect!  My wife and I just stayed for the first time, it is going to be our go to hotel in NYC from now on. Everyone was so friendly and service oriented. The hotel is a quiet spot right in the middle of Times Square area and feels like home.  The food and bar were both top notch. 
Can’t wait to return.

title: Irish charm and hospitality in the heart of New York City
text:
My wife and I come to New York from the Philadelphia area to see Broadway shows.  What we found at Merrion Row exceeded our expectations.  With only 28 rooms, it was a quieter, more intimate space than most hotels.  The Irish theme is not just cosmetic. The warm and welcoming staff we met, were mostly from Ireland, and enjoyed talking about their hometowns. The room was beautiful, with wood floors and a very comfortable bed.  The bathroom had a vintage look, with modern accents.  The price was right in line for a theater district hotel in NYC, but it felt like you were staying someplace very exclusive. We can't recommend this hotel enough. We are already making plans to return later this year.  I almost don't want to tell too many people about
this place!

title: Can I please give 10 stars?
text: I cannot say enough about how awesome this place is. We were severely let down by another accommodation who cancelled on us at the last minute. After a 4 hour drive, we were left scrambling to find a place to stay immediately. I called Merrion Row and spoke with Mark. Mark was very understanding of our situation and moved heaven and earth to get us 2 rooms that adjoined. Upon our arrival, everything was ready to go, they took our bags, made us feel so welcomed and basically said "we got this". Location is half a block from Times Square. Perfect. It is an Irish based hotel and bar. Irish hospitality and friendliness shines from ALL of the staff. A massive thank you to Mark and Troy who took our worries away. To cap it off, they allowed me to park in front of the hotel saving us $48 in parking. Thank you, thank you, thank you. If you are going to New York, DO NOT MISS THE OPPORTUNITY TO STAY HERE!!!

title: AWESOME GEM - close to Times Square and theaters
text:
Found this place on the internet. It  seemed a bit pricey, but the description made me curious.  Such a small hotel, 28 room s if i recall it correctly.  It is close to Time Square, theaters and restaurants.

On arrival we were pleasantly greeted.  Staff went over our reservation, informing me that the resort fee included 2 pints or glasses of wine in their bar or restaurant.  It also included continental breakfast for both nights of our stay  .  If you prefer to order from the breakfast menu, they will offer a discount in lieu of the continental breakfast.  Suddenly this place is becoming less expensive. 

Our room was immaculate.  A welcome note on the edge of the bed with chocolates. On the desk was a plate with a greeting in chocolate greeting us along with some french macaroons.  Room was very comfortable.

We had dinner in their restaurant, a  small glassed in room at the back of the building.  It has great ambiance and very cozy.  Food is amazing.  Well above what you might expect to find at a hotel restaurant.  

Hotel and restaurant have earned an excellent rating. I know that they will keep that rating and become a destination point on NYC for both the hotel and restaurant,  You NEED to visit this place it will greatly improve your stay in NYC.

title: Above and beyond
text: After a stressful cancellation of an apartment we had booked in New Jersey,  we were scrambling for somewhere to stay after a 4 hour drive. We weren't planning on staying in the city, but we are so glad we did. Mark was the most understanding and helpful member of staff we have ever done across and  made us feel valued and welcome. We would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting New York.

title: A gem in new york, one of my best hotel experiences!
text:
I do not know how to describe the hospitality with which they welcomed us at Merrion Row. The hotel has an amazing location, one block from Times Square and close to the subway. I fell in love with the design of the rooms, so chic. They really have an attention to detail, the beds are very comfortable, the bathroom is spectacular, everything is clean, what can I say? The hotel is beautiful. 

We were two people in the room and it was the perfect size for our comfort. It is important to mention that the Merrion Row staff knew it was my birthday and they had a welcome and congratulations surprise at my room. I would definitely come back without thinking twice. I felt at home throughout my stay. A special thanks to Joseph and Franklin who helped us with all our questions and greeted us as friends every time we entered the hotel. Last but not least, you need to try the restaurant, amazing food and atmosphere. Thank you Merrion Row for such a lovely stay.

title: Super Hotel direkt am Times Square
text:
Super tolles Hotel. Perfekte Lage - man ist schnell überall (auch zu Fuß).
Die Zimmer sind etwas klein aber dafür stimmte einfach alles. Man merkt hier steckt viel liebe zum Detail drin.

Sehr zu empfehlen ist das Hoteleigene Restaurant. Das Avocado Toast zum Frühstück ist ein Muss! :)

title: Very friendly staff and quite accommodation in Time Square
text: The hotel has 6 months of life so everything is new. Decor reminds Ireland everywhere. Social areas are nice and welcoming. Staff is very friendly and helpful (Joseph in particular was very nice both at the check in and during my stay). Price very convenient (in my rate breakfast was included and so a pint of beer). Time square is right on the corner but you do not feel as the hotel has a very quite atmosphere. It's a small boutique hotel of just 28 rooms, good size to give a home feeling.

title: Butwearefamily
text: This hotel was beyond exceptional.  The staff were all very courteous, professional, full of knowledge about the city, and personable. My fiancé and I went on a long weekend to a concert and hang out with friends. The hotel is remarkably clean and very well planned out. The smell inside the hotel is amazing. (They can bottle it and sell it to guests)  every single employee that we saw positively interacted with us. The location is amazing. Right off of Times Square. We now plan to visit multiple times a year!!

title: Amazing hotel!
text: We stayed in this hotel with our two daughters for 4 nights in April. Every aspect of this hotel exceeded our expectations, including the exceptionally personalized service, the elegant yet comfortable ambience and decor, the delicious food, and how quiet and cozy the rooms were!  The location was perfect.  It felt  like we were coming home to our Irish family every day after exploring the big city!  We will definitely stay here again and have recommended it to all of our friends.

title: Was perfect and adorable!
text:
My family and I stayed there for one night though we also had a couple meals there. It was a perfect boutique hotel, in a prime location to enjoy the shows in Times Square.

The food was very good and the staff were very polite and friendly. And the rooms were perfect for our needs. Very comfy beds and large bathrooms. The rooms were small but again, had everything you need. The one note I’d make is about the showers and it was surprisingly difficult to figure out the temperature. And the decorator did a very nice job as well. Would absolutely go back!

title: Very Quaint Hotel in a very crazy place...AMAZING!!!
text:
The Merrion Row Hotel exceeded my expectations.  It is a beautiful cozy environment and the staff is amazing.  It is like taking a step back in time yet very modern at the same time.  The rooms and dining area are beautiful and over all the hotel is quiet.
I look forward to going back soon.

title: Wonderful Irish Hospitality
text: From the moment I checked in with Frank at the front desk, the service was superb.  Everyone, including the barmen and the wait staff, was uniformly warm and friendly.  I appreciated being treated in a way that made me feel instantly at home.  The location was great as a midtown location close to Times Square and the theater district, with various subway stops nearby.  It is a  boutique hotel nestled in a block of Irish pubs but my room, facing the street, gave me no issues with street noise.  It was perfect for a quick business trip, with a sturdy Irish breakfast to get my day started.

title: Delizioso ed accogliente
text:
Un hotel dove è come sentirsi a casa: accogliente, elegante, pulito e centralissimo, a due passi da Times Square ma, nonostante ciò, lontano dalla calca e dal caos della famosa piazza. Le stanze non sono molto grandi ma sono dotate di ogni comfort, in più incluso nel prezzo del soggiorno offrono la colazione continentale, il che è piuttosto raro negli Stati Uniti. 
L'albergo è gestito da irlandesi ed ogni dettaglio nell'arredamento lo ricorda: quadri, tavoli, bicchieri...perfino la birra, offerta dal gestore durante la durata del soggiorno.
Un saluto particolare a Rob, che con grande pazienza e gentilezza ci ha assistito nell'effettuare le prenotazioni ai ristoranti ed alle attrazioni, ed a Linda, la "Galway girl" che ogni mattina ci illuminava la giornata col suo sorriso e la sua cordialità. See you very soon!

title: Located in the heart of the city exploring was a breeze.
text: Located close to Times Square and the theater district this hotel was all we had hoped for. A boutique hotel with good service, friendly Irish staff, nice rooms and a good breakfast to start the day. Located in the heart of the city exploring was a breeze.

title: Best Hotel in New York City
text:
Definitely my favorite hotel in New York. We stayed one week here with my husband and kid. Everything was perfect.
Location is very convenient. The team is very helpful and friendly.
Thanks Mark (General Manager) to make our stay wonderful.
Thanks all the team (Joseph, Troy, Rob, Reina...) for everything.
Rooms are so nice and quite. (rare in Time Square).
Restaurant was delicious. 
Merrion Row is a wonderful Boutique hotel.
I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Lovely boutique hotel steps away from Midtown action
text:
Had the pleasure of staying here for a recent work trip - what a lovely hotel!  Beautifully appointed and the staff was wonderful.  Reina was so welcoming and friendly when she checked me in.

Highly recommended!  Will definitely re-book here for my next trip.

title: Excellent 10/10. Mon Hôtel préféré à NYC
text:
J’avoue avoir bien regardé les avis avant de réserver notre séjour de 8 nuits. 
Tous les avis positifs pour le Merrion Row Hotel m’ont convaincus de réserver. 
Que j’ai bien fait. Tout était exceptionnel. Encore mieux que ce que je pensais. 
Je voyage le monde entier. Je vais dans des hôtels 5*, des palaces “everywhere”. 
Le Merrion Row est un boutique hotel qui m’a apporté plus de plaisir que tous ces hôtels. Mon épouse et notre fille ont été aussi enchantées. 
Le général manager Mark est très professionnel. Il est très concerné par le bien-être de ses clients. Il veille sur tout. 
Il est accessible et très disponible (contrairement à tellement d’hôtels...) Mark vous donnera de bons conseils aussi. 
C’est tout le personnel que je félicite (Rob, Troy, Linda, Reina, les cuisiniers...). Au Merrion Row Hotel, vous aurez un service personnalisé, sincère et pas stéréotypé comme toutes les chaînes hôtelières.
Les concierges sont très pros et très utiles. 
Le personnel du restaurant (petit-déjeuner et autres) s’occupe très bien de vous. Toujours avec le sourire. Les plats sont très bons. Nous avons d’ailleurs souvent déjeuner ou dîner au Merrion Row. Contrairement à beaucoup de restaurants new yorkais, ici tout est clean et bon. 
Les chambres sont cosy. Belle superficie. Bien équipées. Literie parfaite. Lumière parfaite. 
Un mot sur l’emplacement. Il est super bien placé. Tout est proche à pied (Central Park, 5eme avenue, Central Station, Broadway, Bryant Park...)
Bref, voilà mon hôtel préféré de New York. 
Absolutely fantastic. 
J’ai hâte de revenir vite. A bientôt

title: Merrion Row accessible many places in midtown NYC
text:
Overall: very satisfactory
Room: enough for solo tourist, bathroom / toilet separated. Very functional equipped with almost everything. new and clean
Hotel: compact with only 28 rooms
Restaurant and Bar: quite nice
Breakfast included in resort fee - continental breakfast
Staff: very friendly
Location: very convenient - 5th to 9th (Hudson yards), and Central part to Chelsea in walking distance. Many subway stations nearby

いろいろ探した結果、直前でこちらに決めました、とてもよかったです。オープンは昨年12月。まだ新しいです。小さいながら機能的にできていて、観光ビジネスに便利な場所だと思います。同じ通りに幾つもパブ、レストランデリなどあり、またタイムズスクエアまで近距離です。

title: Formidable
text:
L'hôtel est idéalement situé, très proche de Times Square, de Broadway et de diverses stations de métro. Le bar de l'hôtel est très agréable, avec un personnel charmant.
La chambre que nous avions réservée était un peu petite (queen size), le manager Rob nous a gratuitement proposé une chambre King Size. Je vous recommande la réservation de ce type de chambre : Excellente literie, belle décoration et salle de bain parfaite.
L'ensemble du personnel est à l'écoute, ce fut un fabuleux séjour.

title: A Quaint Slice of Ireland in the Middle of Times Square
text: I cannot express how delighted I was to come across Merrion Row Hotel and Public House.  Each year my sisters and I have a weekend in NYC with a show, meals and sightseeing.  Upon check in Mark LaHood (GM) greeted us, offered us a drink and showed us to our rooms.  We planned on having dinner elsewhere but time was tight as we had tickets to the theater.  We decided to eat at The Public House in the hotel.  The service was spectacular, the food delicious, salmon perfectly cooked, short rib sliders (my personal fave), Linguine (al dente) with clams, crab cakes, and, of course, fish and chips, crispy & cooked to perfection, everything was fresh and tasty.  In the morning we had breakfast at The Public House, we ordered different items again. The lemon ricotta pancakes was served with warm maple syrup (heaven), fluffy omlette, avocado toast, thick yummy crisp bacon.. I could go on and on. I do want to add that the rooms were quiet and we could not hear outside noise which was a concern when booking.  The rooms were clean and the entire place is beautifully decorated with so many amazing personal details specific to Ireland. The entire staff could not have been more warm and professional!.  I highly recommend this accommodation and restaurant and cannot wait to revisit.  Well done to the proprietors. Slante

title: Wonderful hotel
text: Just a wonderful boutique hotel.  A real gem. Will stay here whenever I’m in NY. Couldn’t ask for a nicer staff, modern exquisitely clean rooms, and great location.  Highest recommendation. Rooms are completely silent despite being in the middle of Times Square which is exceptionally rare.

title: Great Hotel and Experience!
text:
If I could give 10 stars I would!!!!!
My experience at Merrion Row Hotel and Public House was perfect. 
Excellent staff and management make this a real gem!! It is a little bit of Ireland in the Big Apple

title: Kleines Spitzen Hotel in perfekter Lage
text:
Das Merrion Row Hotel ist ein neues kleines Boutique Hotel in perfekter Lage ganz in der Nähe des Time Square. Das Hotel hat nur wenige Zimmer und in der Lobby einen schönen Gästeraum mit netter Bar, sowie eine überdachte Terasse zum Lunchen oder Frühstücken.
Die Zimmer sind sehr stylish eingerichtet und top ausgestattet. Sie sind recht groß für NY Verhältnisse (in meinem Fall das Studio). Die Betten sind spitze.
Der Service ist easy going, höchst persönlich und sehr familiär. Der Aufenthalt hat mir sehr gut gefallen, das Hotel ist sehr zu empfehlen.

title: Fantastic find
text:
Just spent 5 nights at the Merrion Row and had an incredible time. Hotel is brilliant, staff are the best we have come across, food was really good. You can’t get a better location for everything you would want to do around Times Square. Special thanks to Mark, Joseph, Rob, Linda, John, and Holly for their welcome and hospitality throughout.
Thanks for contributing to our great stay.

title: Great little hotel
text: Came to NYC to take an elderly friend to see a couple of shows. The hotel was lovely!!! The staff was so helpful and kind. It was like coming home everyday after our outings. Highly recommend! Comfortable, clean, great staff, lovely bar and dining area, great food! Will be staying here again for sure!

title: Amazing hotel in Times Square!
text: We had a wonderful stay at this lovely hotel, steps from our Broadway show. The staff were helpful and lovely, the room was a perfect size for our family of four, and the breakfast was delicious. We will definitely be back!

title: Gracious staff
text: I just stayed one night for a work trip and was so happy to find this boutique hotel. It’s quaint and adorable, and all of the staff was incredibly gracious and helpful (especially Franc!). Thank you for a lovely trip and all your help.

title: Superbe séjour
text:
Nous avons séjourné au Merrion Row et non seulement l’hotel est vraiment jolie, beaucoup de cachet, mais l’accueil y était incroyable. Toujours au devant pour nous aider, cocktail de bienvenu et viennoiseries pour le déjeuner.
L’emplacement est génial à 2 pas de Time Square!

Merci à tout le personnel pour son accueil chaleureux et la belle attention pour notre fille qui a été malade.

title: An Oasis in Times Square
text:
My wife and I recently stayed at this hotel for a combination personal/business trip. We found Merrion Row at the last second when we found out our original hotel would not be turning on the AC for another week - and I'm very glad we did, as we loved our stay. The hotel is beautifully and thoughtfully designed. While the rooms are small (basically just big enough to fit a queen bed), that's not unusual for the area. They make good use of the space and the bathrooms are quite large.

As others have mentioned, the staff is wonderful. Hotels in midtown are usually just places to go rest up in between work or activities. However, we found ourselves looking forward to stepping back into the relative calm of the hotel and grabbing a pint in the nice pub from barman Karl. We also ordered breakfast from the full menu and it was very tasty. The welcome pints are a very nice touch, though the continental breakfast included in the property fee seemed a bit unnecessary. Just give me free coffee in the morning (there is no coffee maker in the rooms).

The only thing to be cautious about (and the reason I docked a star) is that the neighboring rooftop bar played loud club music on Saturday night until 2am. Maybe it was just our room's location - not everyone seems to have this problem - but it was quite loud and made it difficult for me to sleep until the party wound down.

Overall, I highly recommend staying here if you need to be in midtown. It's a gem.

title: We love it
text:
We love it. 
100 points for ambiance and attention. Clean and bright. 
Good food. 
Great service. 
I will recommend this hotel to my family and friend as and for sure we will come again. 
We are so happy we chose it to stay for our visit to NY 
Thanks

title: A gem
text: Can’t say enough good things. A really lovely boutique hotel in the centre of the world. A retreat from the craziness of New York. This hotel is classy, quaint, quiet and quite special! Word will get out so book soon; they only opened in December. Congrats on a superb place to stay. We will be back!

title: The best hôtel in Time Square
text:
The Merrion Row Hôtel is the best hôtel we can find in New York at Time Square ! The price, quality and proximity ! 

The staff was perfect, friendly and professional ! 

A special thank you for Joseph, Frank and the incredible Miriam (barmaid) ! 
Thank you again to the director and Miriam for the evening where we were able to discover the French song to all the hotel and the 45 th!  It was very cool ! 😂✌️

So all is perfect ! Don’t think and reserved immediately ! 

I come back next year with another friends i hope ! Thanks again and see you nextime the Merrion Row 🇺🇸💯✈️

The french singer ! 

Dylan Pinon. Room 503 03 April 2019.

title: An oasis of warmth and hospitality
text:
I've just returned after 3 nights Merrion Row and I miss the place already. It's an oasis of warmth and hospitality just a few blocks from the hustle and bustle of Times Square.  Unlike many other "Irish" places in the area, this feels like a hotel and pub that you might find in a trendy neighborhood in Dublin rather than the typical American imitation Irish bar. The decoration everywhere is warm and laid back yet impeccably tasteful and classy.

The food in the bar is excellent - I particularly enjoyed the full Irish breakfast which will leave you energized for a long day of sightseeing with no need to stop for lunch.

Upon checking in, the hotel offers a "welcome pint" which I thought was a nice touch. John the bartender from Donegal was particularly welcoming, as was Mark the hotel manager.

The rooms are spotlessly clean – everything is brand new and works flawlessly. The bathrooms in particular are beautiful and spacious, uncommonly so for this part of the city. Even the internet access was fast.

In short I can not recommend the place highly enough.

title: Restaurant
text: Absolutely stunning food in the restaurant,only found this wonderful place on our last day but on future visits to New York this hotel and restaurant will be on top of the list,highly recommend to anyone who is planning a holiday

title: Fabulous Boutique Hotel - 1 min from Times Square
text:
Stayed 4 nights and have absolutely nothing to complain about! Staff is extremely friendly and service oriented. I would personally like to THANK Reina, Joseph & John for making me feel welcome and always making sure that I had everything I could possibly need. 
I asked for a quiet room on a high floor, and to be honest I DID NOT hear one siren or garbage truck through out my stay. Wow! 

The hotel is perfectly located (1 min from Times Square), public transport is around the corner and most parts of Midtown can be reached by foot (20-25 min). 

Rooms are a bit small,... but bright, clean and equipped with modern technology. 

I will definitely return to the Merrion Row Hotel :)

title: Attentive Staff and welcoming atmosphere
text: Stayed for the weekend of March 29th - March 31st. We were welcomed warmly by the staff and given some complementary drink tickets, always a plus. Staff was very attentive and greeted us by our names whenever we were leaving or returning. Room was clean and comfortable. A little small for my liking, but we were in/out a lot so no complaints. Breakfast was very good and the location was perfect, a few steps from Time square, but was a nice escape when you needed it. I would definitely return.

title: Irish hospitality at it's best!
text:
This hotel is just wonderful - small, but so friendly.  Situated right in the heart of New York, just steps away from Time Square and Broadway Theaters - you just couldn't get nearer the action.

This newly renovated hotel is a taste of Irish hospitality.  Spotlessly clean throughout. The food is wonderful, particularly the breakfasts!  The chat in the bar with the Irish staff was so enjoyable we stayed there until after midnight!

I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel!

title: Jewel of a Hotel Just Steps Away from Times Square
text:
With much good fortune, we have found a hotel jewel located just steps away from New York City's iconic Times Square and within easy walking distance of the Theatre District, Restaurant Row, Herald Square, Bryant Park, and Rockefeller Center. There are not enough superlatives to describe the FANTASTIC guest experience we had at the Merrion Row Hotel and Public House. The rooms and the entire hotel itself were immaculately kept. Without exception, each and every hotel-staff member with whom we interacted was exceptionally professional and personable and went above and beyond to exceed our guest expectations!! We travel to New York City often for both business and personal trips and have stayed at many notable hotels. The Merrion Row Hotel tops them all!! We already had hotel reservations for our upcoming summer vacation and within an hour of staying at the Merrion Row Hotel, we canceled them and made new ones at the Merrion!! This is an exceptional hotel for family visits, romantic getaways, and business trips. 
Mark, Frank, Joseph, Miriam, Pedro, Rob, and Troy exemplify what it truly means to be customer focused. Thank you to them and all the other hotel-team members operating behind the scenes who made our guest experience a stellar one!! We look forward to our return!!

title: Relaxing boutique hotel in the heart of the Broadway theater district
text: My wife and I stayed here for two nights recently and had a wonderful time. The room was small but with very efficient use of space. It provided a very comfortable bed and space for us to retreat at the end of our walks around the city. Plenty of outlets for those with numerous electronic devices. Window overlooking 45th Street but with heavy blinds when privacy was desired. Would definitely stay here again. Joseph at the front desk was very kind and helpful, as were the other two attendants with whom we interacted.

title: Nuestra Mejor Experiencia en Nueva York!
text:
Nuestra experiencia en el Hotel Merrion Row fue sencillamente Excelente !  La ubicacion es perfecta para desplasarse a cualquier lugar en Nueva York, esta a unos pasos de Times Square y a no mas de 5 minutos para las estaciones del Subway que encontramos lo mas practico para desplazarnos a todo Manhattan y Brooklin.
Tuvimos el placer de ser recibidos calidamente por Joseph en la recepcion, nos asistió en todo lo necesario para hacernos sentir comodos para comenzar nuestra experiencia en la gran Manzana.  Del mismo modo cada dia se aseguró de orientarnos sobre nuestros planes y asegurarse que nuestra estancia era completamente placentera en el Hotel. Siempre muy amable hablando en Español con nosotros.
Obviamente que habia otras personas encargadas en diferentes turnos, como Troy y Frank, quienes no fueron diferentesen el trato para mi Esposa y Yo.
Quedamos impresionados por el orden y los detalles tan bien cuidados que se ofrecen en todo el Hotel, aun siendo pequeño se nota el esmero por ofreceru a estancia de CALIDAD SUPERIOR. Las Habitaciones son exactamente lo que muestran las fotos. Todo es pulcro y de muy buen gusto. La decoracion tiene estilo britanico y tanto la habitacion como el baño muy comodos. Ademásde que nunca tuvimos molestia de ruido, tanto d3 la calle como de otras habitaciones... realmente sirve para descansar y despertar con energias renovadas.
El Servicio en el Resturante es muy bueno, los desayunos muy ricos y bien presentados... dificil resistirse a probar la variedad del menu au  cuando la tarifa ee hotel incluye desayuno Continental, muy bueno tambien. El joven John que atiende las mesas es muy atento y anticipado a cualquier cosa necesaria para hacer una experiencia muy confortable en el Restaurant.
No puedo terminar de enumerar todo lo que puedo recomendar de este Hotel. Simplemente decir que ES MUY BUENO y todo su Staff ENCANTADOR !

E. Aguilera 
Cozumel, Mexico.

title: New York Spring Break 2019!
text: The Merrion Row Hotel Bar/Lounge made our trip to New York a memorable event from March 18 to 22, 2019. We didn’t stay at the hotel we just happen to be walking by and decided to meet up with our other friends for happy hour and dinner. The entrance to the lobbythst lead you to the back of the bar/lounge was so inviting and just was a special place to find the serene time that we were looking for after a busy day touring NYC. We plan on returning next time we are in New York. Our thanks to Reina who was so much fun to chat with her every time we were there...

title: Beautiful place and staff!
text: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and we absolutely loved it! I have been staying in a lot of different hotels in New York, but this one is the absolute best! The staff are always there to help with the best service. The breakfast are delicious!! I recommend this hotel from the bottom of my heart!!

title: AMAZING WEEKEND GETAWAY
text:
I'm from ATL and we recently booked the Merrion Row Hotel in NYC for an Early 50th Birthday/Girls trip 3/9-3/11.  We had Broadway tickets to see NETWORK which this Hotel is literally right around the corner from the Belasco Theatre.  This was my 2nd trip up this year/ 3rd hotel experience around Times Square.   Merrion Row BLEW ME AWAY with our Accommodations.  From Check in to Check out we had an amazing stay.  The Rooms are Spacious.  We had (2) Oversized Queen beds... Floor to Ceiling Mirror for Changing, nice desk ... huge Flat Screen TV and a Walk in Shower/2 shower heads ...gorgeous Bathroom.  Plenty of outlets for plug ins.  Charging devices.  The room was electronically controlled (lights and heating/air).  The floors hardwood with rug under beds.  High Ceilings; fresh paint.  The air/heat system silent.  It is a small intimate stay (meaning not many floors or rooms).  The stay felt more like a HOME than a Hotel.  You are just 2 blocks off Broadway and the room was QUIET... you are minutes away from Rockefeller Center; shopping, diamond district...etc.  Great Restaurants; Starbucks across the street..  

What set this place apart from the other 2 I've stayed at this year was not only room size/comfort but The People!  The staff was Amazing, friendly and helpful.  Joseph was instrumental w/our check in process and getting our bags to room when it was ready.  The Bar/Restaurant was excellent... lots of great Beers/Drinks.  Breakfast in the morning was top notch and reasonably priced.  It rained on Sunday and they had large handled Umbrella's for Patron use.  The only slight problem was that I had to print something out and they did not have a business computer/printer  ...however; the staff just had me send the document to the hotel email account and they printed it out for me while I stood at the front desk.  Again; top notch service.  We were leaving on flights late Monday night and asked for a 12:00 checkout and they held our bags while we continued to venture out until we returned at 5:00 pm  to head to the airport.  The staff helped guide Uber to us at the street and off we went.  The whole stay was Seamless.  If you are looking for a nice, spacious, quiet, convenient  --- super friendly hotel...do not pass this one up.  You will not be disappointed in your choice to stay with this Hotel and Staff.

title: Perfect weekend stay in the city
text: We stayed here over St. Patrick's Day weekend and I was looking for a new hotel to stay in from the other one's that we bounce around at when we visit for the weekend in the Midtown area.  I've now found the perfect spot to stay when we return.  The price is acceptable for what I look for when visiting, and the small, unique, cozy feel of what it offers is exactly what we want.  The service from the moment we checked in up until the moment we checked out was first class, and everything in between from the front desk to the servers and bartenders in the public house.  The rooms are wonderful and clean and brand new, and I cannot say a bad thing about our stay.  I'll be staying here again the next time we come back to NYC and it won't even be a debate.  We couldn't have enjoyed our stay any more than we did.

title: Simpatia e cerveja boa
text:
Fomos no pub ao lado do hotel, só pra tomar 1. Estava lotado e a recepcionista nos indicou o hotel que tem um bar que é do mesmo dono. Local Romântico, bem pequeno, luz âmbar, limpeza impecável e móveis de bom gosto. Tomamos 3 Guinness, uma  kilkenny e uma smithwicks red ale...$8,00/cada. Todas excepcionais. 
Atendimento da Miriam rápido, simpático e comunicativa. Foi bastante compreensiva quando passei o cartão e esqueci da gorjeta (dei em cash).

title: Awesome Midtown Hospitality
text:
I had the good fortune of spending St. Patrick’s Day weekend at this gem of a world class hotel property hidden in mid-town Manhattan. 

From the moment I walked in the door I experienced unbelievably gracious and top quality hospitality from every member of the staff with which I made contact. It was truly refreshing to have everyone I interacted with do everything they could to make my stay enjoyable. Not a common occurrence in today’s hospitality environment.  I can’t recall all of their names but I’m happy to acknowledge the great service of the few I do remember including Joseph, Franc, Shona and Karl. 

The fit, finish and furnishings of the hotel rooms, common areas and restaurant/bar were grand and reminded me of the many fine international hotels I have visited over the years - including the Merrion in Dublin. 

Food and beverage was top shelf and much better than you’d expect in a hotel. Most importantly, they dedicated extra taps in the bar for additional Guinness to flow during this most special time of the year ☘️

If you’re looking for a first class boutique hotel in NYC that is fairly priced and where you will feel like you’re at home with family and friends - this is the place for you. 

I can’t wait to return.

title: Excelente hotel
text:
Personal, aspecto, atencion, limpieza, ubicacion, confort. Excelentes!!!!!
Desayuno continental incluido. prolijo, adecuado y bien servido. 
Estadia muy agradable y amena 
Volveria sin duda alguna a este hotel

title: Great botique hotel with Irish Touch
text: Had very good two night stay at this newer hotel.   Centrally located a block off of Times Square and great proximity to Theater District.   Nice size room; only downside was probs my recently painted as it had a paint smell odor but was not too bad; bar-eating areas very nice and quaint; “resort fee” but did include couple of pints per day and continental breakfast (or discount on regular breakfasts).   Plenty of Irish around and very friendly staff (also mostly Irish).
