We were here (coincidentally) while st.patricks day parade was happening - they own the pub next door - and while crowded for the day and night you would not know being next door with so little noise.   Would definitely recommend if you at in NYC and want to be centrally located in Times Square area.

title: Fantastic Location and Great Staff
text:
Stayed here in 11th December 2018 when the hotel first opened (apologies for the delayed review). 

This was such a great find in the heart of New York City. I spent hours trawling through hotels on the various websites and I’m glad I did as me and girlfriend both agreed this is probably one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. 

The rooms are small but it was expected as it’s in the centre of New York City. The location is unreal - 30 seconds and you’re in the centre of Times Square, yet the rooms are so quiet and cosy! 

Megan who checked us in was so helpful to us first timers New Yorkers. Very professional and friendly - writing this review 3 months later, her customer service still stands out. 

The bedding was so fresh and after an 8 hour flight with jet lag, the sleep was great. 

I would recommend this hotel to anyone - everything about the place was clean, fresh and great. It really helped make the trip so special.

title: Just like home
text:
I have visited the Big Apple twice a year for 30 years and nothing tops this experience 
What a friendly group of people in the core of NY. Nothing more than excellence in my eyes. Worth the experience

title: Restaurant at Hotel
text: Had the pleasure of dining there for lunch.  It is fairly new; entire hotel has been redone.  Restaurant is small but has an old world charm to it.  It is very pretty.  Food is outstanding.  Had fish chowder that had chunks of fish in it; also shrimp salad that had 5 huge shrimp, not little ones that you are usually given.  All were delicious.  A welcome change from the Irish pubs in the area.  Service is superb.  Plan on going back and highly recommend.

title: Extra Friendly New Hotel
text: Lovely boutique hotel, small, quiet and charming staff as well.  Recently renovated and within easy walking distance to the Theaters with several choices to eat right on the street if you didn't want to eat in the hotel.  However, the food in the hotel was quick and delicious as well!  Felt very safe there.  The staff always asked about our plans for the day and could they help in any way.  A special thanks to Joseph and Mark, I hope we'll see you next visit!

title: Quiet and Elegant
text: Really nicely done, lovely renovations...a little oasis in the chaos of Times Square. So quiet-nice sheets, great bed, huge bathroom. For NYC standards, this was a great experience for a mid-priced hotel.

title: Gastvrij, luxe hotel met prima restaurant en zeer vriendelijk personeel op toplocatie!
text:
Zeer vriendelijk, attent personeel die alles in het werk stelt om het jou naar de zin te maken. Mooie, ruime schone kamers. Prima restaurant waar je lekker aan de bar kunt zitten of een lekker hapje kan eten. Prima kwaliteit! 

Verder zit het hotel op slechts 100 meter van Time Square, echt een toplocatie!

title: None
text:
Great location in theater district 

Beautiful, very private, quiet, boutique hotel, great bar and delicious food. 

Rooms are small but very comfortable and well designed.

Staff is very professional and extremely helpful.

title: Business Meeting in NYC
text: Location is excellent, Food and Atmosphere in the Lounge was perfect and the guest service was exceptional! The rooms are comfortable and seem setup for the economical traveler. I don't need room to roam and I'm not living in the room! I prefer a clean place to stay and the bedding is as good as any place I've stayed! Well worth the price!

title: Charming and Unique!
text: I loved EVERYTHING about this place!  We were in town for a show and wanted to stay somewhere within walking distance of the theater.I was nervous about staying in a hotel so close to Times Square, but this small boutique hotel was the perfect spot!  Once you step through the door, you feel worlds away from the hustle and bustle. So charming and unique!  The room was small, but everything is new and clean and fresh, so we really didn't mind the size.(Unless you're planning on spending a lot of time in your room, you should be fine.) Some other reviewers have mentioned noise issues, but our room was extremely quiet.  Got a great night's sleep.  The staff could not have been more friendly and accommodating. (Shout out to both of our bartenders!) Will definitely be staying here again!

title: Great hotel with amazing staff
text: The Merrion Row Hotel is wonderful.  It is in a great location and the staff is great.  Very attentive and friendly.  The room we stayed in was fairly small, but it was wonderfully decorated with great finishes.  The whole hotel is extremely clean and nicely done.

title: Like a European B&B But Better!
text: Since it was a new property I was a bit nervous in making the reservation as I wasn't sure if the reviews were really marketing tactic to get business. I'm so glad I chose Merrion Row Hotel - it was perfect. The location was on the same street as the show we were attending, doable walk from the train station and convenient to Times Square and Rockefeller Center.  The hotel decor/design was perfect, I loved that the room had hardwood floors with an area rug - made you feel more at home. The concierge/desk staff were awesome and accommodating. A huge thank you to Troy and Melissa (and the bartender) for making my birthday better than the show I came to see. And as I told them, I really didn't want to give a good review because I may not be able to book a room next time because they'll be so popular.  Also, note that my friend cancelled her business travel reservation at a different hotel for the following week so she could stay at the Merrion Row Hotel.

title: Irish Excellence
text: I spent a week at Merrion Row traveling on business - what a beautiful spot to call home. It’s like staying in Dublin, but just steps to the hustle and bustle of Times Square, without any of the noise and crowds. The service is genuine and topnotch, and really enjoyed the evenings eating, working and socializing with other travelers in the lobby/living room area downstairs. The food is delish and everyone was so accommodating - extra points for the GF bread options at breakfast. The room has everything you need, great decor and the music in the elevator was one of my favorite parts.

title: A great hotel in Manhattan
text:
We stayed here for a week (15th - 22nd Feb). The hotel is a welcome haven from the larger hotels in NYC. It’s is beautifully decorated and everything is fresh, clean and well presented, This place does actually look like the pictures! The staff are friendly, welcoming and were always helpful. Despite other comments we had no issues with noise in the hotel above what you would expect in any hotel. The street noise was also minimal on the 4th floor (we were overlooking 45th street) 

If you are looking for something central, location wise this hotel is perfect. Right off Times Square and close to Subway stations, major attractions and restaurants. If you don’t fancy going out too far the food at the hotel resturant was great and the bar is a nice place for a cocktail or evening meal.

While I was happy with my stay, there were a few minor niggles I wanted to mention. The free continental breakfast (which is covered in the tax and service charge) is ok and enough to keep you going for a while, but there is a $3.00 service charge to pay the breakfast staff, so it’s not really complimentary. The biggest criticism for me is the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the rooms. Coffee is available in the bar from 7am, but if your up early or, like us stuck on UK time there is no chance of a hot drink unless you leave the hotel (There is a great 24hr deli next door), but 1st thing in a morning you just want a hot drink! 

I would certainly stay here again and recommend it to anyone visiting NYC.

title: Great location - but room for improvement
text:
Stayed here for 5 days for wife’s 40th. I emailed before our arrival and asked if upgrade was available as we arrived on her actual 40th birthday. Hotel emailed back - no upgrade available but we will make it special. This amounted to nothing. We arrived and no mention of birthday in any shape or form.

Location wise it is basically yards from Times Square and 1km to Central Park. What more do you want. Bright clean, small and brand new. Rooms are basically a bed and not much more...but you don’t come to New York to sit in.

Don’t book taxi to airport through hotel. We had asked at desk for best way back to JFK and took their advice . I feel we got ripped off and the hotel knew it!!!. When you see the taxi man tipping the hotel staff in front of you as he is collecting you, you just know your paying more. It’s a flat fee of 56 plus tolls from manhattan to airport. Yet when we asked at hotel then said we can arrange it. We then asked taxi can we pay by card and he said no problem. We were then brought to JFK through residential area to avoid the tolls, driver did this we didn’t ask. Yet when we got to airport we were told 75 Euro plus 10% to pay by card...then a tip on top of this...RIP OFF and arranged by hotel.

Do yourself a favor walk out the door wait 15 secs and arrange your own cab. 

Good overall experience just feel let down by hotel at the end with taxi and no acknowledgment of Birthday.

title: What a gem!
text: The level of service and the comfortable feeling of this boutique hotel are outstanding! All of the staff were service-oriented from the check-in experience, to the cocktails/bites in the Public House, to the delightful continental breakfast, and the quaint rooms - all were incredibly warm and charming! The rooms are not elaborate - but they are sufficient for the time spent in the room and the room was so quiet at night I slept as if I was at home. If you are spending time seeing Broadway shows, shopping on 5th Avenue, people-watching in Times Square, or wanting to be in the heart of midtown Manhattan, this is the hotel for you - location is superb and it feels like a warm, cozy respite at the end of the day.

title: Incredible value, top-notch experience
text: The best experience I've had in NYC for the price. Spotless, thoughtfully appointed, great "personality", warm welcome, terrific dining area, pleasant public workspace, nice bar. Believe I had one of the larger rooms - it was more than enough space and a very inviting setup. Irish themes throughout, but in a way that enhanced the experience, never dominated it. e.g. enjoyed the Irish radio station piped into the elevator. I've been travelling to NYC for a long time and can't recall the last time I was this impressed.

title: Great small hotel near theaters
text: We stayed at Merrion Row on a recent Saturday evening. We had tickets for a play, “The Ferryman,” and wanted to stay somewhere close to the theater. The Merrion is half a block east of Times Square, and the theater is half a block west, both on 45th St. it’s a small hotel, a recently converted building. Six storeys , and small but spotless rooms that were reasonably priced. We stayed in one on the back of the building, which was a lower rate. The first floor is a small lobby and a bar/restaurant, the latter opening on to a solarium. We ate in the restaurant a couple of times, and the food was excellent and not overpriced. The menu was Irish themed, as was the hotel. The bar had a great selection of tap beers, including, of course, Guinness. TVs over the bar were tuned to Irish football. That and the play made for an Irish themed weekend! We plan to return on our next theater visit.

title: Exceptional
text:
The Merrill Row has exceptional service. Very hospitable staff, exceptional food, and very pleasant atmosphere.
A special thank you to Frank!
We would definitely stay here again. If you like a warm and friendly atmosphere, I highly recommend The Merrion Row.

title: Great Service!
text: The staff here is so great! This is such a cute boutique hotel, they go above and beyond. The character, the great location and welcome pint were great. The beds were comfy and the little details really made the spot a hit.

title: Wonderful stay — couldn’t be cuter, cleaner, friendlier!
text: We visited Merrion Row for my fiancé’s birthday and chose the location bc of proximity to shows. The hotel is incredibly clean, impeccably designed with A+ service. We loved hanging out in the common spaces bc of the cozy atmosphere and incredible, unfussy service. Can’t say enough good things!! We will be back! Loved the boutique experience w a great price and kind service. Appreciated the birthday macaroons, too!!

title: Great location, great service
text: This place used to be a youth hostel. It’s been totally redone and is very new and modern. Loved the vibe and location. 3 blocks to Rockefeller Center.the food was excellent. Johnny and Frank at the front were so friendly. I’d stay there again!

title: An excellent choice
text:
My husband and I were in NYC during the week for a play in Times Square and stayed at this charming, well run hotel.  Stepping into the hotel I immediately thought, I am going to like staying here.  The interior is well designed and welcoming, There are nice touches of unique materials and fabrics. And one is not met with a front desk, but with a stylish dining/lounge area. 
But the highlights for us were the fresh food being served in the restaurant and the quietness of our room.  We had a front room on 45th Street, however there was no NYC NOISE filtering into our room and the window treatment blocked any exterior ambient light at night.
The staff was friendly and accommodating .  
What a pleasure it was to stay so close the the theater. 
What a pleasure it was to stay at this hotel !

title: Ate at Public House and the food was excellent
text: Had dinner at Public House and the food was amazing! We ate here before a show and the service was wonderful. I ordered the fish and chips and they were great. I always judge a restaurant based on their French fries and they did not disappoint. While I didn’t stay at the hotel, I will next time I’m in NYC!  Great new spot.

title: Fabulous Find in NYC
text: I was so happy to find this place. It's a beautiful new Irish-owned hotel, which opened in December 2018. I was there to meet friends for a meal. So, while I didn't stay in the hotel (I live in Manhattan) I did get the chance to look at several rooms which are spacious, very clean, attractive and modern looking. Pricing is competitive especially for that area – right in the heart of the city - and for the winter months. The restaurant and bar area are fabulous. Modern decor (again) with an array of artwork from various Irish artists. The restaurant is so light and airy with a big skylight above, it's like being outdoors with the warmth and comfort of being inside. It is not too big and has a really nice, intimate feel. Nice menu too. Wonderful staff. A big shout-out to Troy, the manager, who was so kind and friendly and went out of his way to show me around. Wait staff terrific too. I have already started to tell my friends about it. Wishing them the very best of luck! (I'm heading back as soon as I can for another meal.)

title: 50th Birthday Weekend
text: We usually stay in larger, higher end hotels, but on this trip in, we decided to choose a smaller boutique type hotel near the theater district....sorry Ritz Carlton, I am now a convert.  I loved the "like home" feel to Merrion Row Hotel and the staff was superb.  Our needs were immediately met, the rooms comfortable and modern, and the bar was perfect to start or end our nights.  We so enjoyed our stay here.  The only call out I have, there needs to be flatter pillow options.  When I mentioned this to the front staff, Johnny, he told me that was already in the works!  We will be back for certain.

title: Business trip visit
text: i booked at Merrion Row Hotel, because i know the place from earlier visits to New York, i was really surprised to see how they re-build the building from when it was a hostel back in the days. The way the hotel is run, the hospitality and how it looks like makes it a really relaxing place to stay in a very busy environment. i will for sure come back here and will advise a lot of people to stay in this place.

title: Lovely Stay!!
text: Went to New York to see a show and wander around New York. Just so happen to find this boutique on TripAdvisor. What a treat. Minutes away from time Square but once you walk into the hotel you felt miles away. The staff was wonderful and inviting the rooms were small but meticulously clean and beautiful. Will never stay any where else when in New York.

title: Beautiful new hotel
text: We were in NYC for a business/leisure trip and chose the Merrion Row because it was a new hotel and in a convenient location. The hotel is a small, boutique type hotel. Our room was spacious, especially for a NYC hotel. The room was beautifully decorated and had all modern amenities you would expect at an nice hotel. The bed was extremely comfortable and the rooms were quiet which was really nice considering Midtown Manhattan is crazy during early December. ALL of the staff at the hotel and restaurant(Public House)were EXTREMELY kind, courteous, helpful, efficient, and professional. The only issue we had was with the thermostat in the room. The setting would randomly change itself. I ended up speaking with the manager, Jonathan, about the thermostat and he did everything he could to get the thermostat fixed and even change rooms. The thermostat ended up just being defective which was not the hotel's fault as some of these types of things happen when opening a new hotel. Problems arise sometimes in the service industry and I believe the hallmark of good service is the response from staff and management. The staff and management of Merrion Row did EVERYTHING right and obviously have had excellent customer service training. I will DEFINITELY be back to Merrion Row and Public House on my next trip to Manhattan!

title: Lovely Stay and Incredibly Accommodating!!
text: Troy and the staff at this location could not have been more accommodating to my family and I. Opened recently, they are a well oiled machine. Staff was incredible, room was beautifully appointed and spacious, breakfast was super yummy. Totally worth the price and a great spot!

title: The beds were amazing
text: This is the best hotel I have ever been to I love this place so much the quality was great the food magnificent I had the margaritas which were very refreshing and the staff including Ella and Adelina were beyond charming

title: Wonderful gem!
text: My wife and I booked a room at this new boutique property (opened December 4th) for New Year’s Eve, as it is a stone’s throw from where the ball drops in Times Square. Beautiful, chic, trendy interior, outstanding staff, great dining and bar, very stylish and comfortable rooms. Great vibe. Will return frequently to take clients for drinks and meals as it’s close to my midtown office. I noticed a review about the thin walls but didn’t notice that when I stayed there despite it being New Year’s Eve.

title: Quite and nice!!
text: Quite and cozy place with excellent food at a reasonable price. I had a really good Lobster Bisque and a Homemade Potatoes Gnocchi with a butter squash sauce 😳😍!! It looks like a high end rest. from the outside but prices are good for the food and service.

title: 25th Anniversary Trip
text: This was a wonderful hotel for our 25th anniversary trip! From the moment we were greeted by the door man, who had a wonderful Irish accent, to the moment we checked out we were given excellent service. We arrived early and they not only checked us in early but upgraded us to one of their king suites. We had only been in the room a few minutes when they delivered complimentary champagne to our door with their well wishes for our anniversary. The room was clean and decorated beautifully with deep blues and textured wall features. No worn carpet here, just shiny hardwood floors with new rugs in strategic places. The lighting was even spectacular with different zones equipped with dimmer switches. The bed was very comfortable with quality linens and a clean sheet over the duvet, a foot runner at the bottom. They even included a complimentary continental breakfast that we didn’t know was included. There was only one thing that could have been better and that was maybe a piece of rubber stripping under the doors, one for the adjoining room and one for the hall door. We could hear our neighbors conversations quite clearly, but it was a quiet hotel otherwise. Thanks for making our trip special!

title: Lovely hotel, calm in the middle of bustling Times Square
text:
Loved this little boutique hotel! My husband and I came to NYC for a short visit and we were looking for something close to Times Square. This little gem was super close by, but the moment you walked in the doors, it was a calm oasis. 

The good:
- Everything is brand new
- The staff were very accommodating when we arrived early. Even though our room wasn't ready, they stored our luggage and even moved it to our room as soon as it was ready.
- The welcome [free] pints were greatly appreciated, as was free breakfast, which was a nice surprise we weren't expecting
- Loved the lounge area to relax in between activities
- Excellent wifi

The bad:
- The room was a bit small, but not unexpected [this is NYC...]
- The walls aren't exactly sound-proof [read: not at all] so you can hear an angry child wailing early in the morning

title: Amazing hotel, perfect location, great staff
text:
My husband and I absolutely loved Merrion Row Hotel and Public House in NY. We have been to NY many times and I have to say this was by far the best stay we had. The hotel is brand new and everything is super clean and chic. 
The staff goes out of their way to make sure you are well taken care of and happy. 
Jonnny at the front desk was so helpful. Every request was taken care of. He even looked up Broadway tickets for us online and gave suggestions. He really went above and beyond and made our stay so pleansant. Karl at the bar was so nice and made sure we were happy with our drinks, the bar has an amazing selection of drinks. Their breakfast menu was tasty and well priced. The beds are so comfortable, we slept like babies, and the tv has a super large selection of channels 

For the fact that you are right in Times Square and steps away from everything you literally cannot find anything better. We walked everywhere and were so so happy with the location, many subway stations right around the hotel. I would so highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to stay at a classy hotel and really enjoy everything NY has to offer.

title: The Irish Elegance Meets Times Square
text: Just spend a week at this gem. Elegantly appointed.  Great location steps from Bryant Park and Times Square. Great bar and restaurant and extremely friendly staff. Felt like Dublin in NYC. Would stay there for business or with family. Don't miss.

title: Saved our Christmas night!
text: The Merrion Row Hotel and Restaurant is amazing!  On Christmas day we had a reservation at a restaurant right next door and they wound up being closed (definitely skip Connolly's next door!).  The Merrion welcomed us in and we were so grateful and pleasantly surprised.  The service was super friendly, the decor was beautiful and the food was absolutely delicious!  We are so happy we came across this NYC gem.  They really saved the night.  We were so grateful for their hospitality.  This is a definite stop for anyone visiting NYC and we will be back!

title: Sometime you really CAN have nice things
text: What a little gem of a brand new property! The staff was extraordinary, the rooms were lovely and the food was beyond words. Steps away from Fifth Ave. at Christmas bustle but no street noise and the hotel was an oasis of European charm and civility. Can't come back soon enough. Thank you

title: Great find tucked into the theatre district
text: Stayed for a long weekend while in NYC to see a few Broadway performance. The hotel is a great find. Clean, peaceful, and beautifully decorated. The rooms are a bit small but it's NYC so that comes with the territory. I was pleased with room amenities. The complimentary breakfast is fairly lame but we boxed it up and easily found a homeless person that needed it. The welcome pint was a great touch. The location is easily walkable to many theatres, times square, Rockefeller square, Macy's, and St. Patrick's cathedral. We would definitely come back and stay again!

title: Wonderful
text: Booked this hotel on a whim as a birthday get away for my husband and I am so glad we did! Beautifully decorated lobby, restaurant and rooms.  Each staff member from the doormen, bartender, manager and reception were hospitable and friendly. Loved every aspect of our stay and hope to return again soon.

title: Outstanding Boutique Hotel
text: Just spent the weekend in NYC with friends. We were fortunate enough to stay at Merrion Row. The accommodations, staff and service were excellent. The hotel has a bar & restaurant with great drinks & food. We enjoyed every minute we were there. The staff, especially John, who was our server in the restaurant, was welcoming & accommodating to any request. If you are looking for great lodging around Times Square, definitely consider Merrion Row.

title: Amazing Hotel in Midtown
text: Fantastic brand new boutique hotel in midtown.   Rooms are perfectly decorated with high end linens and well appointed art work.   Bathrooms are crisp and clean - with top of the line fixtures and tile work.  Highly Highly recommend this hotel.   Bar and restaurant are just an added bonus!

title: Great Location and Price
text: You can't beat the location that is less than a block from Time Square. There is a nice restaurant and bar located in the hotel. The rooms aren't large but are sufficient. The entire staff including Jonathan, the manager, was OUTSTANDING! Not a lot of hot water in the shower on the 5th floor but we did ok. There is sharp corners on the rail around the bed. We will definitely stay here each time we go back to NYC.

title: Walls too thin, otherwise very good
text:
You will hear every single word spoken in the rooms next to you.  Didn't hear any street noise from 45th - the windows and exterior walls are solid - but not the interior walls/doors.  Bed, bathroom, overall design aesthetic and service was perfect.  Except the bench provided as seating for the desk is too low - you cannot type or write comfortably with that seat.

The restaurant was exemplary and good value in this part of Manhattan.  Do skip the free continental breakfast - it was beyond terrible - use the $10 breakfast credit instead.

Wifi was superfast - 150mbps download speeds.

Hotel doesn't have a gym and oddly has no relationship with any of the gyms nearby.  The closest I found was Blink at 40 & 6 for a $15 daypass.  Equinox on 43 was $50.  

Looked like the 5th floor is adjacent to the roof deck of the bar next door - might be careful of rooms 502-3 or 602-3 in the summer - but again the exterior noise didn't seem to penetrate the room.

title: Great location & great for friends and family!
text:
This was one of the cutest most and hospitable places I have ever stayed at and that really nicely merged the New York City spirit and Irish charm. The staff was very friendly and helpful to my family and I during I incredible stay in NYC. The whole hotel was very pretty and well located next to a very nice Irish pub called Connolly's. The restaurant in the hotel was very nice and and service and food was exceptional. Overall I had an amazing stay and I hope to return to the Merrion Row Hotel again soon.

Show less

title: 5 Star boutique hotel
text:
I had a perfect stay! I arrived hours early/ my room was ready for me! My studio king was beautifully appointed, the bed was incredibly comfortable, towels, linens, robes, all new and first class. I had a delicious dinner and breakfast in the hotel atrium. The staff was really really amazing! They held the door, hailed cabs, summoned the elevator, asked if they could assist me in any way/ in short they went out of their way to make my stay comfortable and memorable. I prefer the Merrion to The Plaza any day (or night)! Thank you, Merrion staff ! i'll be back in the spring.
Paula Steele

title: A Gem in the Heart of NYC
text: We had a lovely stay at this hotel on what happened to be opening weekend. The hotel was chic and comfortable and clean. We figured there would be a few kinks to work out given that it was opening day but the staff was overly accommodating and attentive to all of our needs. We found the spaces to be charming and cozy and the restaurant area in the back was a bright and cheerful spot to enjoy breakfast. You wouldn't even know you were in NYC. We ate dinner in the restaurant and found the food on the menu appealing to both kids and adults. The Irish version of the Vongole was delicious. We could easily walk to the skating rink in Bryant Park and to shops on Fifth Avenue and Rockefeller Center and the MOMA and we were always happy to return back to our hotel. We would definitely stay here again!

title: Horrific Stay, Avoid at ALL costs.
text:
HORRIBLE HOTEL!  We stayed here in December 2018 with 5 rooms on a 2 night business trip.  The staff was very friendly and kind, that's where the good stopped.  The hotel is very pretty and nicely renovated, sure they had a nice architect... but the builder was HORRIBLE!  The hotel infrastructure and facilities are terrible!  Here are the problems:
1) the walls are paper thin.  You will hear EVERYTHING your neighbor says or does.  I was subjected to 5 hours of an extremely vulgar and offensive encounter with two people that just met on Tinder.  If you are here for business, 5 hours of this crap from 1AM-6AM is the LAST thing you want.  
2) Anytime anyone takes a shower, in any room, it sounds like there is a motorcycle in the pipes/walls.  
3) the LED panel that controls the heating does not work and is also the size of a bright ipad pointed directly at the bed.  good luck sleeping with that pointed at your face. 
4) the "Closet system", which is a freestanding tower of wood and metal has the safe on the bottom drawer, but its not bolted down to the round.  I nearly toppled it in the small room, it would kill a small child if it fell.
5) the beds have super sharp edges on the wood corners.  Tight room, night time, go to the bathroom, gash open your shin... awesome!
6) Any person walking or talking in the hallway or in any room, get ready to hear and be part of their conversation.  Not one minute of peace!!  
7) restaurant was closed due to some problem, we had to have breakfast at the Irish Pub next door.  Annoying. 
We stay in dozes of business travel rooms a year, trust me I know.  AVOID AT ALL COSTS.

title: Great location & friendly staff but a few concerns
text: Truly great location and very friendly staff. Why not a stronger review, then?  Problems I had: housecleaning staff never made it to my room even though I had vacated it from 7:00 am through 4:00 pm. It was quite disappointing not to come back to a clean room after a long day of meetings. The "complimentary" breakfast was an insult or a joke, not sure which is the better word. Three stale, processed, supermarket-quality pieces of carbohydrates and sugar and shortening -- a pastry, a croissant, and a mini-muffin that was to my tastes inedible. Questionable "resort fee", allegedly covering the breakfast, a bottle of water, and a welcome pint for 2. Of course, I was only 1 person and the purchase price of those items would probably be no more than 5 or 10 dollars, if that, not the $50+ I was forced to pay. I would have liked an in-room coffee-maker, though I wouldn't subtract any stars for that alone. I think they have some wrinkles to iron out.

title: BEST HOTEL EVER
text: All I have to say is this is the best hotel ever and the people are so nice! We had the best stay ever! I came with my Chicas and had a great time 🎄🤫🤞👍🏼🎄🎄💪🤞😑🙌🏼🎄🤫😢🙏🏻👍🏼💙🙌🏼👍🏼🎄🎄💪👍🏼🤞👍🏼🙌🏼👍🏼🙌🏼👍🏼🤞

title: Cozy Retreat in the Heart of Times Square
text: We were greeted by a very dapper doorman,  a welcoming,  personal touch more common to the upper east side than Times Square. Our King Studio room was well appointed and cheery, with a super comfy bed and sumptuous bedding! Enjoyed exploring the unique features of the hotel  - a glass domed restaurant (with retractable roof),  display of NYC bedrock and great view of the Tower 45 Sculptural Rectangles light sculpture across the street!  The staff were very friendly and attentive.

title: We were the first guests!!
text:
We checked into this fabulous property having no idea this was the grand opening - and this little Irish gem did not disappoint - down the street from our Broadway play and the linens on the bed were to die for! My daughter and I enjoyed our complimentary "welcome" pints in the adorable hotel bar - and the coffee and the complimentary continental breakfast were both wonderful. 
The staff were all so nice - and we had the good fortune to meet the owners as well - such nice people who truly cared whether we were comfortable or not. The Irish music playing was fabulous as well.
I cannot say enough about this place - great location for everything and I will stay here again definitely!!!

title: Wonderful Stay at The Marrion Row Hotel & Public House
text: A weekend with my girlfriends was made even better by the wonderful experience at this new boutique hotel on it inaugural opening. The location is perfect as it is an easy walk to broadway theaters, 5th ave shopping, Bryant Park, etc. There is a nice bar and restaurant which is a combination of Irish theme but yet very updated decor. After a busy day it is a nice to have a home away from home to relax in a friendly bar/restaurant/lounge area where the staff greets you as old friends. The rooms are very comfortable with upscale bathroom fixtures, comfortable beds and high quality linens. They offer a wonderful breakfast including a traditional Irish breakfast among many great options. I definitely will stay here again!

title: Absolutely fabulous new hotel
text: This new hotel on 45th street is a great place to stay. The staff is making a home out of a house. Exceptional that they are all so nice and willing to help you. No exceptions and the all give the idea their support is genuine. Very nice room with a comfortable bed. Nice breakfast room with a glass roof to let you know where you are eating your eggs and bacon; in the heart of New York City!

title: THE BEST!
text:
For my birthday weekend my husband (of one month) and I decided to stay here because it looked nice, had a great location, and was a good price since they were running a deal for opening weekend.  

Boy did it exceed our expectations! We loved everything about it. First off I am an interior designer based in Chicago so spaces are very important to me. I loved the boutique style this place had with the Irish charm. Almost all staff had an Irish accent so that’s cool. The staff is all so nice, accommodating, and want to get to know you. The bartenders were fun, witty and made excellent cocktails. They made me feel extra special for my birthday and you could tell they were all excited about the opening. There was a slight hold up with the elevator because it was brand new and a mix up with which room was ours and they apologized profusely, but just sent us to the bar with 2 drinks on them so we had absolutely no complaints. It was the very first day for them, but they had it all covered. 

Location is huge. It worried me to be so close to Times Square, but it was not a problem. You can easily walk in the other direction when you exit the hotel and avoid it completely. The hotel has great sound proofing as well. We were so close to 5th Avenue, Rockefeller Center, Bryant Park, Broadway shows, and not too far to Central Park. 

The rooms itself were adorable and so comfortable. They paid a lot of attention to detail, which I appreciate. The bed was VERY comfortable. I wish I could get those sheets and pillows at home. Since we were celebrating my birthday and our recent marriage they upgraded us for free to a bigger room on the top floor :) A+ 

If you are staying in New York and prefer a beautiful boutique hotel with a great location and a fun, Irish charm — STAY HERE. You will not regret it. And who doesn’t love Irish accents?!

title: Exceptional Stay
text: What a gem near Times Square! This was the best stay we’ve ever had in NYC! Hospitality was through the roof. Room size and amenities were wonderful, including continental breakfast, and the staff’s attention to detail goes unmatched. We’ll be back.

title: Amazing new boutique hotel
text:
I was lucky enough to be one of the first guests at this brand new hotel. I had high expectations and the hotel did not disappoint.  The staff was very warm and welcoming. I really appreciated the touches of Irish charm without it being cheesy (no flashing green shamrocks or leprechauns). The music in the elevator was my favorite touch. 

The rooms were extremely cozy and comfortable. The linens were top notch, I didn't want to get out of bed in the morning.   The windows were also completely soundproof, i was worried about noise being that the hotel is located so close to times square, but I slept like a baby.  

The food was also amazing, everything I tried was excellent, there's no need to go out and try the other restaurants in the area.  The bar area is perfect too, very upscale but not snobby or pretentious.  

If you're going to Broadway shows, the location could not be any better. I would definitely stay here again!

title: Unbelieveable Hotel
text:
Excellent Sevice very warm & welcoming I felt right at home , 
Bed , mattress, pillows , linens the best !!!
Food outstanding 
I will definitely return to NYC & this will be the only place I stay , will highly recommend to all friends & family .

title: Fantastic Irish Experience
text:
This wonderful cozy Botique Hotel made me feel like is was home in Ireland. The warm and caring staff treated me and my family like royalty. If I could give this lovely hotel 7 Stars I would.

I will never stay anywhere else when I visit New York City. I had a wonderful experience.

Sinecerely 
James F

title: THE BEST!
text: Honestly this place was so clean and so nice. The staff is so sweet and welcoming. My boyfriend and I stayed here because we were seeing Springsteen on Broadway, we literally felt like we were at home. Could not have asked for a better experience. I cannot wait to go back. Megan and Joe and the rest of the staff there are truly amazing! Thank you for making our trip perfect.

title: Great New Hotel and Restaurant
text:
Had dinner at the The Public House Restaurant in the new Merrion Row Hotel last night.  The place is great:  beautifully decorated with a bar/restaurant area in the back.

Food was all delicious.  Fun menu.

And great bartenders !!!!

Will definitely return

title: Don’t leave without getting breakfast!!!
text: We are the first guests of room 302! Very chic decor, very clean, cozy beds. Rooms are small, but still enough space. Staff very friendly.  Great location - perfect if you are going to see a show.  I had the best breakfast ever this morning at the restaurant inside- lemon ricotta pancakes that melted in my mouth. I would love to try dinner.  Would stay here again.
